loans.name: Yawa Domési

texts.fr:
Cette dame de 53 ans est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Pour contribuer aux besoins du ménage, elle achète et revend des boubous et foulards pour femmes.
Depuis l’an 2000 qu’elle exerce cette activité, elle achète ses boubous à Lomé et les revend sur un étal au marché local d’Adidogomé.
Aves le prêt demandé, elle compte acheter 60 boubous et 20 foulards pour satisfaire la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en:
This woman is 53 years old, married and the mother of one child. To contribute to the needs of her household, she buys and sells boubous (traditional dresses) and scarves for women. She has been involved in this work since 2000. She buys her boubous in Lomé and resells them at a stand at the local market in Adidogomé. With the loan she is requesting she plans to buy 60 boubous and 20 scarves to satisfy an ever growing demand.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy dresses and scarves

loans.name: Adán

texts.es:
El señor Adán O. esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo pagar la diferencia para que le entregaran su casa.
Esta solicitando nuevamente su cooperación para este otro préstamo, ya que le esta haciendo falta la barda alrededor de su nueva casa donde están vivienda su familia y desea que estén seguros cuando el se encuentre en su trabajo.
Planea pagar el préstamo con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo en un restauran en el área de cocinero.
texts.en:
Sr. Adán O. is grateful for the assistance he received from his previous loan, which was used to make the down payment so that he could take possession of his home.

He is seeking your cooperation again by requesting another loan. Adán needs to build a fence around his new house so that his family is protected while he is at work. He plans to repay the loan using part of the earnings that he receives working as a restaurant cook.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a fence around his house

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Mavis E. sells second hand clothing at Takoradi. Mavis has received a senior high education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter. She supports her husband in providing food, clothing and shelter for the family. Her loan will be used to buy bales of second hands clothing for sale. She hopes to use the new income from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy bales of second hand clothing

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El grupo “San I.”  nombrado así por que son originarias del Poblado San I.. Es integrado por tres mujeres. Los representa doña Aurelia L. H., tiene 5 hijos,  Doña Lilia D. L. C. I. tiene 3 hijos, tiene junto con su esposo L. venta D. pescado, además se dedica a vender productos D. catalogo marca Avon y Jafra y  bisutera enfrente D. su casa, doña María J. T. se dedica a L. crianza D. cerdos para su matanza y venta D. carne, tiene un chiquero en L. parte D. atrás D. su domicilio, comprara alimento, vitaminas y vacunas.


Doña Aurelia se dedica a L. renta D. computadoras en un local que construyó en L. parte D. arriba D.  su casa, el crédito lo utilizara para arreglar las computadoras e  impresora. Sueña con tener su local D. renta D. computadoras con más aparatos, para atender y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Además desea que sus hijos terminen una carrera universitaria para tener así un mejor nivel D. vida.


Son mujeres  muy unidas y sus actividades son diferentes, es un grupo solidario y se conocen desD. hace años.  

Agradecen el apoyo que le brinda L. Fundación y KIVA por ser considerados para poder realizar sus pequeños negocios y hacer sus sueños realidad.
texts.en:
The San I. Group is aptly named because its three members are originally from the village of San I.. Doña Aurelia L. H. has five children. Doña Lilia D. L. C. I. has three children and sells fish with her husband. She also sells Avon and Jafra products by catalog as well as costume jewelry in front of her house. Doña María J. T. raises pigs and slaughters them to sell the meat. She has a pigsty behind her house. Doña María plans to buy animal feed, vitamins, and vaccines.

Doña Aurelia has a computer rental business built above her house. Her loan will be used to repair the computers and a printer. She dreams of acquiring more devices so that she can attend to more customers and proviD. better service. Doña Aurelia wants her children to finish their university degree so that they can have a better standard of living.

The women are very close. Even though they have different business activities, they are a united group and have known each other for many years. They are grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the support they have provided and for considering them so that they can continue their small businesses and make their dreams a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for computer & printer repairs

loans.name: Quingeo (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Quingeo es un banco comunal conformado por mujeres emprendedoras  capaces de salir adelante junto a sus familias, todas   viven en la ciudad de Cuenca pero son oriundas de la parroquia Quingeo ubicada al sureste del cantón Cuenca, limita al norte con la parroquia Santa Ana, al sur con la parroquia San José de Raranga del cantón Sígsig, al este con la parroquia Ludo del cantón Sígsig y, al oeste con las parroquias Cumbe y Tarqui.  La población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería con el cultivo de maíz, papas, fréjol y cebada, la floristería es una actividad nueva y lucrativa. La ganadería tiene su importancia en la zona baja especialmente por la producción lechera.  De aquí la población masculina en edad de trabajar se traslada a la ciudad de Cuenca  ocupándose como obreros de la construcción, en menor escala como obreros de fábricas, talleres artesanales de diferente tipo y en otras actividades comerciales y de servicios de transporte  un buen porcentaje de mujeres se ocupan en el servicio doméstico.

Rosa B. vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca pero es oriunda de la parroquia Quingeo  migró a esta  ciudad en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo y para salir adelante con su familia, ella tiene 22 años es soltera y vive con sus padres, ayuda muy poco para los gastos del hogar ya que deben pagar arriendo  pero en su comunidad si  cuentan con su casa propia.

Rosa vende verduras hace tres años en el mercado de la feria libre,  labora los días miércoles, viernes, sábados y domingos desde las 5 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. y los demás días se dedica a la limpieza de casas desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m., se encuentra en su segundo ciclo, con su nuevo crédito invertirá en la compra de tomate, cebolla, pimiento, zanahoria, acelga y mas verduras para continuar con su negocio siendo su meta ampliar con otros productos y dar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes.

La señora  Lilia Jiménez es una socia luchadora y siempre se encuentra en la búsqueda de mejores días, se dedica a la venta de aretes, moños, binchas, etc., actividad que realiza hace 9 años laborando en el mercado 10 de Agosto tiene un puesto propio y sus hijos son quienes le ayudan a vender su mercadería, trabaja de 8 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m. de domingo a domingo.

Lilia tiene 39 años vive en unión libre y fruto de su unión ha concebido 3 hijos de 19, 11 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo le ayuda en el negocio,  sus dos  hijos pequeños  estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo labora como taxista y como no tienen  casa propia viven arrendando. Este es su primer crédito gracias a la invitación de una amiga a formar parte de este equipo de mujeres trabajadoras, con el dinero que reciba comprará aretes, vinchas, moños, ligas, chunchis, etc.  para abastecer su negocio.

Su meta es  comprarse un auto.
texts.en:
Quingeo is a community bank made up of entrepreneurial women willing and able to help their families get ahead in life. The women live in the town of Cuenca but are natives of Quingeo parish located to the south-east of the canton of Cuenca. To the north is the parish of Santa Ana, to the south the parish of San José de Raranga of Sígsig canton, and to the west the parishes of Cumbe and Tarqui. Most of the inhabitants work in agriculture and cattle raising, but as well they grow corn, potatoes, beans and barley. Growing flowers is a new and lucrative venture. Cattle raising is important in the lower areas especially for the production of milk. As soon as boys reach working age, they move to Cuenca to take up jobs as construction workers, or as factory workers, artisans of different types, or in various business or transportation ventures. A good number of the women have jobs as domestic servants. Rosa B. lives on the outskirts of Cuenca but is a native of Quingeo parish. She moved to the city in search of better work opportunities and to help her family get ahead. She is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She contributes very little to household expenses as they have to pay rent, but back in their community they own their own house. Rosa has been selling vegetables for three years in the Feria Libre market. She works on Wednesdays, Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays from 5am to 6pm. The other days she cleans houses from 7am to 5pm. This is Rosa’s second loan cycle and she wishes to use the money to buy tomatoes, onions, peppers, carrots, chard, and other vegetables for her business. Her goal is to expand into other products and thus improve service to her customers. Señora Lilia Jiménez is an entreprising member of the group who is always seeking a better life. She sells earrings, hair accessories, head bands etc., work she’s been doing for nine years. She has her own stall in the 10 de Agosto market where her children also help to sell the merchandise. She works from 8am to 2pm, seven days a week. Lilia is 39 years old and lives with her partner. They have three children aged 19, 11, and 7. Her oldest son helps with the business, and the two younger children attend school in the town. Her husband is a taxi driver. As they do not own a house, they live in rented accommodation. This is Lilia’s first loan. She was invited to join this team of hardworking women by a friend. With the money she will buy earrings, hair accessories, buttons, etc to better stock her business. Her goal is to buy a vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy vegetables and hair accessories

loans.name: Brenda Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Brenda Janeth V. está muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito con el cual pudo dar la diferencia que le faltaba para que le entregaran su vivienda, don están viviendo ella y sus hijos.
Solicita nuevamente un préstamo para poder construir un cuarto de madera ya que la casa es pequeña y no hay suficiente espacio para los niños. Ya que le están pidiendo su propio espacio en la casa.
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo en una fabrica en el departamento de producción.
texts.en:
Brenda Janeth V. is very appreciative of the help provided to her with the previous loan, which allowed her to make the difference she needed to acquire her home, where she is now living with her children. She is currently requesting another loan in order to build an additional room out of wood. The house is small and there is not enough space for the children; they have been asking her for their own space in the house. She plans to repay the loan with the income she receives from her work in the production department of a factory.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building an additional room out of wood

loans.name: Cumbre Del Sol Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio Loma de la cuidad de Caacupé, en este comité cada integrante cuenta con un actividad productiva y que le genere ingreso.
Las integrantes se sienten seguras trabajando en sus propios negocios, lo que comercialmente realizan les ayudan al sustento familiar, para el mejor de sus respectivos negocios ellas reciben la capacitación de las asesoras y de manera cada una realiza una buena planificación.
La señora Norma se dedica a la venta de dulces, y con este negocio ella obtiene buenos ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Ella para elaborar los dulces compra las pulpas de frutas y otros ingredientes que se agregan en el preparado.
Por la calidad de sus productos ya tiene clientes seguros  y vende todo lo que prepara.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por la ayuda crediticia que les brinda.
texts.en:
The women who belong to the group live in the Loma neighborhood in the city of Caacupé. Each of the members of the group has a productive activity that she uses to generate her own income. The members feel confident running their own businesses, since their businesses help them to support their families. They have all received training from financial advisors in order to improve their respective businesses, and each of them has created a good business plan. Norma, for example, makes a living selling sweets, and this business has allowed her to earn a decent income to help her family. She makes the sweets by purchasing fruit pulp and other ingredients and mixing them together. Norma has many reliable customers because of the quality of her products, and she always sells all of the sweets that she prepares. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the credit help they have offered her.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing raw ingredients such as a large quantity of sugar and pulp from various fruits.

loans.name: Roselfina

texts.es: Roselfina, de  29 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 5 años trabaja en el  campo, además tiene vacas y una  granja de cuyes. Todas las mañanas sin excepción  cuida y alimenta sus animales con bastante dedicación, pues las ganancias de la comercialización y producción  de sus animales es bastante rentable .Al día Roselfina puede extraer de 10 a 12 litros de leche, además su granja de cuyes esta en aumento y los vende casi todos los días. Paralelamente se dedica al cuidado de sus tierras de cultivo, en esta temporada  esta sembrando pastizales de alfalfa que son indispensables para  la alimentación de sus animales.Es la octava vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será muy responsable con sus pagos,  también agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo pues  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Roselfina utilizará el dinero en la compra de más animales como cerdos y ovejas, para engordarlos y luego comercializarlos.
texts.en:
Roselfina, age 29, lives with her husband and 3 children in a house that they own. For the past 5 years, she has worked in agriculture. She also keeps cows and raises guinea pigs. Every morning, without exception, she feeds and cares for her animals with great dedication, since the income from their production and sale provides her with good profits. Each day, Roselfina's cows produce 10 to 12 liters of milk. Her guinea pig business is also expanding, with sales nearly every day. Parallel to this, she also cultivates her agricultural lands. During this season, she is planting fields of alfalfa, which is indispensable for her animals. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. She would like to thank all of the people who made the loan possible, since it will be very useful to her in developing her business. Roselfina will use the funds to buy more animals, such as pigs and sheep, to fatten and sell.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying more animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys D. is a widow and has four children. Gladys sells canned fish, meat and tomatoes at Takoradi. She has received a junior high education. Gladys uses the income she earns from her sales to take care of her four children.  Gladys will use the loan to purchase other canned foods to sell to meet the demands of her customers.  Gladys plans to use the new profits from her expanded business for her family's expenses.

loans.use: To purchase other canned foods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying fabrics, thread and buttons

loans.name: Abla Ama

texts.fr:
Cette femme est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle s’est spécialisée dans le commerce des vêtements pour enfants.
Elle exerce cette activité depuis 6 ans. Les marchandises proviennent de la Chine et elle les acquiert auprès des grossistes sur place. Elle les revend ensuite dans sa boutique au grand marché de Lomé.
L’objet de ce crédit est l’achat de nouveaux stocks de vêtements pour enfants pour réapprovisionner sa boutique.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of three children. She specializes in selling children’ clothing. She has been doing it for six years. The merchandise arrives from China, and she purchases it from local wholesalers. She then resells it at her store at the big market of Lomé. The purpose of this credit is to purchase a new supply of children’s clothing in order to restock her store.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing clothes and scarves [for resale]

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 35 años, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo se llama Cheng Yostin de 3 años, juntos viven en su casa propia.  Ella es una muy emprendedora, que no conoce obstáculos pues asegura que con voluntad lo puede conseguir todo. Hace mas de 8 años trabaja como docente de nivel inicial pero también se dedica al bordado y tejido con bastidor (madera larga de metro y medio que estira la tela), además de la costura de prendas de vestir. Por lo general en épocas festivas es cuando tiene más pedido de su trabajo además lo realiza sola sin ayuda de nadie. Disfruta mucho el tener que combinar los colores de hilos en los bordados y que estos sean muy llamativos. Sin embargo el tener que poner toda su atención hace que se esfuerce la vista y con el paso del tiempo se esta perjudicando. Pero para ella todo esfuerzo es recompensado, ya que cada metro de tela que es bordada, cobra la suma de S/. 350.00 nuevos soles, esta ganancia económica le permite ahorrar para desarrollar sus planes futuros, pues Teresa desea instalar una tienda de comestibles grande dentro de su vivienda. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y como ya conoce la metodología de trabajo de su grupo  comunal se siente más tranquilo y seguro, el saber que pertenecer a un grupo muy bien conformado donde prima el respeto y la responsabilidad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará telas tipo paño, agujas, hilos de color, para bordar hermosas polleras (faldas con diversos dibujos).
texts.en:
Teresa is 35 years old. She is a single mother, with a 3-year-old son named Cheng Yostin. She and her child live together in her own house. Teresa is a very enterprising woman who does not recognize obstacles, because she is confident that if she has the will, she can achieve anything. More than 8 years ago, she began working as a kindergarten teacher, but she also worked in embroidery and weaving on a bastidor (a wooden frame 1.5 meters long which stretches the fabric), as well as sewing clothing. In general, she receives the highest volume of orders for her work during holiday seasons. She does all the work alone, without help from anyone. She very much enjoys choosing the color combinations for the embroidery threads, making sure that they are striking and attractive. However, having to concentrate on this work has required to strain her eyes and has affected her vision over time. Still, she finds that all of her effort brings rewards, since for every meter of fabric she embroiders, she receives 350 Peruvian new soles. This economic gain allows her to save up to implement her plans for the future; Teresa would like to set up a large food store within her home. This is her third loan with MFP, and since she is already familiar with the way her communal bank operates, she feels more secure and tranquil, knowing that she belongs to an excellent group in which respect and responsibility come first. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy more pieces of fabric, needles and colorful thread to create beautiful polleras (skirts with a variety of embroidered figures).

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabric, needles and colored thread

loans.name: Josiane

texts.fr: Née en Avril 1977, Z. Josiane est mariée à KILAYOSSI Rubin, un conducteur de taxi-auto. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et qui vivent ensemble avec leur parents. Il y a deux ans environs que la famille s'est installée au quartier Avotrou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Josiane vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges familiales, grâce au revenu de son activité. Josiane n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Il y a près de quatre ans que Josiane mène comme activité, la vente d'oignons et aussi de lubrifiants au quartier N'Vènamédé à Cotonou. Josiane s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Josiane a déjà obtenu deux prêts de ALIDé, prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Josiane désire agrandir davantage son activité et mieux faire face aux différentes exigences de sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Josiane sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième pêt.
texts.en:
Born in April 1977, Josiane Z. is married to Rubin Kilayossi, a taxi driver. They have four children, all of whom live with their parents and go to school. About two years ago, the family settled in the Avotrou district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Josiane helps her husband support the family, thanks to the income from her enterprise. Joisane finished only primary school. She has been selling onions and automotive lubricants in the N’Vènamede district of Cotonou for almost four years. Josiane purchases her stock in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Josiane already had two previous loans from ALIDé, both of which were duly repaid. Josiane would like to expand her business and better meet the diverse needs of her clients. This is why she is seeking a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing bags of onions and cartons of motor oil [for resale]

loans.name: Loubaboutou

texts.fr:
Cette femme, née en 1980 est revendeuse d’articles électroménagers.  Elle est mariée sans enfant.
Elle expose ses différents articles (ventilateurs, lecteur DVD) dans sa boutique située à ADIDOGOME.
Elle cumule près de 08 ans dans cette activité. Le crédit sollicité sera essentiellement destiné à l’achat de ventilateurs, lecteurs DVD et divers articles électroménagers.
Elle espère grâce à ce nouveau crédit accroitre sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en:
Loubaboutou A. was born in 1980 and is a reseller of electrical appliances. She is married and without children. She displays her various products ( fans, DVD players ) in her shop localed in Adidogome. Loubaboutou has worked at this business for 8 years. This loan will be used primarily to buy fans, DVD players and various electrical appliances. She hopes that this new loan will provide additional profits.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of fans DVD players, and various electrical appliances

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es: María Concepción L. reside en Puerto el triunfo, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután, vive junto a sus tres hijos de 15,13 y 12 años de edad. María posee un comedor en el cual se encarga de hacer desayunos y almuerzos, los cuales  comercializa en el mercado municipal de Usulután en donde vende sus platillos con los otros vendedores del lugar. Este negocio es muy importante para ella, debido a que representa la única fuente de trabajo el cual le permite sacar a delante a sus hijos por ella sola, ya que no recibe la ayuda de nadie más. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, quien se esfuerza a diario para brindarle, ropa, techo, alimento y educación a sus tres hijos, los cuales son el mayor incentivo para seguir luchando. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar todo los elementos necesarios para elaborar más alimentos, ingredientes como: vegetales, verduras, granos básicos, frutas y otros más. De esta forma ella espera poder mejorar su negocio de manera que pueda atender a más clientes, y así mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María Concepción L. lives in Puerto El Triunfo, located in the Usulután department. She lives with her 3 children, aged 15, 13 and 12 years. María has an eatery where she makes breakfasts and lunches that she sells in the municipal market of Usulután, where she sells her dishes with the other merchants in the market. This business is very important for her, since it is her only source of work that allows her to help her children get ahead, since they do not receive help from anyone else. She is a very responsible and hardworking woman, who makes a daily effort to provide clothing, shelter, food and education for her 3 children, who are her main incentive to keep going. María requests a loan so that she can buy all of the items necessary to make more dishes, ingredients such as: vegetables, staple grains, fruit and others. In this way she hopes to improve her business so that she can have more customers and increased earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make meals

location.town: Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Elvio

texts.es:
Elvio tiene 23 años, es soltero, vive el barrio San Francisco de la ciudad de Caacupe con sus padres. 
Es comerciante desde hace más de 4 años, se dedica a la venta de ropas en forma ambulante, realizando sus ventas y cobranzas en una motocicleta que adquirió gracias al esfuerzo y dedicación que le imprime a su actividad, cuenta con clientela formada con aproximadamente 100 clientes, quienes constantemente acuden a él para solicitarle algún tipo de prenda de vestir que está acorde a la moda ó el gusto de cada uno de ellos.
Con los préstamos que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo renovar su stock para estar acorde a la estación entrante (otoño, invierno), entre otros productos para poder hacer frente a los numerosos pedidos que tenia.
texts.en:
Elvio is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the San Francisco neighborhood in the city of Caacupe. He has worked in retail trade for more than 4 years; he sells door-to-door, making his sales and collections using a motorcycle that he acquired through the effort and dedication that he has put into his business. He has a regular customer base of about 100 customers, who constantly look to him to request some type of garment that is in fashion or in accordance with their tastes. With the loans that he has taken from the Fundación Paraguaya, he was able to renew his inventory with garments appropriate for the coming season (fall, winter), and buy products to fill the numerous orders that he had.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy jackets, sweatshirts, pants, sweaters and other cold weather clothing

loans.name: Afiwavi Anastasie

texts.fr:
Cette dame a 37 ans, elle est marié et a un enfant. Pour participer aux charges de sa famille elle fait le commerce de détail de  bijoux, sacs, pagnes, ustensiles de cuisine et basins.
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé auprès des grossistes. elle revend ensuite ces articles sur un étal en face de l’Institut  Goethe de Lomé.
Le crédit demandé servira à l’achat de 16 pièces de pagnes de haute qualité pour attirer plus de clients.
texts.en:
This lady is 37 years old, and is married with one child. In order to contribute to her family's expenses, she sells jewelery, bags, pagnes [traditional, sarong-like wraparounds], kitchenware and bowls. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers at the large market in Lomé. She then sells her goods from a stall across from the Goethe-Institut in Lomé. The loan requested will help purchase 16 pieces of high-quality pagne in order to attract more clients.

Translated from French by Jessalyn Pinneo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pagne cloth

loans.name: María Elisa

texts.es: María Elisa V. M. de 35 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, un señor muy responsable y trabajador quien desea todo lo mejor para su familia, así mismo vive junto a sus 3 hijos el mayor de 11 años de edad, y los menores los cuales son gemelos de 2 años de edad. María Elisa se dedica a la venta de pescado seco, el cual es una comida muy típica salvadoreña, y la cual sobretodo en esta zona se vende muy bien y cuenta con una alta demanda. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de pescado seco, así mismo comprar otro tipo de mariscos como camarones y pescado fresco, por esta razón ella solicita el préstamo a Integral ya que para invertir en el negocio debe contar con el dinero ya que sus compras son al contado. María Elisa es una mujer muy emprendedora quien cuenta con muchas metas, una de esas es la de mejorar su negocio ya que solo de esta manera ella podrá ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo mejor.
texts.en:
María Elisa V. M. is 35 years old. She lives in the department of Usulután. She lives with her husband, a responsible and hardworking man who wants the best for his family. She also lives with her 3 children. The oldest is 11 and the youngest are 2 year old twins. María Elisa sells dried fish, a traditional Salvadoran food. It sells especially well in this area and is in high demand. She is asking for a loan with which she can have enough money to buy other types of seafood such as shrimp and fresh fish. This is why she is asking Integral for the loan to invest in the business. She must have the money because she has to pay for her purchases up front. María Elisa is a very enterprising woman who has a lot of goals. One of these is to improve her business since this way she can help her family and give them the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase different types of seafood.

loans.name: Chérifatou Gambi

texts.fr:
Cette femme âgée de 35 ans, est mariée sans enfant. Elle est revendeuse de boubous.
Elle exerce cette activité depuis 2005 et  maitrise  ses différents contours. 
Ses boubous, elle les achète sur place à Lomé et les revend en détail au grand marché de Lomé.
Le crédit actuellement sollicité sera entièrement consacré à l’achat de 10 douzaines de boubous pour les besoins de la clientèle.
texts.en:
This woman, age 35, is married with no children. She is a retailer of boubous [traditional flowing, wide-sleeved robes]. She has been conducting this business since 2005 and is mastering its ins and outs. She buys her boubous on site in Lomé and sells them at retail price in the large market in Lomé. The loan currently being sought will be fully devoted to the purchase of 10 dozen boubous for the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Jessalyn Pinneo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying boubous [traditional flowing, long-sleeved robes]

loans.name: María

texts.es: María S. O. de 60 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora, la cual día con día se esfuerza por salir adelante y mejorar en todo lo que sea posible. Vive junto a su esposo, su hija y dos nietos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. María posee una tienda en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad como: agua embotellada, gas propano, pan, leche y otros más, la tienda se encuentra ubicada en su casa de habitación la cual se encuentra en Santa María, en el departamento de Usulután. Desde hace 5 años que María cuenta con este negocio, el cual poco a poco ha ido sacando adelante surtiéndolo con lo que ha sido posible para ella, ya que esto es bastante difícil, ya que la mayoría de las ganancias son destinadas a los gastos familiares. Es por esta razón que María solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos comestibles, así mismo productos los cuales sean de primera necesidad para el hogar. María es alguien quien sueña con mejorar su condición económica, es por esto que espera mejorar mucho su negocio.
texts.en:
María S. O. is 60 years old. She is a hardworking woman who works day to day to get ahead and improve in every way possible. She lives with her husband, her daughter and her two minor grandchildren, who are in school. María has a store where she sells basic products such as: bottled water, propane gas, bread, milk, and more. The store is located in her house, which is in Santa María, in the department of Usulután. Maria has had this business for five years. She has gotten it ahead little by little, diversifying it as much as she has been able, since it is very difficult. Most of the profits are used for family expenses. This is the reason that María is asking for a loan from Integral through which she can buy a greater quantity of edible products, and items that are basic necessities for the home. María is someone who dreams of improving her economic condition, and that is why she is hoping to much improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perishable items.

loans.name: Achille

texts.fr: Né en 1975 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, T. Achille est marié à ATTIVI SOKLA Julienne, une revendeuse. Il y a près de neuf ans que Achille vit au quartier Agbalilamè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Achille  vit dans ce quartier avec sa femme et ses enfants. Achille a en effet, trois enfants, dont deux sont scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Achille a très peu fréquenté. Achille est un peintre. En plus de cette activité qu'il exerce depuis sept ans environs, Achille vend également des peintures à Cotonou. Achille achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à la SOBEPEC (une société de peinture au Bénin). Achille a déjà obtenu deux prêts de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter le stock de ses produits, pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Achille sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Born in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital, in 1975, Achille T. is married to Julienne Attivi Sokla, a retailer. Achille has lived in the Agbalilamè district, in the town of Sèmè-Podji, for nearly nine years. He lives in this area with his wife and his children. Indeed, Achille has three children, two of whom are in school. Together, the couple provides for the various family expenses. Achille himself received very little schooling. Achille is a painter. In addition to this business that he has run for approximately seven years, he also sells paint in Cotonou. Achille buys his supplies in Dantokpa, Benin's international market, and also at SOBEPEC (a painting society in Benin). Achille has already received two loans from ALIDé, and has fully repaid them both. With the intention of building his business and increasing his stock, in order to better accommodate his customers, Achille is seeking another loan.

Translated from French by Jessalyn Pinneo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying jars of paint

loans.name: Yako Adjoyo

texts.fr:
Cette dame est âgée de 30 ans. Elle fait le commerce d’articles bureautiques et divers.
Son activité se déroule au sein de sa boutique dénommée Ets Yolande. Elle y vend des cartouches pour imprimante, photocopieuse. Elle associe à cette activité, la photocopie de documents aux particuliers et diverses institutions du quartier.  
Le prêt demandé sera utilisé pour l’achat de 03 cartouches de carbone et de 02 cartons de papeteries.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is 30 years old. She does commerce in office supplies and a variety of items. Her business takes place in her store called Ets Yolande. There, she sells cartridges for photocopy printers. She includes with this business the photocopying of documents for individuals and various institutions in the district. The loan requested will be used for buying three toner cartridges and two boxes of stationary. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying office items and more

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida N. is a hairdresser and sells wigs, weave-ons, shampoo and other hair products at Takoradi. She is married and has a child. She has been through junior high school. Her husband is a teacher.  Vida uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of the home.  Vida will use the loan to buy more hair products like creams and wigs for sale and also for use at her saloon. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vida plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more hair products

loans.name: Los Ideales Group

texts.es:
Yanet Hernández Vázquez, ella cuenta con  25 años de edad, curso la carrera de Leyes  por cuatro años en la universidad GUABJO; en el estado de Oaxaca.
 Vive  en la comunidad de San Felipe Jalapa de Díaz, es madre soltera de su pequeña hija Kimberly, vive en casa de sus padres, su madre ama de casa y su padre dedicado al campo al igual que sus 3 hermanos; dos de ellos trabajan y uno sigue estudiando. La  casa donde vive es pequeña.  
 Debido a la escasez de recursos con la que se cuenta en esa comunidad sus padres no pudieron seguir ayudándola con sus estudios, así que no logro titularse. Pero busco una forma de conseguir sus propios ingresos. Y es así como decidió poner su negocio.
El grupo fue formado por doña Carmen  que cuenta con un restaurante en la comunidad de los ideales, es así como Yanet al igual que los otros 9 integrantes pudieron ingresar y formar el grupo , que estará empezando su primer ciclo. 
El grupo fue denominado LOS IDEALES, la palabra que muy a parte de ser denominado asi su lugar de residencia, significa para ellos metas, objetivos, perseguir sueños que un día gracias al esfuerzo de cada uno y al apoyo de instituciones de prestamos lograran ver cumplidos.
Yanet solicito el préstamo para invertir en un negocio que ya tenia desde hace varios meses y que junto con su hermano han mantenido hasta ahora. Ella no cuenta con un local establecido, pero su negocio se concentra en el interior de su vivienda.
Invertirá el préstamo en la compra de 100 crías de pollitos, considerando que hasta ahora cuenta con 50 pollos listos para su venta.  También invertirá en la compra de alimento para hacer crecer a los animales  lo que pronto será su fuente de ingreso, incluso tendrá más recurso para seguir creciendo. 
Pero ella aparte de criar y vender pollos cuenta con dos actividades mas, que demuestran el verdadero interés de esta joven por ser mejor cada día.
Ella hace aretes, pulseras y collares de piedras y frijoles  de colores. Los vende de casa en casa con las amistades y conocidas de la comunidad, ella se surte cada mes de este material para la elaboración de los mismos en el estado de Oaxaca, con lo que gana se ayuda para invertir en cualquiera de sus negocios.
Ella cuenta también con una tienda de abarrotes que se encuentra ubicado a 15 minutos de su casa en una comunidad llamada Piedra de Amolar, aunque su negocio es pequeño siempre trata de tenerlo surtido ya que es una de las pocas tiendas con  las que cuentan los habitantes.
Ella desea tener su propio hogar en donde pueda crecer su hija, darle una comodidad aparte de lo que para ella es esencial el estudio con lo cual pueda sentirse orgullosa de ver fructífero sus esfuerzos y que mejor viéndolo en el desarrollo intelectual de su familia. Así mismo seguir manteniendo como hasta ahora sus pequeños negocios y hacerlos crecer. 
El grupo esta conformado por  7 mujeres y 3 hombres :
La Sra. María del carmen que invertirá en mobiliario nuevo para acondicionar su restaurante, la Sra. Kicsia Irais que utilizara el préstamo para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de antojitos, la Sra. Jazmín que comprara mas pares de zapatos, para vender con las amistades. La señora Cecilia que utilizara el préstamo para comprar mas cerdos y así criarlos para después revenderlos en las carnicerías, el joven Otilio que comprara pollos para su crianza y posteriormente su venta. La señora Reyna que comprara telas e hilos para realizar su oficio de costurera. La señora Nallely que iniciara su negocio con la venta de abarrotes la cual con el préstamo a otorgar surtirá su tienda de artículos de primera necesidad, el señor Moisés que comprara telas, hilos y manta para seguir bordando sus prendas artesanales, el señor Rogelio que surtirá su tienda de arroz, frijol, azúcar, galletas y artículos de limpieza.
A todos esto ellos agradecen saber que ahí gente como FUNDACION REALIDAD y junto con ellos otras instituciones  que puedan ayudar a la gente necesitada y ver como ellos también pueden crecer, y así mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Yanet Hernández Vázquez, 25, pursued a law degree for four years in UABJO University, in the state of Oaxaca. She lives San Felipe Jalapa de Díaz in her parents’ small house. She is a single mom of one daughter, Kimberly. Her mother is a housewife and her father works in farming, along with Yanet’s three brothers. Because of the scarcity of resources in the community, her parents could not continue supporting her in her studies, so she never earned her degree. For this reason, she decided to look for a way to earn money, and started her business. Carmen, who has a restaurant in the community of Los Ideales, formed the group. Yanet and the other nine members joined her in forming the group, which is now beginning its first loan cycle. The group is named Los Ideales which, aside from being the name of the community, signifies for them, goals, objectives, and following dreams that one day, thanks to the efforts of each member and the help of loan institutions, will be fulfilled. Yanet needed this loan to invest in a business that she has run for a few months with her brother. She does not have an established location, but works from her home. She will invest the loan in the purchase of 100 young chicks, as she now has 50 that are ready for sale. She will also buy feed for the chicks and have a little left over to continue growing. Aside from the raising and selling of chicks, Yanet has two other business activities, which demonstrates her entrepreneurial spirit. She makes earrings, bracelets, and necklaces from stones and colored beans. She sells these from house to house among her friends and acquaintances in the community. She stocks up on materials for the jewelry each month in the state of Oaxaca, and she re-invests her earnings back into one of her businesses. Yanet also has a small grocery store located 15 minutes from her home in the community of Piedra de Amolar. Although this business is small, she tries to keep it stocked, as it is one of the few stores available for the residents of this town. Yanet would like to have her own house in which to raise her daughter and give her a place to study, something she considers essential. She also wants to continue maintaining and enlarging her small businesses. The Los Ideales group is made up of seven women and three men. María del Carmen will invest in new furniture for her restaurant. Kicsia Irais will use her loan money to buy ingredients for the making of snacks. Jazmín will buy shoes to sell. Cecilia will buy young pigs to raise and resell to butcher shops. Otilio will buy young chicks to raise and resell. Reyna will buy cloth for her tailoring business. Nallely will use the loan to stock her general store. Moisés will buy cloth, and thread for making aprons. Rogelio will stock his general store with rice, beans, sugar, cookies, and cleaning products. All the members are grateful to know that organizations like Fundacion Realidad are there to help them grow and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Jewelry making supplies and stock for general store

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés es un hombre risueño y bastante empeñoso en sus labores, tiene 56 años, casado con Alejandrina de 46 años, con quien tiene 5 hijos pero sólo vive con tres, en su casa propia. Sus hijos siempre fueron el motor de su vida, por ellos venció todos los obstáculos que se le presentaron en el camino, desde entonces lleva más de 10 años dedicándose al cultivo de café y plátano en compañía de su esposa. Dentro de su actividad, le agrada aplicar abono a sus cafetales, eso le ayuda a preveer que tan productiva será su cosecha, sin embargo el costo alto de este producto no  logra ganar lo espera, pero al menso recupera la inversión. Con el tiempo espera incrementar sus plantaciones hasta llegar a ser el productor de café más reconocido de su localidad y convertirse en un comerciante mayorista. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y sabe que es gracias al trabajo conjunto que desempeño junto a los integrantes de su grupo comunal en donde fueron puntuales en cada pago, creando así un buen historial crediticio. Con los dos mil quinientos soles que solicita, comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes, además contratará operarios para que se encarguen de la limpieza de sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Andrés is a cheerful man, and he is very hard-working. He is 56 years old, and he is married to 46 year old Alejandrina. They have five children, but they only live with three of them in his own house. His children were always the impetus of his life. For them he overcame all obstacles that presented themselves along the way. For over ten years he and his wife have been growing coffee and bananas. He likes to apply fertilizer to his coffee fields because it helps the productivity of his crop. However, with the high cost of this product, he did not earn what he had hoped to. But, a least he recovered his investment. In time he plans to increase his planting until he comes to be the most recognized coffee producer in his area. He will become a wholesale merchant. This is his third loan with MFP. He knows that it is thanks to the way the members of his communal bank work together, making their payments punctually, that they have a good credit history. He will use the requested 2,500 PEN to buy several bags of fertilizer. He will also hire workers to clean his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of fertilizer and hire workers to help clean his fields

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, de 57 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a las tareas del campo, junto con su familia. Y en la actualidad trabaja activamente en estas labores, cultiva maca (raíz con propiedades curativas) y papa (tubérculo peruano), además cría diversos animales, pero sobretodo la alpaca, pues es la adecuada para el tipo de clima  de la comunidad donde vive. Diariamente lleva a pastear a sus alpacas en las amplias planicies de su tierra natal, luego comercializa la lana que trasquila de sus animales, y obtiene regulares ganancias; en ocasiones también vende su carne. Las cosechas de sus productos también los comercializa, sobre todo la maca que le trae mayores ganancias. Para el futuro tiene planes de aumentar la  cantidad de sus animales y también desea sembrar en mayor cantidad.Es la quinta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete será muy responsable con sus pagos, además agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Antonio invertirá el dinero solicitado en  pagar  a ayudantes   para sus cosechas, y también comprará medicinas que necesita para sus alpacas.
texts.en:
Antonio is 57 years old, and lives with his wife and three children in a house that he owns. Ever since he was very young, he has worked in the fields with his family. Nowadays he grows maca (a root with curative properties) and papa (a Peruvian tuber). He also raises various animals, above all alpacas which are the best suited to the climate where he lives. Every day he takes his alpacas to graze in the ample plains of his homeland, and he regularly shears and sells their wool for profit. Sometimes he also sells their meat. He also sells the harvests from his crop, from which the maca is the most profitable. His plans for the future include increasing both the number of animals he raises, and the number of plants that he sows. This is Antonio's fifth loan with MFP, and he promises to be very responsible with his payments. He also wishes to thank everyone who has made possible this loan, which will be very useful for the further progress of his business. Antonio will use the requested money to pay farmhands to help in his fields, and to buy medicines for his alpacas.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medicine for his alpacas and pay farmhands.

loans.name: Assoupi

texts.fr:
Cette femme de 31 ans est très dynamique. Infirmière de profession, pour faciliter l’accès aux populations de base, elle est aussi revendeuse de produits pharmaceutiques. 
Pour les besoins de son activité, elle a aménagé une boutique dénommée Jehovah Rapha où elle sert les produits pharmaceutiques aux habitants du quartier.
Le présent crédit est destiné à l’achat de 03 cartons de produits pour répondre plus promptement aux besoins sanitaires des populations.
texts.en:
This 31-year-old woman is very energetic. A nurse by profession, she is also a retailer of pharmaceuticals in order to facilitate access for people. For business reasons, she has fixed up a shop called Jehovah Rapha, where she provides pharmaceutical products to the residents of the district. The present loan is for buying three boxes of these products to respond promptly to the health needs of the people.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El sr Juan C. está casado con la Sra. Ilsa Sanguina de C. tienen dos hijos y viven en la Atyra, el Sr. Juan posee una parada de  moto taxi  en el cruce Tobati.
Su actividad consiste en ayudar a gente que desciende del bus llevando sus bolsas o acercar a la gente hasta su casa.
Este trabajo resulta bastante bien y quiere invertir en la compra de otra moto taxi y trabajar con un socio, para concretar este proyecto solicita el préstamo.
El sr Juan empezó con una unidad su trabajo y desea seguir creciendo para obtener más ingreso y así dar una vida digna a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan C. is married to Mrs. Ilsa Sanguina de C., they have two children and live in Atyra. Juan owns a motorcycle taxi stand at the Tobati crossroads. His work consists of helping people who get off the bus with their bags, or taking people to their houses. This business has worked well, and he wants to buy another motorcycle taxi and work with a partner, which is why he is requesting this loan. Juan started with only one motorcycle, and he wants to keep growing in order to make more income and give his family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en: Jeneba B. trades in various commodities such as cosmetics, provisions, and cigarettes. Her business is located in the eastern part of the city. She is a widow with three children and also has two relatives living with her. Jeneba's business has struggled over the years from the lack of adequate capital. She is therefore asking for a loan in order to buy more goods which will eventually grow her capital. She hopes to use proceeds from the loan to care for her children and save for the future construction of her house. She is a client with very good repayment history.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia tiene una tienda de golosinas, en un local alquilado que esta ubicado cerca del mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus ventas son al por mayor y menor, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima y también de algunos distribuidores locales, actividad que realiza todos los días. Aurelia es conviviente y tiene un hijo, viven en casa propia, por lo que sueña tener una casa propia y también ampliar con otro local.
Aurelia es socia del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi que significa Piedra Nueva, y necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas de diferentes marcas.
texts.en:
Aurelia runs a candy shop in a rented space that is located near the wholesale food market in the city of Ayacucho. Her purchases are both wholesale and retail, and she daily acquires her products in Lima and from various local distributors. Aurelia lives in her own house with her partner and her son. She dreams of owning her own store and of expanding to another location. Aurelia is a member of the Musuq Rumi (New Rock) Communal Bank, and needs a loan of 1200 soles, which she will use to buy various brands of soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various brands of soft drinks.

loans.name: Ayao

texts.fr: ce monsieur est âgé de 33 ans, il est un responsable de famille avec un enfant à sa charge et une femme qui est revendeuse de produits génériques. il fait ce commerce depuis 2009. il s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé dans une boutique. il fait face en une rupture de stock, pour éviter cela et bien satisfaire ses clients, il sollicite de WAGES un prêt pour l'achat de divers produits d'alimentation générale. C'est avec le revenu de son activité qu'il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who is 33 years old. He is the head of household with one child to support and a wife who is a retailer of generic products. He has been operating his business since 2009 and stocks up from a store at the big market of Lomé. He is facing shortages. To prevent this and to satisfy his customers, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy various grocery items. With the revenues from his business, he provides for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grocery items

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, A. S. Julienne est mariée à TOFFA Achille, un peintre. Le couple a trois enfants, dont deux sont scolarisés. Tous les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents au quartier Agbalilamè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Il y a plus de neuf ans que Julienne vit dans ce quartier avec sa famille. Julienne vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les charges familiales, grâce au revenu que lui apporte son activité. Julienne vend en effet de l’huile végétale à son domicile, mais aussi de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Julienne vend également des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Julienne a deux ans d’expérience dans ce domaine et a déjà bénéficié de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Julienne sollicite à nouveau un prêt, afin d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et d’accroître sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Julienne A. S. was born in 1980 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is married to Achille Toffa, a painter. The couple has three children two of them attend school. All the children live together with their parents in the neighborhood of Agbalilamè, in the town of Sèmè-Podji. Julienne and her family have lived in this neighborhood for over nine years. She helps her husband and, with him, provides for the family’s expenses thanks to the income brought by her activity. She sells vegetable oil from her home but also door-to-door. As a secondary activity, she also sells prepaid cards for mobile phone. She has two years of experience in this sector and has already received a loan from ALIDé. This loan was reimbursed fully. Julienne is requesting a new loan in order to increase her stock and her customer base.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drums of vegetable oil

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Angel Giménez C. es casado y vive en la compañía Cabañas  de la ciudad de Caacupe.
 El señor Miguel Angel es muy trabajador, es mecánico automotriz y también tienen una Hamburguesería.  Empezó con un pequeño capital hace 10 años, gracias al buen trato con sus clientes  el negocio va creciendo constantemente.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de  repuestos para autos ya tiene muchos vehículos para reparar y el desea adquirirlos para vender a sus clientes.
El señor Miguel Ángel gradece a la fundación paraguaya por apoyo obtenido para su actividad ya que gracias a la ayuda y el esfuerzo su negocio está creciendo, brindando sus servicios y productos de buena calidad a la comunidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel Angel Giménez C. is married and lives in the Cabañas region of the city of Caacupe. Miguel Angel is very hardworking; he is an automotive mechanic and owns a hamburger stand. He started with a small amount of capital 10 years ago, and thanks to his good relationship with his customers his business is constantly growing. He asks for the credit to buy some car parts. He already has many vehicles to repair and he needs the parts to sell to his customers. Miguel Ángel thanks the Paraguay Foundation for their help for his business, now that with help and hard work, his business is growing and he can offer high quality products and services to the community.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy car parts.

loans.name: María Maribel

texts.es:
María Maribel tiene 26 años de edad, es separada y vive sola en el caserío El Arenal una zona rural dedicada principalmente a labores agrícolas, pertenece al distrito de Túcume, en la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, esta actividad tiene bastante acogida en las zonas rurales de la provincia de Lambayeque ya que constituye un ingreso adicional a la mayoría de familias, ya que se dedican principalmente a la agricultura y esta actividad no les provee de ingresos permanentes. En su caso, María complementa sus ingresos con la confección de pantalones en poliéster y drill.

María cría aves de corral (gallinas, patos, pavos) en unos corrales instalados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Ella desea mejorar la calidad de la alimentación de sus aves para que estas tengan una buena acogida en el mercado, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado.

María es una joven luchadora y que ha aprendido a valerse por si misma para salir adelante. En la zona donde vive ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos que la consideran una mujer honrada y responsable.
texts.en:
María Maribel is 26 years old, and is separated. She lives in a country house in El Arenal, a predominantly agricultural area in the Túcume district, of the Lambayeque province, which is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. For the past three years, she has been raising and selling animals, an activity that is common in the rural areas of the Lambayeque province. It provides extra income to most families that are predominantly farmers, although it doesn't give them a permanent income source. María complements her income by making pants out of polyester and drill. María raises poultry (hens, ducks, turkeys) in pens behind her home, and when they have grown enough she sells them in the markets of Chiclayo. She wants to improve the nutrition of her birds so that they are received better in the market. To achieve this goal she has requested her first loan of S/.800 from Edpyme Alternativa to buy feed that will provide a balanced diet María is a very motivated young woman and she has learned to look after herself in order to get ahead. In the area where she lives she is well known, and highly regarded by her neighbors, who consider her to be an honorable and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy nutritional feed for poultry.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila tiene 60 años, está felizmente casada con Nicolás D. 74 años, ellos tienen 11 hijos, quienes son independientes, por eso sólo vive con 3 D. ellos en su casa propia. Junto a su inseparable esposo y con la ayuda D. sus hijos, lleva 30 años dedicada al cultivo D. café, plátanos y piña, productos muy solicitados en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta es ver crecer sus frutos, los compara como si fueran sus hijos, por otro lado le resulta pesado retirar la maleza D. sus terrenos. Según Cirila, que gracias a la agricultura, pudo ampliar sus chacras así como su producción; además pudo construir su casa y brindarles a sus hijos una adecuada calidad D. vida y sobre todo una buena educación que es la mejor herencia que les pueD. dar. “Me gusta cuidar la tierra, aunque es pesado y ya no tengo tantas fuerzas, por eso trabajaré contratando operarios”, asegura. Por tal motivo planea alquilar un establecimiento en la ciudad o en su localidad para instalar una tienda D. comestibles, donD. pueda estar tranquila al lado su pareja. Éste es su tercer crédito con MFP y se muestra muy agradecida por continuar trabajando con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, mandará a instalar un vivero D. café para renovar y alternar sus plantaciones, asimismo comprará plantas D. plátano que sembrará en sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Cirila is 60 years old and happily married to Nicolas, 74. They have 11 children, all of whom are independent. As a result, they live with just 3 of them in their own house. Together with her inseparable husband and with the help of their children, for 30 years they have been cultivating coffee, plantains and pineapples, all high demand products in the market. What Cirila likes most is to see her fruits grow. She looks upon them as if they were her children. But she hates to pull weeds. According to Cirila, thanks to agriculture, she has been able to expand her farm land and production, as well as build a house and offer her children an adequate quality of life and, above all, a good education, which is the best inheritance that one could give. “I like to care for the earth, although it is hard work and I no longer have as much strength. That is why I have to contract laborers,” she says. For that reason, Cirila plans to hire an establishment in the city, or in her locality, to install a grocery store, where she can work tranquilly besiD. her husband. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she is very grateful to be able to continue working with her communal group. With the loan she solicits, Cirila will install a coffee nursery in order to renovate and alternate her plantings, plus buy plantain plants to sow in her fields

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: INSTALLING A COFFEE NURSERY AND BUYING PLANTAIN PLANTS TO SOW

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr: Née en 1956 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, K. Joséphine vit depuis vingt six ans environs à Agbalilamè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Joséphine est mariée à WATCHINOU Antoine et est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Joséphine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Joséphine n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Joséphine vend des condiments de sauce (oignons, piments, gingembre, légumes, etc.) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Joséphine vend du maïs. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi au marché de Abattoir à Cotonou, que Joséphine achète ses produits. Joséphine a déjà quinze ans d'expérience dans l'exercice de son activité, et a déjà obtenu quatre prêts de ALIDé.Joséphine a bien effectué le remboursement de ces crédits. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Joséphine souhaite rehausser le niveau de son activité et mieux faire face à la demande des clients ; raison pour laquelle Joséphine sollicite un cinquième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1956 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Josephine K. has been living in Agabalilamè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, for 26 years. She is married to Antoine Watchinou and is the mother of three children, all of whom go to school. Josephine lives together with her husband and children. The couple takes care of the family budget jointly. Josephine never attended school. In order to support herself, she sells condiments for sauces (onions, chili peppers, ginger, vegetables etc) out of her home. In addition, she also sells corn. She purchases her stock in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin as well at the Butcher’s Market in Cotonou. She has 15 years of experience in this business, and had obtained four ALIDé loans in the past. Josephine has always repaid her loans properly. Facing the growing customer numbers, she would like to expand her business and better meet the demand, which is why she is seeking her fifth loan.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing condiments [for resale]

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Julio aperturo un restaurant hace varios años, aunque el restaurant no estaba situado en un local céntrico, pudo adquirir algunas ganancias que le permitan mantenerse. Bárbara se desempeña en  el rubro D. las confecciones D. todo tipo D. prendas D. vestir, lo hace en el puesto D. venta D. su compañera, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos por lo cual desea mejorar su situación económica, a ella le gustaría aperturar un taller para obtener mejores ganancias.
El grupo se muestra puntual y responsable en el crédito obtenido por su compañerismo y esfuerzo. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
Julio opened a restaurant several years ago. Although it wasn’t located in central spot, he managed to earn enough money to support himself. Barbara makes all kinds of clothing which she sells from her friend’s stall. She is married and has three children. Because of them she wishes to better her financial situation by opening a workshop and earning more money. The group is punctual and responsible with repayments of the loan which they obtained through comradeship and effort. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products and supplies

loans.name: Iris Lanao Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Iris Lanao inicia su ciclo séptimo con 13 socias, que realizan diferentes negocios. 

Las socias son del Distrito D. Chiara que se encuentra a 2 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Bernardina es presidenta del Banco Comunal, Bernardina se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado, adquiere los animales en Chiara y lo venD. en la feria D. animales D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, en algunas oportunidades venD. carne. Además Bernardina compra cereales que luego procesa en molidos, también hace papa seca, productos que comercializa en la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Bernardina no cuenta con la ayuda D. su esposo y realiza varias actividades para poder mantener su hogar, tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales 2 hijos todavía están estudiando. Bernardina sueña con que sus hijos estudien en la universidad. Su prestamo sera invertido en la compra D. ganado ovino y caprino,
texts.en:
The Iris Lanao Communal Bank has begun its 7th loan cycle with 13 members, all of whom have different businesses. The members are from the District of Chiara, which is located 2 hours outsiD. the city of Ayacucho. Bernardina, president of the communal bank, dedicates herself to buying and selling livestock. She acquires the animals in Chiara and sells them at the animal fair in the city of Ayacucho. On occasions, she sells meat. In addition, Bernardina buys grains which are then milled, and she also buys dried potatoes. These products too are sold in the city of Ayacucho. Bernardina can't count on the aid of her husband, so she is involved in various activities, in order to be able to maintain her home. She has 5 children, 2 of whom are still studying. Bernardina dreams that her children might study in the university. Her loan will be invested in buying cattle and goats.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia, de 30 años, vive con su esposo  y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde su niñez se dedica a la  agricultura. En la actualidad trabaja en sus campos, junto a su esposo, todos los días labora desde muy temprano con mucha dedicación para tener una cosecha exitosa y de esta manera mejorar sus ganancias. Siembra  maca (raíz con propiedades curativas) que es  muy comercial, pues  los cultivos necesitan de poco abono  y se produce en cantidad. Para el futuro tiene planeado adquirir más terrenos de cultivo y mejorar su producción.Es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete ser  muy responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, además agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Eusebia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de un toro que le ayudará  como arado en su siembra, además pagará la mano  de obra de ayudantes para recoger su cosecha.
texts.en:
Eusebia, 30 years old, lives with her husband and their 3 children in their own house. Since her childhood she has worked in agriculture. These days she works in her fields along with her husband. Every day, starting early in the morning, they work with great dedication in order to have a successful harvest and in this way improve their income. She plants maca (a root plant with curative properties) which is a very good commercial product since the crop needs little fertilizer and produces in quantity. In the future she plans to acquire more cultivable fields and increase her production. This is the second time she will have a loan with MFP and she promises to be very responsible with the repayments. Also, she thanks everyone who made the loan possible since it will be very helpful to her in the progress of her business. Eusebia plans to invest the requested money in the purchase of a bull that will help her with plowing during planting and also to pay for the labor of workers who harvest the crop.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will pay workers for the harvest

loans.name: Nafissatou

texts.fr: A. Nafissatou est née en 1978 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à DOSSOU Didier, un mécanicien, Nafissatou est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. En dehors de ses enfants, Nafissatou a un autre enfant à sa charge. Tous les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents au quartier Tokplégbé à Cotonou. Il y a près de treize ans que Nafissatou vit dans ce quartier. Nafissatou contribue efficacement aux charges familiales, grâce au revenu de son activité. Nafissatou vend en effet, des tissus, mais aussi des bijoux et des produits de beauté, par le système de distribution. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Nafissatou achète ses produits. Nafissatou a déjà huit ans d'expérience dans l'exercice de cette activité, et a bénéficié antérieurement de deux prêts auprès de ALIDé. Nafissatou est une bonne cliente de ALIDé. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de se faire plus de profits, Nafissatou sollicite un troisième crédit, afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Nafissatou was born in 1978 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Married to Mr. DOSSOU Didier, a mechanic, she is the mother of three children, who are all in school.  Besides her children, Nafissatou has another child to support.  All the children live together with their parents in the Tokplégbé in Cotonou.  She has been living in this district for almost thirteen years.  She contributes effectively to covering family expenses, thanks to the revenues from her business.  Basically, she sells cloth but also jewelry and beauty products by the distribution system.  She purchases her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  Nafissatou has already had eight years of experience operating this business and has benefited in the past from two loans with ALIDé.  She is a good ALIDé client.  With the goal of bolstering her business and making more profit, Nafissatou is requesting a third loan in order to satisfy her customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bolts of cloth and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Madres Unidas Del 7 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
“Madres Unidas del 7 de Octubre”, es una alcancía comunal que se encuentra ubicada en la 6ta zona de 7 de octubre, distrito de Ate, departamento de Lima,  conformado por 7 socios quienes se dedican a labores de servicio, comercio y producción minorista, es un grupo recién constituido por EDAPROSPO – prosperidad.
Carlos Alberto tiene 39 años, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, asume actualmente el cargo de presidente.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de periódicos y desde hace 2 años a la venta de cosméticos, se inicio en la venta de periódicos como ayudante y por las necesidades que había en su hogar, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado mejorara su calidad de vida y la de su familia, sus ingresos cubren los gastos de mantención el estudio de sus hijos. El gran sueño de Carlos es mejorar su vivienda y ampliar su negocio. El reciente préstamo será destinado para comprar mercadería. Nuestros socios agradecen la oportunidad que le han dado, e iniciativa para su constitución como Alcancía Comunal y prometen no defraudarlos y cumplir con sus respectivos pagos.
texts.en:
“Madres Unidas del 7 de Octubre” is a community bank located in the 6th zone of October 7th area, in the district of Ate, Lima department. The bank consists of seven members who work in services, business, and retail. They recently started working with Kiva partner, EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD. 39-year old Carlos Alberto is married and has two children. He is the current president of the group. For five years he has been selling newspapers, and also cosmetics for two years now. He started out as an assistant selling items to earn money for daily necessities. Through hard work he managed to improve his family’s standard of living. His income is sufficient to support his family and send his children to school. Carlos’s great dream is to improve his house and expand his business. The recent loan will be used to buy stock. Our members are grateful for this opportunity and for the initiative of the community bank. They promise not to disappoint and to make their respective repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Asociacion De Todas Las Sangres Group

texts.es:
Este es el primer préstamo de la Alcom “Asociación de todas las sangres”, las socias se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas para apoyar a sus familias Con mucho esfuerzo Lucy apertura  una bodega hace 1 año con las ganancias del negocio pudo mantener a sus 3 hijos y  seguir adelante con sus planes.
Nuestra socia Ruth empezó  su negocio con la ayuda de una amiga, ella vende marcianos y gelatinas,  aunque al principio no obtenía muchas ganancias, entonces decidió ampliar su negocios así que ahora vende diferentes bebidas y con la ganancias de sus ventas puede mantener y solventar los gastos en casa.
Yeny es una socia que viaja constantemente, ella trae frutos de la selva peruana para venderlos en su casa asi puede aportar con los gastos en casa.
Los socios agradecen el préstamo y prometen cumplir con los acuerdos del grupo.
 seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
This is the first loan for the communal bank "Asociación de Todas las Sangres.” The members have a variety of economic activities with which they support their families. With a lot of effort, Lucy opened a store a year ago. With the earnings from her business she is able to support her 3 children and move forward with her plans. Our member Ruth started her business with the help of a friend. She sells frozen fruit juice and gelatin snacks. Although at first she did not have very good earnings, she then decided to expand her business so that now she sells a variety of drinks, and with the earnings from her sales she is able to cover the household expenses. Yeny is a member who travels constantly. She takes fruit from the Peruvian rainforest to sell from her home. In this way she can help with the household expenses. The members are grateful for this loan and promise to make their payments according to their group agreement. EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Agustín Darío

texts.es:
Agustín tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el sector Antonio Raimondi, una zona urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, ciudad conocida a nivel nacional por su gran movimiento comercial y de trasnporte, es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi desde hace tres años, el brinda su servicio en la ciudad de Chiclayo, este medio de transporte es frecuentado por la mayoría de pobladores de la ciudad ya  que es bastante económico, generalmente las rutas que cubren se encuentran situadas en los alrededores del centro y en la periferia de la ciudad.
