Agustín cuenta con dos unidades para realizar este trabajo, pero actualmente se vale de una, ya que la otra se encuentra inoperativa debido a algunas fallas en el motor, el desea repararla para poder alquilarla y así poder percibir mas ingresos que le permitan ayudar a su familia, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Agustín es un hombre empeñoso y bastante trabajador, su mayor anhelo es formar su propia empresa de transportes para brindarle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida. En la imagen aparece junto a la moto que piensa reparar.
texts.en:
Agustín is 38 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the neighborhood of Antonio Raimondi in the outlying area of the city of Chiclayo. Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region, is known throughout the country for their thriving business and transport. He has worked for three years transporting cargo and passengers in a mototaxi [a motorcycle with an attached cab for passengers] in the city of Chiclayo. This mode of transportation is used by the majority of the people in the city because it is inexpensive. The usual routes that he covers are located in the center of town and the outskirts of the city. Agustín has two mototaxis to do this work, but currently has only one functioning. The other is inoperable due to problems with the motor. He would like to repair it in order to rent it to someone and be able to earn more money that would permit him to help his family. To achieve his objective, he has solicited a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time. Agustín is a hard-working and industrious man. His dream is to start his own transportation business in order to give his parents a better quality of life. He appears in the picture with the moto-taxi he would like to repair.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of a mototaxi

loans.name: Angela Marilu

texts.es:
Ángela de 20 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil como una microempresaria ya que una de sus actividades económicas es la de hacer manualidades a base de formix.

Comenzó a realiza muñecos de fomix desde que salió del colegio. Por las buenas referencias que tuvo comenzó a trabajar para una empresa. En la actualidad es una microempresaria ya que sigue proveyendo a empresas de las manualidades que hace. Tiene un horario de trabajo cómodo ya que puede dedicarle tiempo a sus estudios. Las manualidades que realiza son para eventos específicos como fiestas, cumpleaños etc.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar fomix, espuma para hacer más manualidades y así seguir creciendo en la microempresa. De esa manera el objetivo de ella es automatizar la microempresa y así seguir creciendo como microempresaria hasta llegar a ser reconocida a nivel nacional por los productos que ella elabora que son hechos a base de fomix.
texts.en:
Ángela is 20 years old and lives in an urban area called Guasmo de Guayaquil, where she has a small business. One of her economic activities is making handicrafts from Fomix (a type of crafting foam). She began to make foam dolls when she graduated from high school; she was able to start working for a company because of her good personal references. She now has her own business, and continues to supply her crafts to various companies. She has a comfortable working schedule that allows her to dedicate time to her studies. The crafts she makes are for specific events like parties, birthdays, etc. With this loan, she wants to buy Fomix and foam for more handicrafts so that she can continue to grow her business. Her goal is to automate her small business so that she can continue to expand until she is recognized on a national level for the Fomix products she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Foam to make handicrafts

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 25 años, vive con su esposo en su casa que es propia.Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las tareas de campo pues sus padres le enseñaron todas las técnicas agrícolas necesarias. En la actualidad se dedica al cultivo de maca (raíz con propiedades curativas) que  produce  en abundancia, también cría ovejas que tiene en su establo. Cuando llega el tiempo de la cosecha puede ver con mucha satisfacción la recompensa a su sacrificado trabajo, con su buena producción. Tiene todos los ánimos de continuar adelante y se proyecta a seguir dedicándose a la agricultura, además desea  adquirir sus propias maquinarias (como un tractor) y también  quiere instalar un establo grande.Es la segunda oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete será  muy responsable con sus pagos, también agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Sonia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de alimento para sus animales y además en los gastos de transporte de su cosecha.
texts.en:
Sonia is 25 years old and lives with her husband in a house they own. From childhood she has worked in the field, and her parents taught her all of the agricultural techniques necessary. Currently, she works cultivating maca (a root with healing properties), which she produces in abundance. She also raises sheep in her stable. When harvest time arrives, it is satisfying to see the rewards of her sacrifice and hardwork in her good harvest. Sonia intends to continue moving forward, and she plans to continue working in agriculture. She would like to buy her own machines (like a tractor) and also install a large stable. This is her second opportunity for a loan with MFP, and she promises she will be very responsible with her payments. She would also like to thank all of the people who will make the loan possible, because it will be very useful for the progress of her business. Sonia plans to invest her loan in the purchase of feed for her animals and also in the costs of transporting her harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animal feed and payment for transporting crops

loans.name: La Flor De Pampamarca Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Flor de Pampamarca inicia su primer ciclo, las socias son de la comunidad de Pampamarca, Distrito de Vinchos, Provincia de Huamanga, las actividades principales de la zona es la crianza de animales y agricultura de maíz, papa, arverja, cebada. Las socias realizan distintos negocios como la venta de cuyes, abarrotes, cereales, cochinilla, quesos. 
Faviana tiene casa propia en donde realiza su negocio, vende comida típica, prepara cuy chactado, además vende cuy que compra en su mismo distrito y lo vende en el mercado de su distrito. Además Fabiana vende cereales, negocio que inicio hace varios años con el apoyo de su esposo, Fabiana invertirá su préstamo en la compra de cuys. Una dificultad para Fabiana es lo alejado que se encuentra su comunidad de la carretera principal de su distrito. El sueño de Faviana es implementar un recreo para vender comidas típicas, bebidas, lo cual generara mas ingresos para mantener su hogar.
texts.en:
The Flor de Pampamarca Communal bank is beginning its first cycle. The members are from the Pampamarca Community, Vinchos district, Huamanga province. The main activities in the area are raising animals and growing corn, potatoes, peas, and barley. The members have different businesses like selling guinea pigs, groceries, grains, “cochinilla” (an insect found on the prickly pear cactus and used to make a red dye), and cheeses. Fabiana has her own house where she has her business. She sells typical food. She prepares fried guinea pig. She also sells guinea pigs that she buys in the same district. She sells them at the district market. Fabiana also sell grains. She started this business several years ago with help from her husband. Fabiana will use the loan to buy guinea pigs. One of the difficult things for Fabiana is how far her community is from the main road in her district. Fabiana’s dream is to establish a recreational area with a restaurant in order to sell typical foods and drinks. That will generate more income to support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Asociacion Las Tres Estrellas Group

texts.es:
L. alcancía comunal “Asociación Las Tres Estrellas”, está conformada por 8 miembros emprendedores quienes viven en L. zona D. Santa Rosa, distrito D. El Agustino, departamento D. Lima, trabajan con EDAPROSPO-prosperidad desD. hace 4 meses.
Maximiliana quien es socia del grupo, tiene 50 años, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, asume el cargo D. presidenta recientemente. DesD. hace 3 años se dedica a L. venta D. verduras y tubérculos, se inicio vendiendo como ambulante y ahora lo hace en un puesto en el mercado. Con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo ha logrado comprar una salchipapera y L. construcción del baño D. su vivienda. El gran sueño D. Maximiliana es poner una tienda en su vivienda.
El  préstamo otorgado será utilizado para L. compra D. mercadería. Agradecen el apoyo brindado y se prometen cumplir con los pagos establecidos en las fechas pactadas.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Asociación Las Tres Estrellas” is maD. up of eight enterprising members who live in Santa Rosa, a district of El Agustino in the departament of Lima. They have been working with EDAPROSPO for four months. Maximiliana is a member of the group and has recently taken on the position of president. She is 50 years old, has two children and lives with her D. facto. She has sold vegetables and tubers for three years, starting as a street vendor and later setting up a market stall. Through her efforts she has been able to purchase a “salchipapera” (a mobile cart equipped for selling fried potatoes and sausages) and build a bathroom in her house. Maximiliana’s dream is to set up a shop in her house. This loan will be used to buy merchandise. The group is thankful for the support they have received and promise to make their repayments in the allocated time period.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Gennsi

texts.es: Gennsi, es un joven soltero de 21 años, que quiere aprovechar todas las oportunidades que le brinda la vida hasta que cumpla los 40 años, él vive con su madre Ana de 41 años y con su padre Elmer de 43 años en casa de ellos y junto a sus 3 hermanos. En sus campos agrícolas se observa sus extensas plantaciones de café y plátanos, esto se  remonta desde hace 3 años cuando empezó a trabajar junto a su padre, contratando operarios para agilizar la labor agrícola. Dentro de su actividad lo que más disfruta es cosechar los plátanos, porque los recolecta de rama en rama, por otro lado le molesta trasladar largas horas de viaje sus frutos a los mercados en donde no consideran el precio exacto de lo que debería costar su producción. Gennsi, está seguro de la calidad de sus productos por eso siempre encuentra un mejor postor, “si vendo solo lo que me ofrecen no podré ganar lo que valen mis cosechas”, afirma, por eso siempre busca tener amigos compradores mayoristas. Con el tiempo espera comprar sus propias chacras y plantar en grandes cantidades, también quiere construir su casa en la ciudad, pues ya piensa en conformar su familia. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y como es miembro de la junta directiva, le gusta laborar de manera activa en su grupo comunal y que sus compañeros sean participativos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 20 sacos de fertilizantes para proteger sus plantaciones, asimismo desea contratar operarios.
texts.en:
Gennsi is a young, 21 year old man who wants to take advantage of all of the opportunities that life offers him before he turns 40. He lives with his mother, Ana, who is 41, and his father, Elmer, who is 43, and with his three siblings in their home. On their farmland, you can see their extensive plantings of coffee and plantains. He has been doing this for 3 years, when he started to work with his father, hiring workers to facilitate the farmwork. One of the activities he most enjoys is harvesting the plantains, because he collects them bunch by bunch. On the other hand, he dislikes transporting his products for long hours of travel to the markets where they don't consider the exact price that the production should cost. Gennsi is sure of the quality of his products and that is why he always finds the best bidder "if I just sell at what they offer I can't make what my harvests are worth", he affirms. That is why he always seeks to have wholesale purchasing friends. With time, he hopes to buy his own land and plant in large quantities. He also wants to build his house in the city, because he is planning on starting a family. This is his third loan with MFP, and since he is a member of the board of directors, he likes to work actively in his community group and for the other members to participate. With the loan he is asking for, he will buy 20 sacks of fertilizer to protect his plantings, as well as hire workers.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 bags of fertilizer and to hire workers.

loans.name: Medio Ejido (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Medio Ejido lo conforman  ocho socias que buscan con su trabajo mejorar y crecer en su negocio al igual que con sus familias; está ubicado en la  ciudad de Cuenca  urbe dividida en dos partes por el río Tomebamba, demarcando el centro histórico al norte con sus hermosas casas hasta el barranco y la moderna al sur con barrios residenciales, edificios, centros comerciales y amplias avenidas, que hacen de esta ciudad un lugar que atrae al turista nacional y extranjero.

Banesa es oriunda de la provincia de Manabí  migro a esta ciudad, vive en el sector Medio Ejido  en una casa arrendada con su pareja  que trabaja como ayudante en bus interprovincial y sus dos hijos de 8 y 5 años respectivamente, los niños cursan la educación básica en establecimientos de la ciudad,  ella  comparte su tiempo entre la venta   por catálogo de ropa, perfumes, bisutería y más desde hace un año y medio y los quehaceres del  hogar, también  prepara comidas para fechas especiales según pedido y esta actividad  realiza hace 6 años.

Este es  su primer crédito y con el dinero comprará pantalones, camisas, blusas, perfumes, cremas, maquillajes, aretes, collares, pulseras y más para su exigente clientela.

Su meta es  volver a su tierra natal comprarse un terreno y construir su casa propia. 

María Gabriela  C.  tiene 24 años es casada fruto de su unión concibió tres hijos quienes se encuentran de 6, 5, 1 año,  sus dos  primeras hijas estudian  en una  escuela de la ciudad, gracias al trabajo conjunto lograron edificar su casa propia donde tienen una panadería y pastelería y trabjan tanto esposo y ella  gracias a que su cónyuge le enseño esta actividad.  

Es socia del banco comunal Medio Ejido motivada por su hermana y este es  su primer credito, con el dinero que recibirá va abastecer su negocio con harina, manteca, levadura, azúcar y otros insumos para la preparación del pan y pasteles.

Su sueño es salir adelante con su esposo y agrandar su negocio para dar trabajo a otras personas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
The community bank Medio Ejido is made up of eight members, who are are seeking with their work to improve and grow their business, as well as with their families. It is located in the city of Cuenca, a large city divided into two parts by the river Tomebamba, which demarcates the historical center of the north, with its beautiful houses that go to the ravine and the modern south with residential neighborhoods, buildings, shopping centers, and wide avenues, which makes this city a place that attracts national and foreign tourists.

Banesa is a native of the province of Manabi. She migrated to this city and lives in the Medio Ejido region in a rented house with her partner, who works as an assistant on the interprovincial bus, and their two children, who are 8 and 5 years old, respectively. The children are in elementary school at a city establishment. She shares her time between catalog sales of clothing, perfumes, costume jewelry and more, for one and a half years, and the household chores. She also prepares food for special dates upon request, which she has been doing for six years.

This is her first loan, and with the money she will buy pants, shirts, blouses, perfumes, creams, makeup, earrings, necklaces, bracelets, and more for her discerning customers. Her goal is to return to her native land and buy a plot of land and build her own house.

María Gabriela C. is 24 years old, and married. The fruit of her marriage is her three children aged 6, 5, and 1. Her first two daughters study in a city school. Thanks to their joint work, they managed to build their own house where they have a bread and cake shop, thanks to her husband teaching her this work. She was motivated by her sister to become a member of the community bank Medio Ejido, and this is her first loan. With the money she will receive, she is going to stock up her business with flour, butter, yeast, sugar and other basic ingredients for the preparation of bread and cakes. Her dream is to get ahead with her husband and enlarge their business in order to give work to other people in the community.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, blouses, perfumes, makeup, creams, earrings, necklaces, etc. and to buy flour, butter, sugar, salt, and yeast

loans.name: Las Chocorvinas Group

texts.es:
Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal Las Chocorvinas, Bertha es casada, tiene 1 hijo varón y 1 mujer, tiene casa propia en donde vende golosinas y gaseosas, negocio que inicio hace 2 años primero vendía comida en Huaytara y poco a poco fue creciendo su negocio, negocio que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo e hijos, su préstamo será invertido en la compra de galletas, gaseosas. Los sueños de Bertha son que sus hijos sigan estudios superiores y ahorrar con la ayuda de Finca.
El Banco Comunal Chocorvinas inicia su primer ciclo con 10 socias, que son de la comunidad de Chocorvo, Distrito de Huaytara, Departamento de Huancavelica.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the Las Chocorvinas Communal Bank, is married, and has 1 son and 1 daughter. She owns her own house from which she sells snacks and soft drinks, a business which she started some 2 years ago. First, she sold meals in Huaytara and little by little, her business has been growing, with the aid of her husband and children. Bertha's loan will be invested in the purchase of cookies, crackers, and soft drinks. Bertha's dreams are that her children continue in secondary school and that she can save with Finca's help. The Chocorvinas Communal Bank has begun its first loan cycle with 10 members, all from the community of Chocorvo, Huaytara District, Huancavelica Department.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING COOKIES, CRACKERS, AND SOFT DRINKS TO SELL

loans.name: Arbol De Vida Group

texts.es:
Felipe empezó trabajando como ayudante en una vidriería hace varios años como es un hombre muy hábil aprendió rápidamente y decidió abrir su propio negocio, èl esta contento con su logro, ya que eso le permite aportar con los gastos en casa, además  pronto tendrá su primera bebe, y tiene que ver sus gastos futuros.
María venD. golosinas D. forma ambulante hace varios años ella desea adquirir un lugar donD. vender aunque ahora hay mucha competencia, ella tiene 3 hijos los cuales le ayudan. Ella agradece el capital D. trabajo que le brindan.
Todas los socios se dedican a  diferentes tipos D. negocios que le permitan mantener a sus familias, agradecen los préstamos y desean lograr nuevos préstamos para su capital D. trabajo.
seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
Felipe began working as an assistant in a glazing shop a few years ago. As he is quite skillful he learnt quickly and decided to open his own business. He is happy with his achievement since it allows him to contribute to the bills at home and as he will soon welcome his first child, there will be more costs to cover in the future. Maria has been selling sweets as a street vendor for some years. She would like to find a place where she can sell her products, even though there is a lot of competition now. She has three children who support her and she is thankful for the working capital they offer her. All the members work in different areas which help them to support their families. They are grateful for their loans and hope to obtain new loans for their working capital. EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products and materials

loans.name: Por Una Vida Digna Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Por una Vida Digna” se encuentra ubicada en la zona D. Santa Anita, departamento D. Lima, está conformado por 9 socios, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desD. hace 6 años. Sus miembros realizan diversas actividades D. producción, comercio y servicio.
Elsa quien a su vez asume el cargo D. tesorera, tiene 52 años, es casada, tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales uno esta en la Universidad, se dedica al alquiler D. vestuarios (danzas folklóricas), desD. hace 5 años, se inicio en esta actividad porque sus hijas son profesoras D. danzas, con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria Elsa ha construido el tercer piso D. su vivienda. Su gran sueño es formar una agrupación que difunda el folklor a nivel nacional. El reciente préstamo lo utilizará en la compra D. vestuarios.  
Todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y están comprometidos a cumplir con los pagos según el cronograma otorgado por prosperidad. (En la foto niños hijos D. los socios).
texts.en:
The community bank “Por una Vida Digna” is located in Santa Anita in the departament of Lima. It is maD. up of nine members who have worked with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for six years. The members are involved in diverse production, commercial and service industries. Elsa is the group's treasurer. She is 52, married and has 5 children, one of whom studies at university. She has been renting out folk dance costumes for five years. She started this business because her daughters are dance teachers. As a result of her daily efforts, Elsa has added a third floor to her house. Her dream is to form a group that will take folklore to a national level. She will use this loan to buy costumes. All the group members are thankful for the support they receive and are committed to repaying their installments on time. The children featured in this photo are the children of the group members.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of costumes

loans.name: Las Flores - Ccoñani Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Flores de Ccoñani esta integrado por 10 socias, que son de la comunidad de Ccoñani, Distrito de Vinchos, Departamento de Ayacucho. 
Delia es casada, tiene 3 hijos, Delia junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de animales, como gallinas, vacas, carneros, los cuales adquiere en su distrito y los llevan a diferentes ferias de la región, además Delia se dedica a la crianza de animales que en algunas oportunidades también vende, su préstamo será invertido en la compra de carneros, gallinas para vender en las ferias. 
Los sueños de Delia son mejorar su negocio, tener mas capital para comprar mas animales y tener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
The communal bank Flores de Ccoñani (Flowers of Ccoñani) is made up of 10 members who are from the community of Ccoñani, in the Vinchos district of the department of Ayacucho. Delia is married and has 3 children. Delia, along with her husband, sells animals such as hens, cows, and rams (male sheep), which she procures in her district and takes to different markets in the region. In addition, Delia raises animals that she sometimes also sells. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of sheep and chickens to sell in the markets. Delia dreams of improving her business by having more capital to buy more animals and have more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sheep and hens

loans.name: Felipe Israel

texts.es:
El señor Felipe Israel F. esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo comprar el material que necesitaba para elaborar los pedidos que tenía pendientes para entregar. 
Esta solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para poder comprar una maquina de soldar, ya que solo cuenta con una y quiere contratar a otra persona para que le ayude con los trabajos. 
Desea que su negocio crezca y tenga mas ingreso para la familia ya que es la fuente de ingresos, ya que les quiere dar lo mejor a si dos hijos.
texts.en:
Felipe Israel F. is grateful for the cooperation received in the previous loan with which he was able to muy some materials he needed to make the items for some pending orders he had. He is again asking for funds, this time to buy a welding machine because he only owns one and wants to have another one so that he can get an assistant to help him with work. He wants his business to grow and thus have more income for his family since this is the family's sole source of income and he wants to provide the best for his two children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de  40 años, vive  con su esposo  y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 10 años trabaja en la atención de su tienda de comestibles  ubicada en su casa. Cada día empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano,  con la ayuda de sus hijos. Siempre esta pendiente de la cantidad de mercadería que tiene, para que su tienda este siempre surtida de los mas variados comestibles, y de esta manera ofrecer a su clientela lo mejor en comestibles. Sus ventas son mayores  por las mañanas, es por eso que para Elizabeth  es vital tener la mercadería en el momento oportuno. Las ganancias  que recibe le permiten seguir adelante por lo que ha decidido ampliar su tienda con mayor cantidad de mercadería en frutas y útiles de escritorio.Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y  fue invitada a formar parte de este banco comunal porque  los integrantes la conocen cono una persona responsable en sus  pagos. Además esta agradecida  con todas las personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de más mercadería como arroz, azúcar, menestras y productos envasados para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 40, lives with her husband and three children in her own house. She has had a grocery store in her house for the last 10 years. Her work day starts very early with help from her children. She is always conscious of her stock supplies so that the store is always well stocked with a good assortment of foodstuffs in order to offer her customers the best in food items. Her best sales happen in the morning which is why it’s important for Elizabeth to have her stock available at the opportune moment. The profits she earns make it possible for her to continue forward so she has decided to expand her inventory by including fruits and office supplies. This is her first loan with MFP; she was invited to join this communal bank because the members know her as being a responsible person with respect to repayments. She is grateful to all the people who made the loan possible because it will be very useful for her store’s progress. She will use the requested funds to buy more stock items like: rice, sugar, vegetables and canned goods.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino tiene 60 años, está casado con Octavia de 40 años, ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero vive solo con dos de ellos en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de San Chirio Palomar en Santa Ana. Todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana junto a su esposa, sale a cuidar sus cultivos de café y plátanos, pues saben que los esfuerzos que realizan serán recompensados cuando llega la época de cosecha, en donde cuentan con el apoyo de sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta a él, es retirar la maleza de sus terrenos, para estén limpios y el abono sea aprovechado por los frutos, sin embargo le disgusta cuando sus plantaciones es invadido por la plaga, por lo que tiene que colocar trampas en cada plantación. Marcelino disfruta de los beneficios que le brinda la agricultura, lo hace muy feliz, por eso quiere adquirir más chacras agrícolas para incrementar su producción, pero ahora su prioridad es construir su vivienda para que su familia tenga comodidades. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que le encanta trabajar con su grupo comunal, ya que aprende mucho con las charlas educativas que le brindan. 
Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará madera, calamina y clavos para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Marcelino, 60, is married to Octavia, 40; they have 8 children but only two still live with them in a rented house located in San Chirio Palomar, Santa Ana. He and his wife go out very early in the morning every day to care for their coffee and banana crops because they know that their hard work will be rewarded at harvest time when they can count on help from their children. What he likes most is to remove weeds from his fields so that they will be cleared and the fruits can benefit from the manure. However, he is displeased when his plants are invaded by pests so he has to set traps every planting season. Marcelino enjoys the benefits he gets from farming; it makes him very happy. Because of this, he wants to obtain more fields in order to increase production. His priority right now, though, is to build his home so that his family can have some comfort. This is his 3rd loan with MFP; he enjoys team work very much because he learns a lot from the training sessions they are given. He will use the requested 1000 ne soles to buy wood, calamine and nails to build his house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, calamine and nails to build his house.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Maria Del Carmen P. esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual su negocio a mejora mucho. 
Solicita un préstamo poder comprar mas variedad de mercancía ya que sus clientes el están solicitando que venda verduras y quesos. Pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Del Carmen P. is grateful for the cooperation in her previous loan which made it possible for her store to improve quite a bit. She is asking for funds to buy a greater variety of goods because her customers are asking her to stock vegetables and cheeses; however, she lacks funds to make this investment and doesn't want to decapitalize her business. She plans to repay the loan with part of the profits she earns from the store since this is her family's source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Amistad Group

texts.es: PROSPERIDAD Y AMISTAD se caracteriza por ser puntuales y responsables en sus pagos, nuestra socia Zulema que es la presidenta se dedica a las confeeciones D. polos, blusas, pantalones para damas caballeros y niños, esto le permite aportar en casa y pagar la educación D. sus hijos. Ella desea que sus hijos puedan tener estudios profesionales asi que juntamente con su esposo se esfuerzan por lograrlo. El prestamo lo inveritia en la compra D. telas para sus confecciones. El grupo se muestra agradecido con los prestamos es por eso que pagan puntualmente sus cuotas segun su cronograma.
texts.en:
This group is known for being punctual and responsible in their payments. Zulema makes polos, blouses, and pants for women, men, and children. With her profits, she is able to contribute at home and pay for the education of her children. She hopes that her children will study and get professional degrees, so she and her husband work hard to realize this dream. She will use the loan to buy fabric to sew with. The group is grateful for the loans they have received, and therefore always pays their loan installments on time and according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es:
La señora Mirta M. y tiene 5 hijos varones y vive en el barrio San Antonio.
La  señora Mirta  es muy trabajadora y se dedica a la Fabricación y venta de chipas y bollos (masa dulce con crema de leche o de guayaba)  hace 10 años. 
La elaboración de chipas consiste en la mezcla de todos los ingredientes(almidón de yuca, grasa, queso, sal, leche) hasta obtener una masa amoldable, luego se moldea de acuerdo al gusto del cada uno y se cocina en el horno(tatacua, previo calentado con leña), se puede observar en la foto.  
Comenzó con un pequeño capital y gracias al buen trato con sus clientes  el negocio va creciendo.   
Solicita el crédito para la compra de  materia prima para aumentar la  elaboración de sus productos  y por ende aumentar el ingreso a su unidad familiar.
Doña Mirta agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya el apoyo obtenido para su actividad y mediante ello su negocio está creciendo y brindando Productos de buena calidad a la comunidad.
texts.en:
Mirta M. has five sons; they live in the San Antonio neighborhood. She is very hard-working; for the last 10 years she has made “chipas” (corn and cheese bread very popular as a snack in Paraguay) and “bollos” (sweet dough with a caramel or guava filling) to sell. To make “chipas” you mix all the ingredients (manioc starch, lard, cheese, salt, milk) together until you get pliable dough. Then, you shape it according to taste and bake it in the tatakua oven (ovens indigenous to Paraguay visible in the photo) that has been previously heated with firewood. She started out with a small capital investment and thanks to the good service she gives to her customers her business has been growing. She is asking for funds to buy ingredients so that she can increase production thereby increasing family income. Mirta is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the support it gives to her work; thanks to it her business is growing and providing quality products to the community.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manioc starch, lard, corn flour, cheese, milk, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Prosperidad Leal Group

texts.es:
La presidenta del grupo Beatriz se dedica a la venta de comida de lunes a viernes, hace varios años con sus pocos ingresos puede costear la educación de sus hijos. El préstamo lo usara para la compra de ingredientes para las preparación de comida que le permita cumplir con sus clientes.

Gladis es la secretaria del grupo ella se dedica a la venta de diferentes productos como son: productos de belleza, zapatos y prendas de vestir. Además tiene una fuente de soda donde exhibe sus productos, tiene 2 hijos por los cuales debe de trabajar.

Carmen es podóloga ella brinda sus servicios a domicilio, desea aperturar un local donde poder atender a sus clientes ya que esta logrando hacer una cartera de clientes fijos.

Todas las socias agradecen los préstamos y desean continuar trabajando con KIVA y EDAPROSPO.
texts.en:
The president of the Beatriz group sells food from Monday through Friday. For several years ahe has been able to pay for her childrens' education with her own income. She will use the loan to purchase ingredients to prepare food which will allow her to serve her customers. Gladis is the secretary of the group. She sells different products, such as: beauty products, shoes and clothing. Inb addition, she has a soda fountain where she displays her products. She has 2 children for who she has to work. Carmen is a podiatrist. She offers her services in home visits. She wants to open a locale where she serve her customers and she is getting a regular client base. All of the members are grateful for the loans and they wish to continue working with KIVA and EDAPROSPO.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es: Asunta es una mujer muy emprendedora empezó sus negocios con los prestamos de Edaprospo. Con mucho esfuerzo pudo aperturar una jugueria, además vio las necesidades de sus vecinos y aperturar un bazar donde vende diversos productos y regalos. Con el crédito obtenido lo invertirá en comprar algunos estantes para aperturar una ferretería,  La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cancelar sugun su cronograma. seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
Asunta is a very enterprising woman who started her business with loans from Edaprospo. With much effort she was able to open a juice bar. She also saw seomthing her neighbors' needed and opened a variety store where she sells diverse products and gifts. With the loan she will invest in buying some shelves to open a hardware store. This member is grateful for the loan and is committed to paying it off according to schedule. Edaprospo seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products.

loans.name: Geovanna

texts.es: La Sra. Geovanna es una cliente antigua de la institución, ella se dedica a vender artesanias y aretes artesanales en la calle Sagárnaga (La pintoresca calle de Sagarnaga es preferida de los turistas. Vienen en busca de souvenir típicos bolivianos que se venden en abundancia. Los artículos de lana de llamas, alpacas y vicuñas son especialmente cotizados. Hay una gran variedad de artículos de plata. Mientras más fino el trabajo, tanto más alto el precio. Hay originales artículos de estaño que van desde fosforeras hasta lujosos cubiertos de mesa. El estaño, hábilmente trabajado, tiene una muy buena presencia y, a diferencia de la plata, no se oscurece con el paso del tiempo), del centro de la ciudad de La Paz, comenzó desde muy jovencita con esta actividad ya que su mamá se dedica a este negocio, ahora ella tiene su propio capital y trabaja mucho para que su negocio vaya creciendo, tiene una pequeña hijita que la acompaña siempre, vive con su mamá, ambas se apoyan mucho. El crédito que solicita es para comprar tela de aguayo y lana para elaborar carteras y otros productos que ofrece en su puesto.
texts.en:
Geovanna is an old client of this institution. She sells hand crafts and handmade earrings on Sagarnaga Street (the picturesque Sagarnaga street is a tourist favourite. They come in search of typical Bolivian souvenirs that are sold in abundance. Wool items from llamas, alpacas and vicuñas [a llama relative] are especially sought after. There is a large variety of silver items; the finer the work, the higher the price. There are original tin items ranging from match holders to luxurious cutlery. The tin, neatly worked, is very strong and, in contrast to the silver, does not cloud with the passing of time). Sagarnaga Street is in the center of the city of La Paz. Geovanna started this activity when she was very young, since her mother did this work, and now Geovanna has her own resources and works a lot so that her business will grow. She has a young daughter who always accompanies her. Geovanna lives with her mother, and they both help her very much. The requested loan is for the purchase of multicoloured fabric and wool for making bags and other products that she offers at her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investment in the purchase of multicoloured fabric and wool

loans.name: Julia Victoria

texts.es:
Julia se dedica al trabajo de cerámica hace 15 años juntamente con su esposo, con mucho esfuerzo pudo conseguir clientes que obtengan sus productos como son
Bebederos y comederos para animales. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de productos que necesita para su trabajo. Nuestra socia está agradece el préstamo y se compromete a  hacer sus respectivos pagos en las fechas según su cronograma. seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
Julia has been working with pottery alongside her husband for 15 years. Through great effort she has gained customers for items such as feed and water troughs for animals. She will invest the loan in items she needs for her work. Our partner is grateful for the loan and commits herself to making payments on the dates listed in her repayment schedule. EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her business

loans.name: Nelsón

texts.es:
El señor Nelson M.M.es casado tiene 8 Hijos y una Hija, vive en la Compañía Cabañas de la ciudad de Caacupe.
 El  señor Nelson   es muy trabajador  tienen una despensa en su domicilio y también trabaja en un establecimiento ganadero y agrícola.
El tiene cría de ganado vacuno y de cerdo y tiene algunas plantaciones de yuca y otros cultivos de autoconsumo, y al mismo tiempo como tiene tractor realiza trabajos por hora. 
Solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento general de su maquinaria ya que le resulta muy rentable realizar trabajos con el.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo obtenido para su actividad  y mediante ello su negocio está creciendo brindando sus servicios y productos de buena calidad a la comunidad.
texts.en:
Nelson M.M.is married and has 8 sons and one daughter; he lives in Compañía Cabañas, Caacupe. Nelson is very hard working; he has a grocery store in his home and also works for an agricultural and cattle-raising firm. He raises cattle and pigs and has some manioc and other crops for self consumption; he also has a tractor that he uses to provide hourly work. He is requesting funds to provide general maintenance and service for his machinery because it’s quite profitable to do jobs with it. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the support given to his activities; thanks to it, his business providing services and quality products to the community has been growing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For tractor maintenance and repair

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: LA SRA. MARCELA VIVE EN LA ZONA DE VILLA ARMONÍA DESDE HACE MAS DE VEINTE AÑOS, EN LA CASA QUE SU MADRE LES DEJÓ LA CUAL QUE SE ENCUENTRA A 20 MINUTOS DEL CENTRO DE LA CUIDAD. ELLA TRABAJA EN UN INSTITUTO MÉDICO COMO SECRETARIA ADMINISTRATIVA, PERO ADEMÁS SE DEDICA A VENDER VÍVERES Y LENCERÍA A CRÉDITO. MARCELA Y SU ESPOSO, MIGUEL, TIENEN DOS HIJAS UNA QUE ES ADOLESCENTE Y LA MENOR DE UNOS TRES AÑOS DE EDAD. MIGUEL TRABAJA EN LA EDITORIAL DON BOSCO. MARCELA ES UNA PERSONA JOVEN Y MUY TRABAJADORA, ELLA VENDE SUS PRODUCTOS ESPECIALMENTE A SUS VECINOS Y COMPAÑEROS DE TRABAJO. UNO DE LOS MAYORES ANHELOS DE MARCELA ES VER A SUS HIJAS COMO PROFESIONALES Y ESE ES EL PRINCIPAL MOTIVO QUE LA LLEVA A TRABAJAR Y SER TAN RESPONSABLE CON SU FAMILIA Y SU TRABAJO. ELLA HA TRABAJADO CON NUESTRA INSTITUCION DESDE HACE DOS AÑOS, ANTERIORMENTE TRABAJÓ EN UN GRUPO LLAMADO RESPLANDECER PERO ESTA ASOCIACION SE SEPARÓ Y DESPUÉS TRABAJO DE FORMA INDIVIDUAL. EN TODO ESTE TIEMPO ELLA DEMOSTRÓ SER UNA PERSONA MUY PUNTUAL EN EL PAGO DE SUS CUOTAS, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA AL POR MAYOR. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Marcela lives in the Villa Armonia zone. For over 20 years she has lived in the home that her mother left her, which is 20 minutes from the city center. She works in a medical institute as an administrative secretary, and she also sells supplies and lingerie on credit. Marcela and her husband, Miguel, have two daughters; one is adolescent and the younger one is three years old. Miguel works at the Don Bosco Editorial. Marcela is a young, hard-working person. She sells her products especially to her neighbours and co-workers. One of her greatest wishes is to see her daughters as professionals, and this is the main motivation that brings her to work and makes her so responsible with her family and work. She has worked with our institution for two years. She previously worked in a group named Resplandecer, but this group separated and the members later worked alone. In all this time she has demonstrated herself to be a very punctual person with her repayments. With the requested loan she will buy wholesale merchandise. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence placed in her with the authorization of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy groceries and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Amigas Inseparables Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento  AMIGAS INSEPARABLES   conformado por 12 integrantes, 4 varones y 8 mujeres, los cuales los socios viven en el km6, en los siguientes barrios: B/ 31 de marzo, B/ fabril, B/  bajo Beni,  todos los socios cuentan con negocio como ser; venta de ropa, costurera, venta de hamburguesa, venta de cosméticos, las capacitaciones fueron de 4 días en la cual todas las socias asistieron, y de acuerdo a su historial crediticio ninguna socia esta sobre endeudada 

Este banco de emprendimiento esta formado por una mesa directiva que fue elegida por votación  

PRESIDENTA: Sra. María, nació en santa cruz el 18 de mayo de 1961, cuenta con el negocio de la venta de carteras hace 4 años en el km6, tiene 2 hijos lo cual convive con el Sr. Jorge García el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de mercadería al por mayor y así incrementar su capital de trabajo.

TESORERA: Sra. Marisol, nació en santa cruz  el 23/01/1986, cuenta con la venta de ropa hace 3 años  en santa cruz, la Sra. Marisol  es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en el km6 hace 21 años y el dinero del crédito será para el incremento de capital de trabajo.

SECRETARIO: Sr. Juan Carlos, nacido en la paz el 26 de junio de 1982, el es chofer propietario hace 5 años, tiene 2 hijos y convive con la Sra. Gabriela vive en el km6 hace 3 años.

El banco de emprendimiento AMIGAS INSEPARABLES están  muy agradecidos con emprender por haberles brindado nuevamente su apoyo.
texts.en:
The Amigas Inseparables (Inseparable Friends) enterprise bank is made up of 12 members, 4 men and 8 women, all of the partners live in Km6 in the following neighborhoods: 31 de marzo, Fabril and Bajo Benji. All the partners have their own businesses such as: clothing sales, tailor, hamburger sales and cosmetics sales. All the partners attended 4 days of training and according to their credit history none of them is over-indebted. This enterprise bank has an elected board of directors: President: María, born in Santa Cruz May 18th 1961, has had a purse sales business for 4 years in Km6, has 2 children and lives with Jorge García. She will use the loan money to purchase goods at wholesale in order to increase her working capital. Treasurer: Marisol, born in Santa Cruz Jan 23, 1986, has had a clothing sales business for 3 years in Santa Cruz. Marisol is single with no children, and has lived in Km6 for 21 years. She will use the loan to increase her working capital. Secretary: Juan Carlos, born in La Paz June 26 1982. He has been a driver-owner for 5 years, has 2 children and has lived with Gabriela in Km6 for the last 3 years. The Amigas Inseparables enterprise bank is deeply grateful to Emprender for having once again offered its support.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Working Capital

loans.name: Francisco Wilberto

texts.es:
Francisco Wilberto L. H., es casado y con su mujer habita en el barrio Medardo Andino, su esposa se desempeña como conserje, apoyando con sus ingresos a la economía del hogar, ellos tienen 3 hijos adolecentes que cursan la escuela secundaria, Don Francisco se desempeña como Guarda de Seguridad, ellos son una familia de recursos limitados que ambicionan con la apertura de una pulpería y la mejora de la infraestructura del hogar.

Con el apoyo de Kiva el Señor L., espera mejorar las condiciones en las que su familia actualmente habita, razon por la cual solicita este prestamo para las reparaciones de la habitación donde moran, las paredes y el techo presentan una decadencia que amenaza la seguridad e los miembros de la familia, con el préstamo desea comprar los materiales de construcción y así mismo construir una habitación màs, con el fin para mejorar las comodidades y condiciones en las que habitan, este apoyo les apura puesto que se acercan las temporadas de lluvias y vientos fuertes que debilitan aun más la estabilidad en la infraestructura  del hogar.
texts.en:
Francisco Wilberto L. H. is married, and lives with his wife in the Medardo Andino neighborhood. His wife works as a janitor, helping out with the household expenses. They have 3 adolescent children who are in secondary school. Don Francisco works as a security guard. They are a family of limited means that aspires to open a grocery store and improve the infrastructure of their home. With the support of Kiva, Señor L. hopes to improve the conditions in which the family currently lives. For this reason he requests this loan to repair their dwelling. The walls and roof are deteriorated such that they threaten the security of the members of the family. With the loan he hopes to buy construction materials and also add another room, in order to improve the comfort and conditions of the home that they live in. They need this support quickly, since the season of rain and strong winds is approaching, which would further weaken the stability of the infrastructure of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal for roofing and cement

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: El Sr. Jorge se dedica a rubro del transporte, tiene su movilidad con la que trabaja como taxi, vive en la zona de Valle de las Flores en una casita en alquiler, vive solo porque sus hijos se encuentran en el Brasil, y solo hablan por telefono, tiene muchos amigos y conocidos por la zona, es un cliente muy puntual, el crédito que solicita ahora es para hacer el mantenimiento general a su movilidad, le gusta tener su movilidad en buen estado para que trabaje bien, es una persona responsable y trabajadora siempre pensando en sus hijos y extrañandolos, pero su sueño es volver a ver a sus hijos, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito. .
texts.en:
Jorge works in transportation. He has his own vehicle and works with it as a taxi. He lives in the Valle de las Flores zone in a small rented home. He lives alone because his children are in Brazil, and they only talk on the phone. He has many friends and acquaintances in the area. He is a very punctual client. The requested loan is for the general maintenance of his vehicle. He likes to keep it in good shape so that it works well; he is a responsible and hard-working man, always thinking of his children and missing them. His dream is to see his children again. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence placed in him through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: he will invest in vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Martha Josefa

texts.es: LA SRA. JOSEFA TRABAJA CON NOSOTROS DESDE 2006, LA ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL QUE TIENE LA CLIENTE ES LA DE ATENDER SU KIOSCO DE COMIDA Y BARIOS PRODUCTOS UBICADO DE USO DOMESTICO SU PUESTO SE ENCUENTRA  UBICADO EN UNA DE LAS ACADEMIAS DE ESTUDIO MILITAR, ACTIVIDAD CON LA CUAL MANTIENE SU HOGAR QUE ESTA CONFORMADO POR SUS DOS HIJOS Y SU ESPOSO LOS HIJOS ESTAN ESTUDIANDO ACTUALMENTE Y EN SU TIEMPO LIBRE LA AYUDAN A LA MAMA YA QUE EL KIOSCO ES LA PRINCIPAL FUENTE DE INGRESOS PARA SOSTENER SU HOGAR, LA CLIENTE ES MUY RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA POR ESO QUE SE HIZO BENEFICIARIA DE LA TASA KIVA, LA SRA. JOSEFA ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO SE COMPRARA UNA CABINA TELEFONICA PARA SU PUESTO DE VENTA Y ASI TENER OTRO INGRESO MAS Y CON EL DINERO QUE LE SOBRA LO UTILIZARA EN LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA.
texts.en:
Josefa has worked with us since 2006. Her main work has been taking care of her kiosk that sells food and various household products and is located at one of the military academies. This enables her to maintain her household that is made up of her two children and husband. The children are currently studying and in their free time they help her with the kiosk, as it is the main source of income supporting the household. She is very responsible and hardworking and as a result has been awarded the Kiva rate. Mrs. Josefa is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the confidence they have shown in her through this loan. With the money from the loan she will buy a public telephone for her kiosk and thus will have more income. The left over money from the loan will be used to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a Public Telephone and Products for Kiosk

loans.name: Cosme

texts.es:
El señor Cosme A. M., tiene la edad 63 años con su señora esposa habita en la Comarca San José de los Ríos, ellos tiene 5 hijos, casados que se desempeñan en diferentes actividades, el señor Cosme se dedica a la agricultura y cuenta con más de 20 años de experiencia en este rubro.

El productor ha tenido la experiencia de cultivar diferente variedades de plantas y frutos, uno de los obstáculos que se le han presentado en el pasado, es el alza de los insumos agrícolas en los últimos años. Tomando en cuenta que sus tierras se encuentran en mal estado, es necesario hacer una fertilización foliar, con mejoras a las condiciones agrónomas y fitosanitarias, de tal manera que solicita un préstamo para la compra de matariles agrícolas, fertilizantes y pésticidas para brindarle un mantenimiento òptimo a los cultivos, y aporté a un aumento a las ventas, mejoras a su nivel de vida, y recursos economicos para proyecto a futuro que favorezca a toda la familia.
texts.en:
Cosme A. M., 63, lives with his wife in San José de los Ríos; they have 5 children who are married and in various occupations. Cosme is a farmer and has over 20 years experience in this line of work. He has grown a variety of fruits and plants. One of the obstacles he’s faced in the past is the rise in prices of farming supplies the last few years. Because his fields are in poor condition it’s necessary to apply fertilizers in order to improve soil and plant health. For this reason, he’s asking for funds to buy farming supplies, fertilizers and pesticides to provide optimum care to his crops in order to realize increased sales, improved living conditions and to have financial resources for future projects that will benefit the entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Naiyai Ole

texts.en:
Naiyai Ole M. is 52 years old. He is married to Ipanoi Ene M. and is the father of four school-aged children. Naiyai has been farming on his own piece of land for the last five years.

Naiyai learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend 50,000 KES to buy chemicals and fertilizer for his twenty acres of wheat. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to lease more land for farming to increase his wheat output and use some part of the profit to develop his plot.

His future dream is to be able to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can plant more wheat on a large scale. Naiyai believes he is hard working and, with the right resources at his disposal, he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and fertilizer for his 20 acres of wheat

loans.name: Tananko Ole

texts.en:
Tananko Ole B. is 35 years old. He is married to Nation Ene B. and is the father of three school-aged children. Tananko has been farming on his own piece of land for the last four years.

Tananko learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his first loan. He is planning to use it on his twenty acres of wheat, which is doing very well in this area. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to lease more land for farming to increase his wheat production.

His future dreams are to be able to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can plant more wheat for commercial purposes and to build a residential house for renting. Tananko is a hard working man and determined to reach his set goals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Koitamet Ole Lesire

texts.en:
Koitamet Ole Lesire T. is 41 years old. He is married to Sintei Ene T. and is the father of four children. Koitamet has been farming on his own piece of land for the last three years.

Koitamet learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a Kadet registered client. This will be his first loan. He plans to use it to buy pesticides and fertilizers to spray on his ten acres of wheat, which are doing very well in this area. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to lease more land for farming to increase his wheat production. 

His future dream is to be able to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can plant more wheat for commercial purposes and buy his own farm machinery. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his set goals.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers to spray on his ten acres of wheat

loans.name: Kony Alexander

texts.es:
La señora Kony Alexander C. C., de 29 años, habita con su pareja en el Barrio de Ticuantepe, ellos son una pareja muy joven que comienzan a labrar juntos su provenir, tiene 4 hijos que estudian la primaria secundaria, ella se dedica a la agricultura de piña.

Desde hace unos meses se le ha presentado una infección de plagas, que redujo la producción de la última cosecha, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra urgente de fertilizantes e insumos vegetativos que favorezcan a los terrenos,  garanticen la cosecha y de esta forma recuperar los recursos invertidos  para la reinversión de futuros proyectos, este préstamo ayudará a la familia debido a que sus hijos le demandan mayores necesidades que esperan suplirlas para un mejor porvenir.
texts.en:
Kony Alexander C. C., 29, lives with her partner in Ticuantepe neighborhood; they are a young couple who are just starting to work together for their future; she has 4 children in elementary and secondary school and she’s a pineapple farmer. There has been a pest infestation the last few months that reduced the previous harvest. For this reason she is asking for funding because it’s urgent that she get fertilizers and other farm supplies that will be of benefit to her fields thus guaranteeing a good harvest to recuperate her investment so that she will be able to reinvest in future projects. This loan will help the family because her children’s needs are growing and she hopes to provide them with a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and farming supplies for field maintenance.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: LA SRA. SONIA ESTA CASADA, VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO DISTANTE A 40 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ, TIENE 3 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA AL SERVICIO DE TAXI( TRANSPORTE DE PERSONAS), SU ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL ES LA VENTA DE ROPA EN EL MERCADO DE EL TORNO, SE DEDICA A ESTA ACTIVIDAD HACE VARIOS AÑOS, LA SRA. SONIA TIENE CASA PROPIA, MOTIVO POR EL CUAL SU ESPOSO Y ELLA TUVIERON  QUE TRABAJAR MUCHO YA QUE  LO ADQUIRIO MEDIANTE FINANCIAMIENTO, EL DESTINO DEL CAPITAL SOLICITADO ES PARA LA COMPRA DE ROPA DE INVIERNO YA QUE SE ESTA APROXIMANDO LA TEMPORADA, Y ELLA QUIERE COMPRAR CHAMARRAS Y CHOMPAS DE LANA; ES MUY TRABAJADORA SIEMPRE PENSANDO EN EL BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA, SU DESEO DE LA SRA. ES EL DE VER A SUS HIJAS PROFESIONALES Y EL PODER AMPLIAR SU CASITA, SE SIENTE AGRADECIDA CON LA INSTITUCION YA QUE LE HA BRINDADO EL APOYO FINANCIERO.
texts.en:
Sonia lives in the town of El Torno, about 40 km from the city of Santa Cruz. She is married and has 3 sons. Her husband is a taxi cab driver. Sonia's main activity is to sell clothes in the central market in El Torno. She has her own home, for which she had to work very hard since she acquired it through financing. She will use the sought after loan to buy winter clothes since the seasons are about to change. She is grateful for the opportunity offered her by this institution as it has offered her financial support without too much paperwork. She is a very hard-worker and is always thinking about the well-being of her family. She is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the confidence they have placed in her in granting her this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tania Mazumdar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing merchandise to sell

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El señor José P. C., vive con su compañera de vida en el Barrio de Planes de Arenal, tiene la edad de 49 años, su esposa labora como doméstica, sin embargo en los tiempos libre le apoya a su esposo quien es agrícola, sembrador de yuca desde hace 31 años. Ellos son una familia de 5 hijos, dos de ellos son casados y los menores estudian la escuela secundaria.

Dentro de los planes a futuro está la diversificación de los cultivos, debido a que existen cultivos que se consumen en masa y desean aprovechar el consumo, por este proyecto es que solicitan un préstamo para la preparación de los terrenos,  el crédito lo solicitan para la compra de materiales agrícolas tales como fertilizantes, pesticidas, insumos vegetativos y compra de semillas, este préstamo los preparara a futuro para la inclusión de nueva producción que los favorezca económicamente y aporte a las condiciones de habitad de la familia.
texts.en:
José P. C., 49, lives with his life partner in Planes de Arenal neighborhood; his wife is a domestic employee and helps her husband with his farming chores in her spare time. He has been a manioc farmer for 31 years. They have five children, two of whom are married; the younger ones are in secondary school. Among his plans for the future is crop diversification because there are certain crops that are mass consumed and they want to take advantage of this. They are asking for funds for this project to prepare the fields. They need to buy fertilizers, pesticides, farming supplies and seed. This loan will set them up to include new production in the future that will be of economic benefit to them and contribute to improved living conditions for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam, de  30 años, vive con su esposo y su hija en la casa de uno de sus familiares.Desde hace 5 años ofrece el servicio de fotocopiadora en un local ubicado cerca de su casa, tiene su propia  máquina fotocopiadora, que es la  herramienta vital para su negocio. También ofrece el servicio de redacción de documentos ,que realiza con la computadora que hace unos meses adquirió, su esposo  la apoya en el desarrollo de esta actividad, y muchas veces la reemplaza durante sus ratos libres. Miriam disfruta de realizar este trabajo porque le permite tener tiempo para atender a su  pequeña hija, y con el paso de los años ha notado  que su negocio es muy rentable por lo que planea para más adelante implementarse de varias maquinarias nuevas, para producir en mayor cantidad.Es la octava vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será  muy responsable con sus pagos, además agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de millares de hojas para continuar imprimiendo, además pagará  el mantenimiento  de su fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
Miriam, 30, lives with her husband and daughter in a relative’s house. She has had a business providing photocopying services in a locale located near her home; she owns her own photocopier which is the essential piece of machinery for her business. She also writes documents using a computer that she got a few months ago. Her husband helps her with her work and sometimes fills in for her when he has spare time. Miriam enjoys her work because it leaves her free to care for her daughter. As time has passed, she has noticed that the business can be quite profitable so she plans to install new equipment in order to increase production. This is her 8th loan with MFP and she pledges to be very responsible with her repayments. She is grateful to all the people that made the loan possible because it will be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the requested funds to buy paper sheets by thousand units to continue printing as well as to pay for service maintenance of her photocopier.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paper for her business and to pay for photocopier service maintenance.

loans.name: Jasmines Group

texts.es:
Banco de emprendimiento LOS JASMINES, esta formado por 11 integrantes, el la cual son 9 mujeres y 2 varones, todos los socios viven en el torno, el siguientes barrios: B/ 6 de mayo, B/ mira flores, B/ villa feliz, todos cuentan con negocio como ser: licorería, venta de cosméticos, venta de charque, venta de refresco   
La capacitación de este banco de emprendimiento  fue de 3 días  lo cual todas las socias asistieron a las reuniones. 

Este banco de emprendimiento esta formado por una mesa directiva lo cual fue elegida por todas las socias 

PRESIDENTA: La Sra. Celia, nació en Cochabamba el 19/02/1986, cuenta con el negocio de licorería hace 3 años, tiene 1 hijo la cual ella es madre soltera, vive en el torno hace 5 años, el crédito que solicito es para comprar mas mercadería, como ser: Cerveza en lata, Singani Chapaco y Variedad de refrescos y asi poder surtir su licoreria, es una persona muy trabajadora esta desde las dos de la tarde hasta las tres de la madrugada porque en ese horario es donde mas venta tiene.

TESORERA: La Sra. Leidy, nació en el torno  el 11 de julio de 1989, cuenta con el negocio de licorería hace 3 años, la Sra. Leidy  es soltera, y vive en el torno hace 9 años, el crédito que solicito es para comprar mas mercadería como refrescos, Papas fritas, mani salado y hielo para surtir su licoreria y así poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

La SECRETARIA: es la Sra. Lucila, nació en el torno  El 31 de octubre de 1990, cuenta con el negocio de licorería, la Sra. Lucila  es soltera, y vive en el torno hace 5 años, el crédito que ella solicito es para  aumentar su capital de trabajo, las tres socias se dedican a esta actividad, de este modo se conocieron y entamblaron una muy buen aamistad.

El Banco de Emprendimiento LOS JASMINES le esta muy agradecido con emprender por ayudarlos a seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The Los Jasmines lending bank is composed of 11 members; 9 women and 2 men. They all live in Torno, in the following neighborhoods: 6 de Mayo; Mira Flores; Villa Feliz. They run businesses such as: liquor stores, cosmetics sales, meat jerky sales, and drink sales. The training for this lending bank lasted 3 days and all of the members attended the meetings. This lending bank is made up of a board of directors which was elected by all of the members. PRESIDENT: Celia, born in Cochamamba on 19/02/1986, has had a liquor store for 3 years. She has one child and is a single mother. She has lived in El Torno for 5 years. Her loan is for the purchase of more merchandise, like: cans of beer, Chapaco brand Singani [Singani is the national spirit of Bolivia], and different types of sodas in order to offer a wider range of products. She is a very hard-working woman who is in her store from 2pm to 3am, since sales are best between those hours. TREASURER: Leidy, born in Torno on July 11 1989, has had a liquor store for 3 years. She is single and has lived in Torno for 9 years. Her loan is for the purchase of merchandise, like sodas, potato chips, salted peanuts and ice so that she can better serve her clients by offering a wider range of products. The SECRETARY: Lucila, born in Torno on October 31, 1990, has a liquor store. She is single and has lived in El Torno for 5 years. The loan is to increase her working capital. These three members all do the same work, and this is how they know each other. The Los Jasmines lending bank is very grateful to be borrowing to help them continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer, sodas, singani and snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy basic needs products

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 51 años, vive con su hija en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la crianza de animales, específicamente cría cerdos que después de varios meses vende como lechones. Con la comercialización de  la carne de cerdo obtiene considerables ganancias, en esta labor  la ayuda su hija, además  paralelamente a esta actividad se dedica a la venta de comida  en días de feria comercial por la zona donde vive. La comercialización de animales le ha resultado beneficiosa por lo que continuara  en esta actividad  con la meta firme de tener  más capital, para continuar progresando.Es la quinta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será  muy responsable con el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, además agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible  el préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Luz tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de más cantidad de cerdos para mejorar  su  granja.
texts.en:
Luz, 51, lives in her own house with her daughter. For the last 10 years she has worked raising animals, particularly raising pigs that she sells as suckling pigs a few months later. With the business of selling pork, she, with her daughter’s help, makes a good profit. A parallel business that she has is selling prepared food on market days in the area where she lives. The animal raising business has proven profitable and she will continue with the firm goal of having more capital, so that she can continue progressing. This is the fifth loan that she has had with MFP, and she promises that she will be very responsible with each payment. She would also like to thank all the people who make this possible: the loan that will be so useful in the growth of her business. Luz is planning on using the money to buy more pigs to improve her farm.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more pigs for her business

loans.name: Los Sauces Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Los Sauces”, está conformada por 9 socias quienes se desempeñan en labores D. comercio minorista e informal, trabajan con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desD. hace 6 años.
Julia, mujer emprendedora y entusiasta, actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta, tiene 32 años,  es soltera.
DesD. hace 3 años se dedica a la venta D. comida en un restaurante, se inicio ayudando a su madre, ya que el negocio es D. ella. Con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria ha logrado ponerse a estudiar una carrera. El gran sueño D. Julia es tener su propio negocio y crecer como empresaria.
El reciente préstamo, Julia lo destinará en el pago D. sus estudios. Agradecen el financiamiento para sus actividades comerciales y seguirán cumpliendo con sus pagos puntualmente.
texts.en:
The Alcancia Comunal "Los Sauces" is maD. up of 9 partners who engage in informal retail work. They have worked with EDAPROSPO - Prosperidad for the past 6 years. Julia, entrepreneur and enthusiast, currently assumes the position of president. She is 32 years old and single. For the past 3 years, she has sold food at a restaurant. She started by helping her mother, who owns the business. With Julia's daily efforts, she has managed to pursue her studies for a career. Julia's ultimate dream is to have her own business and grow as a businesswomen. Julia will use the recent loan to pay for her studies. They are grateful for the financing of their commercial activities, and they will continue making repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Tania Mazumdar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education Expenses

loans.name: Enita Lili

texts.es:
Enita de 45 años, vive en una zona urbana de Guayaquil, tiene tres hijos de 17, 14, 5 años que aun estudian, empezó a coser por la falta de dinero hace 17 años atrás después de tener su primer bebe, poco a poco fue incrementando su capital y pudo remplazar su maquina vieja con una nueva. 

Ahora trabaja desde muy temprano hasta que termine todos los pedidos del día, Enita cose ropa, borda y confecciona ropa. Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas y hilos para su taller de costura. 

En el futuro quiere una casa propia y tener hay mismo su taller de costura.
texts.en:
Enita is 45 years old. She lives in an urban area of Guayaquil. She has three children; 17, 14, and 5 years old. The children go to school. After having her first baby 17 years ago, she started to sew because she needed money. Little by little she was increasing her capital, and she was able to replace her old machine with a new one. Now she works from very early in the morning until she finishes the day’s orders. Enita sews clothes, embroiders, and makes clothes. With the loan she wants to buy fabric and thread for her seamstress shop. In the future she wants her own house and to have her seamstress shop in the house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric and thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the “anticrético” (a special type of rental arrangement in Bolivia) of a house

loans.name: Fiorela

texts.es: Fiorela, de  25 años, vive con su abuelita en su casa que es propia.Desde hace mas de 2 años se dedica a la venta de cerveza en el local que tiene en su casa  y en ocasiones también prepara platos típicos, que son la delicia de sus comensales; este trabajo lo realiza durante  los fines de semana. Los días viernes en la noche se alista para que su local de ventas  quede  listo para recibir a sus clientes, en ocasionas en su labor la ayuda su abuela y también algunas de sus amistades. Este negocio le ha resultado bastante rentable por lo que su deseo es incrementar su capital de trabajo.Es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será  muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, además agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Fiorela tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de más cajas de cerveza.
texts.en:
25-year old Fiorela lives with her grandmother in a house which she owns. Her job is selling beer from her house (she’s been doing this for more than two years) and sometimes also she makes local dishes which everyone loves. She does this at weekends. On Friday evenings she does all the preparations so that everything is ready for her customers. Sometimes her grandmother helps her and sometimes her friends do the same. Fiorela’s business has proved very profitable so she wishes to obtain more working capital. This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with her repayments. She is grateful to all those people who make the loan possible as it will be very useful in helping her business grow. The money will be used to buy more cases of beer.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cases of beer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy children's clothes.

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros, "lord Of Miracles" Group

texts.es:
Irene tiene una bodega en su casa por mas D. 15 años, su negocio lleva por nombre” BODEGA  YACKY” aun recuerda cuando recién llego a  su zona  D. residencia, era un lugar donD. no había  luz ni agua, habían muy pocas casas  pero al ver que poco a poco se iba poblando y la  necesidad D. la gente aumentaba decidió implementar en su casa un lugarcito, empezó  vendiendo marcianos (helados) y gaseosas después se abasteció D. otras cosas según le iban pidiendo,  logrando  así en la actualidad  tener una bodega mas granD.  junto a esto ha podido ahorrar y construir su casa donD. esta proyectando instalar otra tienda para poner una bodega  minimarket y  también quiere concretar otro negocio D. venta D. frutas. Actualmente esta incursionando en la venta D. cervezas al por mayor las que reparte para actividades sociales, Irene se siente feliz por que gracias a los prestamos D. EDAPROSPO ella ha visto crecer su negocio con sus anteriores prestamos pudo comprarse una congeladora, exhibidora y  refrigeradora lo que es indispensable para su negocio, en esta oportunidad usara su préstamo para comprar cervezas y seguir en el negocio que hace poco ha iniciado ,el grupo que ella conforma se llama “SEÑOR D. LOS MILAGROS” y esta feliz D. pertenecer al grupo .

*a Sra. Irene es la cuarta D. las paradas(D. izq.a derecha)
texts.en:
Irene has had a small store in her house for more than 15 years. Her business is called "Bodega Yacky."
