Sales are excellent on some days and mediocre on others, but she does not stop selling. With their savings, she and her husband have set up a house, but they still need to add rooms because it is small. With this loan, Martha would like to increase her inventory in staple grains, candy, and cartons of milk, as well as clothing and shoes. Her aim is to attract new customers and earn enough to cover her children's basic and personal needs while expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying staple grains, candy, clothing and shoes to attract new clients and expand her business

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata N. est une femme de 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfants et tutrice de 3 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et a 4 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit qui lui permette de développer un petit commerce de parfum et de crèmes glacées. Avec son crédit elle va renforcer son approvisionnement afin d'augmenter sa production et générer plus de bénéfices et participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aminata N. is 41 years old, married and the mother of one child. She is also the tutor of three other children entrusted to her by close friends. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” loan group for the past two years, and has already been granted four successive loans, which enabled her to develop a small business selling perfume and ice cream. Her loan will enable her to increase her supplies and her production, and consequently her earnings, and participate in improving her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her revenue-geerating activity

loans.name: Ndiémé

texts.fr: Ndiémé F. est âgée de 34 ans, elle mariée et mère de 4 enfants et tutrice de 3 autres enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 18 septembre 2006 et a 7 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et son crédit lui permettra d'acheter une paire de bœufs et de l'aliment de bétail pour engraisser les sujets et les revendre au bout de 5 mois. Elle participe aux différentes charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Ndiémé F. is 34 years old, married and the mother of four children. She is also the tutor of three other children. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” loan group since 18 September 2006, and has already been granted seven successive loans. Her business is fattening cattle. Her loan will enable her to buy a pair of oxen and cattle feed. She will then fatten her stock for resale after five months. She participates in the family’s daily expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a pair of oxen for fattening

loans.name: Claudia Milena

texts.es:
Claudia  Milena O. P. ,  es una mujer casada que tiene un hijo de 6 años  de edad y vive en el barrio Palermo Norte, en la ciudad de Bogotá, la capital de Colombia. La máxima expresión de Claudia Milena  es  diseñar y confeccionar ropa femenina con una calidad inigualable; esta es la razón por la que está solicitando un crédito por valor de $2.300.000  para comprar una maquina  collarín y adecuar una puerta para el local de su boutique, porque Claudia   Milena además de tener su propio  taller, también tiene una unidad de comercialización de la ropa que fabrica y asi mismo vende accesorios femeninos. Su negocio está funcionando desde el año  2003 en un sitio bien  ubicado   comercialmente  y a través de él está generando un empleo directo.

Este es su sexto crédito con la Fundación Mario  Santo Domingo  y con ello ha logrado fortalecer su negocio gradualmente,  especialmente ha podido comprar de contado a sus proveedores y con ello adquierir importantes descuentos, por eso su precio de venta es muy aceptado por sus clientes.  Claudia Milena sueña con viajar y  extender su negocio quiere que crezca para ayudar a su familia y lograr posicionamiento a nivel local y también nacional; esto es justamente su gran desafío.
texts.en:
Claudia Milena O. P. is married and has a six year old son. She lives in the neighborhood of Palermo Norte in the city of Bogotá, the capital of Columbia. Claudia Milena designs and makes women's clothing of unebeatable quality. This is the reason she is asking for a loan of $2,300,000. She would like to buy a sewing machine and add a door to the premises of her boutique. Claudia Milena, in addition to having her own workshop, also has a store to sell the clothes she makes. The store also sells women's acessories. Her business has been operating since 2003 in a well located commercial site and through it, she generates direct employment. This is her sixth loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and with these loans she has gradually succeeded in strengthening her business. She is able to pay her suppliers in cash and therefore get important discounts, so her sale prices are very acceptable to her clients. Claudia Milena dreams of traveling and expanding her business. She would like the business to grow in order to help her family and achieve recognition on a local and national level. This is her big challenge.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine and add a door to her store

loans.name: Lakk's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of five people who live in Deum Kor village in Kandal Province, led by Mrs. Lakk M., who sells pillows door to door to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it and so is seeking a loan to buy cotton and cloth to make more pillows to sell. Her husband, Mr. Sinat Sen, is a soldier who receives a modest salary. They have three children who are attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy cotton and cloth to make pillows to sell

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Just like other members of the ASHI center where 35-year-old Esperanza P. is a member, she also raises pigs in her backyard for breeding and fattening. Once her gilt (mother pig) gives birth, piglets will be raised and fattened for four months and thereafter sold either alive or slaughtered. Loans she avails of through her membership in ASHI finance the purchase of food and required vaccinations for her piglets and pigs until they are grown and ready to be disposed. Profit she gains out of this business is a great help in supporting her dream of uplifting her family's standard of living.

Esperanza’s husband is a village councilor, and his honorarium received every month is too small to cover the needs of his family, especially once their three children, whose ages now are from 8 to 11, have to go to college. With that, Esperanza’s ability to avail of loans through ASHI is a great opportunity for her to grow her small backyard hog-breeding business into a piggery. Some of her proceeds will be saved to finance her ambition of building a concrete house for the safety of her family.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and food for fattening and breeding them

loans.name: Ngaet

texts.en: Mrs. Ngaet M. is 35 years old and is a villager who lives in Angk Village in the province of Kandal. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice, while her husband, Mr. San Sao, is a cow middleman who can earn a little income to support his family. For the farm, Mrs. Ngaet M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to support her farming crop. This couple has four children who all are students in the local school and also support their mother's farming. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Charim's Group

texts.en: This group loan is made up of four people in Lekh Pram village in the province of Kandal. Mrs. Charim T. is the group leader, selected by all the members, each of whom will use the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Lach Koem Phey, are farmers who own a small piece of land to grow crops to sell in order to support their family. Their problem is that their field is infertile. So to improve production, Mrs. Charim T. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. She is the mother of a child who is seven months old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Bopha

texts.en: Mrs. Bopha S. is 38 years old and she lives in Prey Ta Thok-ID village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, she also tailors at home while her husband, Mr. Sengly Prum, is a construction worker. With these careers, they earn a small income to support their family. Mrs. Bopha S. is now requesting a loan to buy cement and timber to make a kitchen for her family. This couple has four children who are all students in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy cement and timber

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Somaly's Group

texts.en: Four people from Preak Raing village in Kandal province make up this group loan. All the members will use the loan for different purposes to help improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. Somaly S. is the group leader, and she has been selected by all the members. She is a house wife who makes delicious food to support her family and to help her husband, Mr. Kim Sang Yeng, who is a security guard. Her problem is that her motorbike is too old to use. So to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Somaly S. is seeking a loan to buy a new motorbike. She is a mother and her child  is enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en: Mr. Vanny H. is 35 years old and lives in Roleang Kaen village in Kandal province. He is the leader of this group loan, and was selected by its 4 members. Each member of this group loan will use the loan to support their different purposes. Mr. Vanny H. and his wife are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, Mr. Vanny H. also makes sugar palm so he can earn a small income to support his family. In order to increase his income to improve his family's living conditions, Mr. Vanny H. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. All of the couple's three children attend school.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Khoeun Thy Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eleven people from Cheung Prey village in Kandal province make up this group loan. Mrs. S. Khoeun T. is the village bank president. She was selected by all the members, who will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. S. Khoeun T. is a house wife who cooks delicious food for her children and her husband, Mr. Savoeurn S., who is a motorbike taxi driver. Although they try to work hard they are currently earning less income because their motorbike is broken. So to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. S. Khoeun T. is seeking a loan to fix her motorbike. She is a mother of two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To fix her motorbike.

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es: Ricardo Antonio M. L. de 49 años de edad, reside en El Transito, ubicado en el departamento de San Miguel, lugar en el cual vive junto a su compañera de vida la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Ricardo se dedica a la reparación de todo tipo de calzado, ya sea formal o deportivo, así mismo trabaja lustrando zapatos. Él se encuentra ubicado con su puesto a las afueras del mercado de El Transito, donde ya posee muchos años de estar, por lo que casi todas las personas del lugar lo conocen, así mismo esto le permite contar con varios clientes los cuales llegan a reparar sus zapatos o a lustrarlos, Ricardo es un señor muy trabajador y responsable quien realiza un excelente trabajo, así mismo es muy cordial y amigable. Él solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar pega de zapatos, tachuelas, suelas, tapitas para los tacones y todos los recursos necesarios para la reparación de calzado. Esto lo hace con el deseo de poder brindar un mejor servicio, de manera que más personas puedan solicitar su servicio y así mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ricardo Antonio M. Lopez, 49, lives in El Transito, in the Salvadoran "departamento" of San Miguel, with his life partner who takes care of their home. Ricardo makes a living repairing all kinds of shoes, from dress shoes to sneakers. He also shines shoes. He sets up his stand just outside the El Transito market, a site that he has used for many years and where he is well known among local people. Because he is well known in the area, he can count on certain customers coming to him over and over for shoe repairs or shoe shines. Ricardo is a hard-working and responsible man who understands the importance of providing a good service to his customers, service that is friendly and welcoming. He is applying for a loan so that he can buy glue, tacks, soles and the other supplies that he needs for the business. With the supplies, he will be able to provide a better service to his customer and, in turn, increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for shoe repair business.

location.town: El Transito, departamento de San Miguel

loans.name: Blanca Daysi

texts.es: Blanca Daysi C. D. M. D. 30 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y su hijo D. 3 años D. edad. Blanca posee una venta D. frutas y verduras, la cual esta ubicada en el mercado D. Jiquilisco, siempre ubicado en el departamento D. Usulután. Su esposo también trabaja en el negocio ayudándole por las tardes a atender el puesto, y por las mañanas se dedica a vender las frutas y verduras en un pick up, las cuales comercializa D. forma ambulante por diferentes pueblos, cantones y mesones del lugar. Blanca solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar frutas y verduras por mayor, D. manera que las pueda obtener a precios más bajos, D. esta manera también podrá surtir a otras personas las cuales posean una venta un poco más pequeña y quienes le comprarían a Blanca por mayor. Este e un negocio familiar, que tanto Blanca como su esposo desean sacar adelante por el bienestar D. su familia, sobretodo D. su pequeño hijo al cual esperan darle todo lo mejor y necesario en la vida.
texts.en:
Blanca Daysi C. D. M., 30, lives in the Salvadoran "departamento" of Usulutan with her husband and their 3 year old son. Blanca owns a fruit and vegetable business that she operates in the Jiquilisco market in Usulutan. Her husband also works for the business, tending their stand in the afternoons and delivering fruits and vegetables, by truck, in the mornings. He delivers their produce from door to door, going to local restaurants and even to surrounding towns. Blanca is applying for a loan so that she can buy wholesale supplies of fruits and vegetables, something that will allow her to buy them at a relatively low price. She will then be able to sell the produce on to slightly smaller businesses that will buy wholesale supplies from her. This is a family business and Blanca's husband wants to get ahead as much as she does. They are working for the well-being of their family and especially their young son who they want to proviD. for in every way they can.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies of fruits and vegetables for produce business.

loans.name: Almabelen

texts.en:
60 year-old Almabelen V. is a hardworking and caring mother to her two children. The only dream she has been pursuing for her children is a college degree and a stable source of income. Her children now are 29 and 31 years old. Unfortunately, they were not able to reach college and employment.

Instead of feeling lost and disappointed, Almabelen tried to find a way to support the needs of her children. She joined ASHI in 2008 and has able to receive a loan since then and has put up her own small sari-sari store (sari-sari is a Tagalog term for a small variety store selling goods or an assortment of grocery items, foodstuffs, and beverages).

Aside from having a sari-sari store, Almabelen and her eldest son cultivate a small parcel of farm land in their backyard for growing vegetables to sell in the market and/or to the people in their village through their sari-sari store.

These small businesses that Almabelen is in are a great source of financial support for her family and children. Therefore, she wishes these to grow them further and gain more profit to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her sari-sari store and fertilizer for her vegetable farming business

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es: Gloria Esperanza C. A. de 38 años de edad, reside en el pueblo de Cojutepeque, ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su esposo el cual se dedica a trabajar como albañil, trabajo el cual es por temporadas mientras dura la obra que están construyendo, así mismo vive junto a sus tres hijos de 17, 12 y 8 años de edad. Gloria es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual se dedica a la venta de cortinas, sabanas, manteles y otros más, los cuales comercializa de forma ambulante, lo que es de mucho beneficio para ella ya que le permite abarcar diferentes zonas, por lo que vende más, su hijo mayor la acompaña a vender sus productos lo que es muy positivo para ella, ya que pueden cargar mayor cantidad de cortinas, sabanas y manteles. Es por medio de esta venta como Gloria logra solventar todos los gastos familiares, incluso en los momentos en que su esposo carece de trabajo. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos de manera que sus ventas aumenten ya que no solo es este su objetivo sino también contar con los recursos necesario para poder conectar el agua potable a su hogar, ya que en la actualidad no cuentan con ese servicio lo que los obliga a ir a un chorro público y llevar el agua en cantaros sobre la cabeza hasta su hogar, esto les beneficiará ya que les permitirá contar con algo tan necesario y esencia que es el agua.
texts.en:
Gloria Esperanza C. A., 38, lives in the town of Cojutepeque in the Salvadoran "departamento" of Cuscatlan. She lives there with her husband, a construction worker, who works during the time of year when building projects are viable. They have three children, 17-, 12- and 8-years old. Gloria is a hard-working woman who operates a business selling curtains, sheets, tablecloths, etc. She works as a street vendor, an advantage for her because she can move from place to place and sell more of her products as she goes. Her son works with her, another advantage because together they can carry more curtains, sheets, etc. than she can carry alone. The business has made it possible for Gloria to pay the family's bills even when her husband has been unable to find work. She is applying for a loan so that she can buy wholesale supplies of her products and, in turn, increase her income. Increasing her income is not only an end in itself, but also her means for pulling together the money she needs to connect the family's house to a source of clean water. For now, the house isn't connected to a supply of clean water and the family has to get its water from a public pump and carry it home in jugs. The loan will help the family hugely because they will ultimately be able to use it to get something essential to everyone: clean water.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Silvia Leonor

texts.es: Silvia Leonor A. D. de 37 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos de 16, 18 y 13 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, así mismo vive junto a un sobrino, con los cuales reside en Ilopango, departamento de San Salvador. Silvia es una madre soltera, la cual trabaja muy duro con el enorme deseo de salir adelante junto a su familia, la cual depende por completo del trabajo de ella, en el cual debe buscar diferentes alternativas para mejorarlo y poder brindarle estudios, alimentación, hogar y todo lo necesario con lo que un niño debe contar. Silvia trabaja comercializando perfumes, cremas para el cuerpo y el cuidado del cabello, así mismo vende maquillaje, su venta esta ubicada en su casa de habitación, y así mismo en algunas ocasiones sale a ofrecer sus productos haciendo visitas de casa en casa, todo con el deseo de poder mejorar sus ventas. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral con la esperanza de poder comprar mayor cantidad de productos, en diferentes marcas y de esta forma ofrecer diferentes precios, todo con el deseo de poder contar siempre con las ganancias necesarias para sostener su hogar.
texts.en:
Silvia Leonor A. D. is 37 years old. She lives with her three children; ages 16, 18, and 13. They go to school. She also lives with a nephew. They live in Ilopango in the San Salvador department. Silvia is a single mother. She works very hard with an enormous desire to get ahead with her family. They are completely dependent upon her work. She needs to look for different ways to improve her work and to be able to provide an education, food, a home, and all of the necessities that a child should have. Silvia works selling perfume, body creams, and hair care products. She also sells make-up. Her business is located in her house. She sometimes sells door to door. She does all of this with the desire to be able to improve her sales. She is requesting a loan from Integral in the hopes of being able to buy a greater quantity of different brands of products. That way she can offer different prices. This is all with the wish to be able to always count on the earnings that are needed to support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume and cosmetics

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: Ana Mercedes H. D. H. 47 años D. edad, resiD. en Apopa, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Su grupo familiar esta conformado por su esposo el cual trabaja como agente D. la Policía Nacional Civil, un trabajo bastante arriesgado pero muy necesario para su hogar. María posee un puesto D. frutas y verduras en el mercado D. municipal D. Soyapango, en el cual venD. su producto por unidad y al mayoreo, ella cuenta con muchos clientes sobre todo  las personas que poseen comedores en el mismo mercado las cuales compran ahí porque María venD. las verduras a muy buenos precios. Es por esto que María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. frutas y verduras, ya que ella quiere comprar al por mayor para poder comprar a precios menores y vender aún más barato. Esto es D. mucha importancia para ella ya que le permite percibir mayores ganancias lo cual beneficia a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Mercedes H. D. H. is 47 years old and lives in Apopa, located in the region of San Salvador. Her family includes her husband, who works as a police officer in the National Civil Police. This job is quite risky, but very necessary for their household. Ana Mercedes owns a fruit and vegetable stand in the municipal market in Soyapango in which she sells her products by unit and wholesale. She has many customers, including people who sell prepared food in the same market. They buy from Ana Mercedes because she sells her vegetables at very good prices. Ana Mercedes is asking for a loan in order to buy a larger quantity of fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices, so she can buy them for lower prices and then sell them more affordably. This is very important to her since it will allow her to earn more money, which will benefit her family.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa L. H. de 42 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos, un hijo de 16 años y una hija de 19 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, residen en el municipio de Ilopango, ubicado en San Salvador, en la capital del país. Teresa posee una venta de productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas para el cuerpo y cosméticos, así mismo comercializa ropa y zapatos, los cuales vende en su casa y de esta misma manera vende de forma ambulante. Ella es una mujer muy admirada en su colonia por sus vecinos, ya que siempre ha sido una persona que se ha esforzado por darles una vida digna a sus hijos, por lo cual ha luchado ella sola para salir adelante. Teresa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de productos de belleza, los cuales ella pueda adquirir por mayor, así mismo que pueda comprarlos al contado, ya que Teresa ofrece a crédito sus productos, razón por la que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para comprar todo lo anteriormente mencionado por mayor. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo de crecer en su negocio y así mismo mejorar la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
Teresa L. H. is 42 years old and resides in the town of Ilopango, which is located in San Salvador, the capital of El Salvador. She lives with her two children, a 16 year old son and a 19 year old daughter, who are both students. Teresa has a business selling beauty products such as perfumes, body crèmes, and cosmetics, as well as clothing and shoes. She operates her business out of her house and also sells her products as a traveling vendor. Teresa is a woman who is greatly admired in the area by her neighbors because she has always tried to provide a decent life for her children and has struggled by herself to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan so that she can have the necessary funds to purchase a large quantity of beauty products. Teresa offers her customers the option to pay for their orders on credit, which is why she does not have enough money to buy products in bulk. Everything she does stems from her desire to grow her business and improve her household finances.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products in bulk

loans.name: Gabriel Antonio

texts.es: Gabriel Antonio M. A. de 47 años de edad, reside en el pueblo de San Juan Opico ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Él posee un negocio en el cual se dedica a la reparación de calzado, puesto el cual esta ubicado en el mercado de Santa Tecla, en el departamento de calzado. El es un hombre muy responsable el cual cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de todos sus vecinos, ya que lo reconocen como una persona muy trabajadora quien cuenta con el deseo de salir adelante. Gabriel vive únicamente junto a su madre de 79 años de edad, una de las mayores razones por las que Gabriel lucha día con día para brindarle todos los cuidados necesarios que ella necesita. Él solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder contar con la capacidad económica para comprar todo tipo de repuestos para zapatos como: suelas, tapitas, tachuelas, pega, hilos y otros más esto lo hace con el deseo de poder aprovechar la temporada de lluvia en la cual Gabriel ve aumentada su clientela.
texts.en:
Gabriel Antonio M. A. is 47 years old and resides in the town of San Juan Opico, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. He operates a shoe repair business from a stand in the market in Santa Tecla, which is also in the Department of La Libertad. Gabriel is a responsible gentleman who has excellent references from all of his neighbors. In addition, they recognize him as a hardworking person who has the desire to succeed. Gabriel lives with his 79 year old mother, who is one of the reasons why he struggles every day since he tries to provide her with the necessary care that she needs.

He is requesting a loan so that he will be financially able to purchase all types of shoe parts and supplies such as soles, tops, tacks, glue, thread, and other items. What he wants most is to take advantage of the rainy season, since he receives more customers during this time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for repairing shoes

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Denis Leonel

texts.es: Denis Leonel G. C. de 26 años de edad, reside en el pueblito de Panchimalco ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa la cual le ayuda con el negocio y así mismo se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, así mismo vive junto a sus 3 hijos de 12, 8 años de edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar, y la menor la cual es una bebé de 8 meses de edad. Denis posee un puesto ubicado en el mercado municipal de Santa Tecla, en donde comercializan frutas, sobretodo melones, los cuales se venden bastante. Denis trabaja junto a su esposa con el deseo de poder brindarles a sus hijos una vida mejor como la que ellos tuvieron, en la cual cuenten con todo lo básico y necesario para una vida digna. Es por esta razón que el solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda comprar manzanas por mayor, ya que es esta la mayor temporada de estas en este país, y a las cuales se les puede obtener un poco más de ganancias. Denis desea con todo su corazón el poder aumentar sus ventas y de esta forma mejorar su vida familiar económicamente hablando.
texts.en:
Denis Leonel G. C. is 26 years old and resides in the tiny village of Panchimalco, which is located in the Department of San Salvador. He lives with his wife who helps with his business and is also in charge of the household chores. They have three children. The two older children, ages 12 and 8, attend school while the youngest child is only eight months old.

Denis manages a vending post at the municipal market in Santa Tecla where he sells fruits, especially melons, which are in great demand. He and his wife work together because they want to provide their children with a better life than they had. They hope to give them all the basic necessities so that they can have a decent life. For this reason, Denis is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can buy apples in bulk since this is the best time of the year to buy them in El Salvador. This will allow him to generate a little more income. He hopes with all of his heart to increase his sales and improve his family’s financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase apples in bulk

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es: Cecilia del Carmen A. Z. de 34  años de edad, reside en Santa Tecla, ubicada en el departamento de La Libertad. Ella vive en un lugar muy humilde, junto a su esposo quien trabaja en el negocio con ella y junto a su pequeña hija de 4 años de edad. Ella posee un negocio el cual esta ubicado en la zona de comedores de el mercado de Santa Tecla, en el cual se encarga de elaborar tortillas y pupusas, dos tipos de alimentos los cuales son muy típicos de la comida salvadoreña. Cecilia es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, por esta razón ella cuenta con muchos clientes los cuales compran en el lugar ya que se sienten agradados con su servicio. Cecilia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, cal y leña para cocinarlo.  Este negocio es muy rentable, ya que a pesar que cuente con muchos clientes siempre se logra obtener ganancias diarias, es por esto que Cecilia desea poder seguir adelante con el y de esta manera mantener la estabilidad económica de su familia y brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo para solventar los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Cecilia del Carmen A. Z. is 34 years old and resides in Santa Tecla, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives in a modest home with her husband, who works with her in her business, and their four year old daughter. Cecelia has a business in the dining section of the market in Santa Tecla. She makes tortillas and pupusas, two foods that are traditional in Salvadoran cuisine.

Cecilia is a hardworking and kind person, which explains why she has many customers who come by her place to buy food and are satisfied with her service. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy large quantities of corn, lime, and firewood for cooking. Her business is very profitable since she has many customers and is always able to generate a daily income. For this reason, Cecilia wants to move forward with her business so that she can maintain financial stability for her family and provide her husband with the necessary assistance to meet their household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, lime, and firewood in bulk

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es: Luis Humberto D. F. de 50 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su esposa la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a su único hijo. Luis se dedica a la elaboración de ollas hechas de aluminio, las cuales elabora en su casa y vende de forma ambulante por el parque Central de Cojutepeque y en el mercado, así mismo elabora un número determinado el cual elaborar con pedidos previos, esta es una forma muy artesanal de elaborar ollas, ya que Luis las elabora y las pinta.  Desde hace 20 años que se dedica al mismo oficio lo que ha logrado convertirlo en todo un experto en el trabajo que realiza por lo que cuenta con varios clientes quienes hace pedidos de varias unidades para comercializar en otros puestos. Luis solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de aluminio y pintura con el fin de poder elaborar más ollas y cubrir más la demanda que posee. La venta de este productos ha sido muy estable durante todos esto años lo que ha permitido salir adelante y que incentiva a Luis a querer invertir aún más el.
texts.en:
Luis Humberto D. is 50 years old and resides in Cojutepeque, which is located in the Department of Cuscatlán. He lives with his wife, who is in charge of the household chores, and their only child. Luis manufactures aluminum pots at his house and sells them as a street vendor in the central park of Cojutepeque and at the market. He produces a set number of pots based on previous orders. His process for making pots is labor intensive because he has to produce them by hand and then paint them.

Luis has been dedicated to his business for 20 years and has managed to become an expert at his job. He has several customers who place orders for multiple units to sell at other locations. Luis is requesting a loan so that he can buy a large quantity of aluminum and paint so that he can produce more pots and meet the increasing demand. The sales of his products have been very stable throughout the years, which has permitted him to get ahead and encouraged him to invest further in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase aluminum & paint for making pots

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Thom's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of ten people located in Krang Chheu Neang village in Kandal province. Mr. Thom C. is a 26-year-old married man and he is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Each member of this village bank loan will use it to support their different purpose.

Mr. Thom C. is a farmer who owns 2 hectares (5 acres) of land on which he cultivates cucumbers and watermelons. His wife, Mrs. Sreymom Mai, is a seamstress in a garment factory where she earns a small salary to support her family. The couple has a child who is 4 years old.

Mr. Thom C. decided to ask for a loan to support his farm crops.

loans.use: To support his farm crops

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov H. is 34 years old and is a villager who lives in Preak Ta Pov village in Kandal province. She is the leader of this group loan who has been selected by its four members. Each member will use the loan to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Pov H. is a beautician at home while her husband, Mr. You Nos Makk, is a construction worker. With these two positions, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. Aside from being a construction worker, Mr. You Nos Makk is also a musician who performs at wedding ceremonies.

Mrs. Pov H. is now requesting a loan to buy beautician supplies to support her business. This couple has two children: one is a attending the local school while the youngest one is just 8 months old.

loans.use: To buy beautician supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
In Srae Ampil village in Kandal province are found these four people who make up this group loan. Mrs. Phalla K. is the group leader, selected by all the members. Each member will use their loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Phalla K. is on the staff of an orphan center and she is also a farmer who owns a half-hectare (1.25 acres) of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family. Her problem is that her rice field has infertile soil.

So, to improve her production of rice, Mrs. Phalla K. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. She is a widow with a child who is nineteen years old.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Phon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon P. is 42 years old and is the leader of this group loan located in Preak Ta Nob village in Kandal province, having been selected by its five members. Each member will use the loan to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Phon P. is a vegetable seller who is able to earn a small income to support her family. In order to increase her income and expand her business, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell.

Mrs. Phon P.’s husband, Mr. Tong Chea, is a farmer who own 2-hectares (5-acres) of land on which he grows crops for a living. This couple has three children who are all students in the local school and also support their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sokhon's Group

texts.en:
Five people, who make up this group loan, live in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province. They will each use the loan for a different purpose to improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. Sokhon T. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members.

Mrs. Sokhon T. is a lotus seller in the local market. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it. So, to improve her business, she is asking for a loan to buy more lotuses to resell.

Mrs. Sokhon T.’s husband, Mr. Hou Or, is a farmer who rents a small piece of land on which he grows lotus to sell to support his family. Through this activity, they support three children, two of whom are helping their parents to grow lotus, while the other one is a fisherman.

loans.use: To buy more lotuses to sell

loans.name: Thary's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thary M. is a 33-year-old married woman and she is the leader of this group loan, selected by the five members located I. Spean Daek village I. Kandal province. Each member will use the loan to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Thary M. is a pig breeder while her husband, Mr. Thoeun Keat, is a car mechanic who is able to earn a small income to support his family. This couple has five children: four are attending the local school while the youngest one is a year old.

For her pig breeding business, Mrs. Thary M. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Phoeun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Potha Lay is a 35-year-old married woman and she is the leader of this group loan having been selected by its four members located in Prek Raing village in Kandal province. Each member will use the loan to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Potha Lay is a seamstress in a garment factory where she receives a small salary to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Oeun Duk, is a motorbike taxi driver who owns a motorbike he uses for his business. This couple has a child who is a student in the local school.

In order to support her husband’s business, Mrs. Potha Lay decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorcycle for his business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her husband's business

loans.name: Mrs. Savorn Raem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Savorn R. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members of this group loan. This village bank loan consists of fifteen people who all live in Popeal Khaer village in Kandal province.

Mrs. Savorn R. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare (1.25 acres) of land on which she grows crops to sell to support her family. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil and it is far away from the irrigation system. So to improve her crop production, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

Mrs. Savorn R.’s husband, Mr. Chen T., is a government worker. She has two children, one of whom is a construction worker, while the other is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: March's Group

texts.en: This group loan, which consists of 4 members, is located in Prek Bak village in Kandal province. Mrs. March C. is 52 years old and was selected as the leader of the group loan by its members. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different businesses. Mrs. March C. stays at home and takes care of her children, while her husband, Mr. M. Soun, is a fisherman who earns a small income to support his family. Mrs. March C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a fishing boat to support her husband's business. This couple has four children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the other three are students at the local school.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat.

loans.name: Kea

texts.en: Mrs. Kea T. is a 35 year old married woman and lives in Samar village in Kandal province. She is a seamstress in a garment factory and her husband, Mr. Phon Tonh, is a construction worker. With both of these positions they are able to earn a small income to support their family's living conditions. Aside from working in construction, Mr. Phon Tonh is also a farmer and owns a piece of land to grow crops. Mrs. Kea T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine to support her husband's farming. The couple (pictured together) has three children, all of whom attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy a water machine.

loans.name: Lider De Defensores Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Socorro, es la Presidenta D. la Alcancia “Lider D. Defensores", ya tiene 18 meses integrando el grupo conformado por 11 socias todas trabajadoras y amigas del mismo lugar, es madre D.  5 hijos, ella es viuda lograr sacar adelante a sus hijos siempre ha sido su mayor preocupación es por ellos que siempre ha luchado y trabajado, durante algún tiempo se dedico a la venta D. pescado en un mercado D. su zona pero se dio cuenta que la venta D. limones era un buen negocio es así que empieza a venderlos, primero los ofrecía  a sus clientes que le compraban pescado después los pedidos fueron aumentando actualmente reparte  al por mayor a restaurantes y los mercados  quienes son sus mejores clientes. Con las ganancias que ha obtenido D. la venta D. limones ha iniciado otro ahora venD.  menú  tiene 10 pensionistas a quienes les prepara el almuerzo esto  le genera otro ingreso adicional.
Para mas adelante quiere tener su propia bodega en su casa  para eso trabaja y sigue ahorrando también en sus ratos libres se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza Socorro siempre busca la manera D. ganarse algo extra, en esta oportunidad el dinero D. su préstamo  lo invertirá en la compra D. limones para su negocio.
texts.en:
Socorro is a widow and the mother of five children. To be able to proviD. for her children and help them move up in the world has always been her greatest concern and the reason for her work and struggle. For some time she sold fish at a local market but she realized that selling lemons was a good business and so she began to sell them. At first she offered them to her customers who were buying fish and later the orders began to increase. Currently she delivers wholesale to restaurants and the markets which are her best customers. With the earnings she has maD. with the sale of lemons she has started another business. Now she sells prepared meals. She has ten retired persons [pensioners] for whom she prepares lunch. This brings in additional income for her. Down the road she wants to have her own grocery store in her home. She is working to make that happen and continues saving money. In her free time she also sells beauty products. Socorro is always seeking a way to earn something extra. In this opportunity she will invest the money from her loan to purchase lemons for her business. The role she plays in the group is that of president. Her group is called “Lider D. defensores” [Leader of Advocates]. She has spent 18 months now putting the group together which is maD. up of 11 members, all hardworking and friends from the same area. * Socorro is the fifth from the right (standing)

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase lemons for her business

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a resident of the mid-sized city of Riwind, Pakistan. She owns a three-room house and has been living in it for the last 20 years.  She is 44 years old and married with seven children: four boys and three girls. Her elder son runs a food stand where sells Daal chawal and Kababs. The others are enrolled in school and are getting an education. 

A very caring and hardworking lady, Farida operates a dairy business. She sells the milk in her community and generates a good income. Presently, she has one buffalo and gets almost 10kg of milk from her. She earns approximately 12k from her business. She has been doing this work for last 12 years. Now she gets completely involved in this business and enjoys it.
 
Her husband runs a tea stall in the community. His stall is famous among his customers. He keeps a variety of tea such as green tea, black tea and creamy milked tea. He serves the tea in good, clean teacups. He has been doing this work for over six years. 

Farida is a regular client of Asasah. She has successfully repaid her four loans to Asasah. With the loan profit, she bought a color television to enjoy her free time by watching programs with her family and a washing machine, which helps her and her daughter wash clothes without difficulty and struggle. Now she is applying for the fifth time for a loan to purchase another buffalo and expand her dairy business.

loans.use: To purchase another buffalo for her dairy business

loans.name: Mrs. Shivan Monh Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of twenty people who live in Popeal Khaer village in Kandal province. All of the group members will use the loan for different purposes in order to improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. Shivan M. is the village bank president, as selected by all the members. She was born in 1957. She and her husband, Mr. Seng Pham, own a general store located in their home. Since their business is going well they want to expand it. Mrs. Shivan M. is asking for a loan to buy more groceries for the store's inventory in order to increase their income this year. The couple supports two children, one of whom earns a low salary as a car driver, while the other is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for inventory.

loans.name: Mrs. Chanry Un Village Bank Group

texts.en: Seventeen people who live in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. They will all use the loan for different purposes to support their businesses in the future. Mrs. Chanry U. is the village bank president, and has been selected by all the members. She owns a general store, and earns some money from selling groceries. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it. Therefore, Mrs. Chanry U. is seeking a loan to buy more groceries to add inventory in order to increase her income this year and in the future. Her husband, Mr. Sophal Choem, has a trailer he uses for business. They support three children who are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to add inventory.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda C. is a 65 year-old generous and thoughtful woman. She is concerned not only about her only child but about her adopted children and neighbors as well. Her son Nelson is a hired laborer and is earning just a small amount of money; he can’t even support himself and his mother. Due to this, Yolanda wanted to have her own way to earn money and augment the income of her son to support them and her adopted children. She joined ASHI in 2008 and has been receiving loans since then. Via these loans she has been able to finance the farming of vegetables in her backyard with the help of her son. These vegetables, once harvested, are sold in the market and to the people in their village. 

Proceeds of Yolanda’s vegetables farming business may be small, but her family is enjoying its ability to support their basic needs. Through the loans she will avail via her membership in ASHI, Yolanda is optimistic that someday her business will grow, allowing her to support the improvement of her family members' lives and the lives of others who may need their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for vegetable farming.

loans.name: Mrs. Neang Un Village Bank Group

texts.en: This loA. group, whose members live in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province, is made up of 20 people. Mrs. Neang U., who has been chosen as president of the group by its members, is a 53-year-old farmer who rents a two-hectare plot of land on which she grows crops to support her family. She is a widow who has six children, one of whom is a driver who earns a small salary. Another makes a living selling fish, a third is a beauticiA., and the others attend the local public school. To improve the output of her farm, Mrs. Neang U. will use her portion of this loA. to plant a good crop.

loans.use: To plant crops

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en: This loan group is made up of four people, all of whom live in Koh Chamroeun village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sopheap O., who is 26 years old and married, has been chosen as leader by the other members, each of whom will use a portiO. of the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Sopheap O. makes a living selling vegetables, from which she earns a small income to help support her family. She will use her portiO. of the loan to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers. Her husband, Mr. Sokhem Khy, is a farmer who owns a plot of land O. which he grows vegetable. This couple has two children who too young to go to school or work.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sam Art's Group

texts.en: The five members of this loan group live in Kaoh Prak village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sam Art U. is the group leader, and was elected to this position by the other members, each of whom will use a portion of this loan for a different purpose. Mrs. U. makes a small income selling vegetables in the local market. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it, and has applied for this loan to make that expansion possible. Her husband, Mr. Ravuth C., is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he grows vegetables. This couple does not currently have aN. children.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable to resell

loans.name: Er's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Er S. is the 38-year-old leader of this loan group, whose members live in Preak Raing village in Kandal province. Each member of this group will use a portion of the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Er S. and her husband, Mr. Song Sam, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow crops. Mrs. Er S. will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer. This couple has two children, both of whom are students in a local school. When not in school, they help their parents on the family's farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sokon's Group

texts.en: This loan group is made up of four people who live in Kampong Samnanh village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sokon M. leads the group, having been elected to that position by the other members. She is widow who has five children, two of whom work, while the others study in the local public school. Mrs. Sokon M. owns a motorbike which is too old to ride, and will use her portion of this loan to buy a new one because this will help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs his store

loans.name: Sairan's Group

texts.en:
Sairan R. is the leader of the group. She is 48 and married. Her husband works as a welder. Sairan has four children: three sons and a daughter. All of them go to school except the youngest son, who goes to kindergarten. When children are not at school, they help their mom with housework.  Sairan has been fattening and reselling cattle for five years. She makes 5,000 soms ($109.40) a month. The initial investment in this business activity was 4,000 soms ($87.53). At the moment, Sairan owns 30 small farm animals and 5 cattle. She wants to get a loan to purchase more cattle. In the future, Sairan wishes to have enough money to pay for her children to go to college (university). 

Burulcha S. is 43 and married. Burulcha is the treasurer of the group. Her husband works as a private builder. They have a daughter and a son. The son helps to take care of the cattle. They own 20 small farm animals and 2 cattle. In this way, Burulcha makes 5,000 soms ($109.40) a month. She needs a loan to purchase two cattle.

Aishabubu I. is 40 and she is married. Her husband is a farmer. They have five children and all of them help Aishabubu with housework.  With money received from loan, Aishabubu will buy 60 liters of fuel and 20 kilograms of seeds for farming.

Sabira Z. is 46 and she is divorced. She has a daughter and a son. The son works as a welder and the daughter is a student. Sabira wants to get a loan to pay for tractor-driver services and purchase 100 liters of fuel, which is needed for farming. 

Sairabubu S. is 56 and married. Her husband is a shepherd. They have eight children. All of the children live separately with their own families, except the youngest son. The son and his wife help Sairabubu with housework. With money received from loan, Sairabubu will buy 150 liters of fuel, which is needed for sowing.  In the future, Sairabubu wishes to build a house for her youngest son.

Kulumkan S. is 51 and married. Her husband works as a welder. They have three sons and all of them work in construction. Kulumkan has been selling national drinks for 14 years, in this way she makes 5,000 soms ($109.40) a month. The initial investment in this business activity was 500 soms ($10.94). Now Kulumkan wants to get a loan to purchase primary products.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Abdufattoh

texts.en:
O. Abdufattoh is 25 years old. He has been running a drugstore for more than three years. He sells only certified medicines. The drugstore is located in the center of the town, which allows him to have many clients and customers. At the same time, Abdufattoh is engaged in a cattle-raising business together with his father. Currently he is asking for $1500 USD to purchase young cattle. Being a very accurate person by his nature, he is sure and would like to ensure the lenders that he is able to pay the loan on time without any violations. Your generosity can change his life.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: Kheng's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four people who live in Boeng Leu-I village in Kandal province. They will each use their loan for different purposes that will improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. Kheng S. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. 

Mrs. Kheng S. owns a general store and also sells fish. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it.  Therefore, Mrs. Kheng S. is asking for a loan to buy more fish to resell. Her husband, Mr. Kak Heu Kry, is a farmer who owns ten-hectares of land and grows crops to sell to support the famiL.. Through this activity, the couple supports three children.  Two of the children attend the local public school and the youngest is a year old.

loans.use: To buy more fish.

loans.name: Saidullo

texts.en:
Saidullo is a noble worker dedicated to raising animals, primarily cattle, which he buys and sells in the most commercial city markets. This work is very agreeable to him, because raising animals is what Saidullo has enjoyed most since he was young. Nevertheless, he also has another job; in his free time, he also provides taxi driver service. Saidullo requires a certain amount of money to increase the number of his cattle. His goal is to increase his product and thereby increase his household income in addition to being solvent in order to continue working on his buying and selling animals.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Mr. Khon Mann Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eight people make a village bank loan and they live in Cheung Prey Bei village in Kandal province. Mr. Khon M. is the village bank president selected by all the members who will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes. He and his wife, Mrs. Phorn Khoem, are farmers who own a half-hectare of land to grow rice to support their family. Their problem is that their rice field is not prepared on time to do farming. Therefore, to improve production, Mr. Khon M. is applying for a loan to farm in this current year. From this activity, the couple supports three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, another is an electrician, and the other is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To do farming.

loans.name: Toktobubu's Group

texts.en:
Toktobubu Z. is the leader of her group. She is 44 and married. Toktobubu lives in Tokmok with her family.  Her husband is a farmer. They have three children. Two of them study at school and the third one is preschool age. Five years ago, Toktobubu, with the initial investment of 500 soms, ($10.91) began to sell eggs at the market. In this way, she earns 4,000 soms ($87.33) a month. Now she wants to get a loan to purchase chickens. In the near future, Toktobubu plans to finish the construction of their house.   

Zhumabubu T. is the treasurer of the group. She is 59 and married. Zhumabubu and her husband are pensioners. They have seven children. The youngest son lives with them. The other children are married and live separately. Zhumabubu has been selling eggs for five years. She started her business with 500 soms ($10.91) and now she makes 2,500 soms ($54.58) a month. They need a loan to purchase chickens. 

Ainura B. is 30 and married. She has a nine-year-old daughter who studies in school.  Ainura is a chef's assistant and her husband works as a builder. With the money received from loan, they will buy household appliances. In the future, Ainura wishes to buy a flat. 

Zhyldyz K. is 39 and married. Her husband is a taxi driver. They have three children and all of them study in school. Zhyldyz works as a chef. She and her husband are also engaged in farming. They started this activity 20 years ago, with an initial investment of 2,000 soms ($43.66). Selling different fruits and vegetables, they make and additional 10,000 soms ($218.34) per month. Now they need a loan to purchase fuel and different seeds needed for farming. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah rakhi, a resident of the mid-sized city of Riwind, Pakistan, owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 34 years. She has one son who is involved in a vegetable-selling business. He has completed his education to the 10th standard but couldn’t study further because the colleges are far away from the house and his parents couldn’t afford for him to go there. 
 
A very talented lady, Allah rakhi operates a business selling thread rolls.  She gets the thread from used sweaters, which she purchases in the city of Lahore. She has been doing this work for over six years. She earns approximately 5,000 Pak Rupees every month, which she saves for the marriage of her son.
 
Her husband's name is M. S.. He is a loader by profession and loads different items such as cement, fruits and vegetables on his donkey cart. He delivers the items from one place to another and generates a good income. He has been doing this work for over 10 years. 
Allah rakhi’s brother who lives with her is 24 years old and operates a vegetable-selling business. He purchases the vegetables from the vegetable markets and sells them on his four-wheeled cart by going to different areas of the community. He has five years of experience in this business. 
Allah rakhi is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest the capital in her brother’s business so he can purchase vegetables in bulk and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma, a resident of the mid-sized city of Riwind, Pakistan, owns a two-room house and has been living in it with her family for over 17 years. Her husband's name is H.. He is drives a rickshaw (local three-wheeled motor vehicle) and generates income for the family. 

A very caring lady, Salma stays at home, manages the household chores and cooks food for her family.  She is a mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son works in a cotton factory on a monthly wage. The younger reads in the 5th standard and her daughter reads in the 2nd standard. Salma and her husband wish to give the kids a good education so they can make their future bright and can recognize the good and bad in their lives.
 
She is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah to pay the remaining installments of her husband’s rickshaw so he can get clearance from the owner and becomes the owner of his own rickshaw.

loans.use: To pay the remaining installments for the rickshaw

loans.name: Saltanata's Group

texts.en:
Saltanata Z. is the leader of her group. She is 33 and married.  She has two sons and a daughter. Saltanata works in a sewing workshop in Bishkek and her brother takes care of her younger son during the day while her other children are at school.  Ten years ago, with the initial investment of 1000 soms ($21.83), her husband began to cultivate strawberries to sell. In this way he makes 6,000 soms ($131) a month. This made it possible for them to buy a one-room flat. Now they want to get a loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, Saltanata dreams of buying a big house.

Kairkul A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 39 and married. She works as a retail packager and her husband is a private driver. Kairkul has two daughters; both of them study at school. Six years ago, Kairkul's relatives advised her to cultivate strawberries. Thus with the initial amount of 2,000 soms ($43.66) she began her business. Now in this way, Kairkul makes 8,000 soms ($174.67) a month. She needs a loan to purchase fertilizer.  

Gulsara A. is 39 and married. She has two daughters and a son. Her daughters study at school and her son is preschool age. The grandmother takes care of him when nobody is at home.  Gulsara cultivates strawberries and she wants to get a loan to purchase fuel and fertilizer.

Keldibek K. is 44 and married. He works as a taxi driver. He has two daughters; both of them are preschool age. Therefore, Keldibek's wife sits at home and takes care of them. In order to make money, Keldibek and his wife cultivate strawberries. In this way they make an additional 8,000 soms ($174.67) a month. Keldibek wants to get a loan to purchase fertilizer, which is needed for cultivation. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Farhad Group

texts.en: Waisuldin is the leader of Farhad group. He lives in district three of Jalalabad city. He is 18 years-old and unmarried. He is a hard working man and after graduating from high school he became responsible for his family. He has a carpentry shop. Waisuldin wants a loan to buy wood and other essential equipment for his shop in order to enlarge his business capacity. He hopes that if his business increases that he will be able to continue his higher education at one of the private universities in Jalalabad city. He is grateful for AFS and Kiva Lender’s for their positive process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy wood and equipment.

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.ru:
С. Тюп находится на берегу необычайно красивого, высокогорного оз. Ыссык – Куль. Герои этой истории – жители с. Тюп. Ботоканова Айнура – лидер группы. Айнура нуждается в кредите, который позволил бы ей закупить одну тонну семенного картофеля и ГСМ. Выращивание сельхоз продукции и скотоводство – являются основным делом, которыми занимаются сельчане. Айнуре тридцать девять лет. У неё пятеро замечательных детей: сын и четыре дочери. На протяжении одиннадцати лет Айнура с мужем кормят большую семью за счёт того, что занимаются земледелием, и параллельно держат живность: коров и овец. Помимо этого муж Айнуры занимается ремонтом и покраской автомашин. От продажи молока Айнуре удаётся заработать около двух тысяч сомов. Это не так много, однако, всё же, хоть какой – то заработок. Старшие дети Айнуры по мере возможности помогают родителям сажать, полоть , поливать и собирать урожай. Перед Айнурой стоят задачи, которые она планирует выполнить в течение ближайших нескольких лет. Прежде всего, Айнура хочет, чтобы её дети выросли образованными детьми. Она готова не жалеть никаких средств и усилий, чтобы открыть детям дорогу в будущее.  Айнура верит, что при умелом использовании собственных возможностей, можно добиться всего. А также она уже давно собирается произвести ремонт хозяйственных построек возле её дома. Это всё требует времени и средств, однако Айнура будет действовать последовательно. 

Партнёры Айнуры по группе:

Сатаровой Нургул сорок лет. Она с недавних пор вдова и одна воспитывает двоих детей – близнецов: сына и дочь. Чтобы прокормить себя и детей Нургул приходится заниматься одновременно земледелием и скотоводством. Она очень надеется получить этот кредит, чтобы купить пять голов мелко – рогатого скота. Её мечта – построить большой дом со всеми удобствами. 

Исмаиловой Эрмек тридцать семь лет. Муж Эрмек работает на птицефабрике «Шумкар» в г. Бишкек. Эрмек – мать пятерых детей. Дома вместе с детьми, она занимается выращиванием сельхоз продукции, а также предоставляет услуги швеи. Эрмек нуждается в кредите. Она намерена купить 500 кг семенного картофеля.

Иманакуновой Замире тридцать семь лет. Муж Замиры работает таксистом. Сама Замира усердно помогает мужу кормить и обеспечивать семью. У них трое детей. Самой младшей дочери всего три года. Она выращивает различные зерновые культуры или овощи на собственном участке земли. Замира очень надеется получить этот кредит, который позволит ей провести оросительные работы. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
he Tup village is situated by the incredibly beautiful mountain lake Issyk Kul. The protagonists of this story are inhabitants of the village. Ainura B. needs loan which would allow her to purchase one ton [2200 lbs]of seed potatoes as well as fuel. Farming and livestock are the main occupations of the villagers. Ainura is 39 years old. She has five wonderful children: one son and four daughters. For many years Ainura and her husband have been able to support their large family thanks to farming work as well as to keeping livestock: cows and sheep. In addition, Ainura’s husbands repairs and paints cars. Milk sales bring Ainura about 2,000 soms. This is not a huge amount, yet it helps. The older children, as much as possible, help their parents with, weeding, watering and harvesting. Ainura has a number of goals to reach in the next few years. First of all, she would like her children to get an education. She will not to spare any money and effort to provide a future for her children. She believes that using one’s abilities wisely makes it possible to achieve anything. Also, she has been planning to renovate the sheds near the house for a long time. All this requires time and financial means, but Ainura will keep working at it little by little. Other group members: Nurgul S. is 40 years old. She is a recent widow, raising her twins, a son and a daughter. In order to support herself, she is forced to do both farming and livestock keeping. She is really hoping to obtain this credit in order to buy five smallstock animals. Her dream is to build a big house with all modern facilities. Ermek I. is 37 years old. Ermek’s husband works at the poultry factory farm “Shumkar” in the town of Bishkek. Ermek is the mother of five children. At home, together with her children, she does farming as well as provides the services of a seamstress. She needs a loan to purchase 500 kg [1100 lbs] of seed potatoes. Zamira I. is 37 years old. Her husband is a taxi driver. Zamira herself is very hard-working and helps her husband support the family. They have three children, the youngest daughter being only three years of age. Zamira grows various grains and vegetables on her own land plot. She is really hoping to obtain this credit which will allow her to complete the watering of her crops.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fuel and one ton of seed potatoes

loans.name: Analie Betache's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Analie B., 29 years of age and married, is a resident of Silangit, Tangub City. Analie is the group leader of a three member group loan offered by Kiva partner PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Analie B.’s Group.
 	
Analie is married to Noel B., a painter. They are blessed with three children: one is now school age and the other two are still babies.  To make a living, Analie has a micro business operating a sari-sari (general) store.  For five years, she has been able to maintain this business through various ups and downs. At present, she earns an average net income of not less than P 2,500.00 a month and this amount is very helpful to their family income.

Analie joined the cooperative in 2009. As an active member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a micro-finance program that reaches out to the rural poor, she is requesting a loan of P 12,000.00 as her four cycle loan in order to add capital for her existing sari-sari store business. The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions for her family, to meet their basic needs, for loan repayments to PMPC and savings for the future especially for the children’s education. She is hoping that someday her business progress.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital.

location.town: Silangit, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mindana

loans.name: Mira's Group

texts.ru:
В жизни каждого человека  возникают моменты, когда, то, чем он занимается, перестаёт доставлять ему удовольствие, и он начинает питать отвращение ко всему, что его окружает. И только сильные люди способны не принимать близко к сердцу такие препятствия, психологического характера, и чётко настраивать себя на работу и надеяться на лучшее. Если прочитать историю наших героев, то становится очевидным, что в повседневной жизни нас окружает множество таких людей.
