This woman is 30 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She has been doing commerce in pagnes (colorful West African cloth) for six years.  She has included jewelry in her business.  She purchases her goods locally in Lomé, the capital of ToG., and resell them in her stall at the Assiyéyé market.  At present, she is out of stock.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from WAGES.  Counting on growth in her business, she hopes to do better to meet the schooling needs of her two children. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pagne cloth and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Caring Sisters Group

texts.en:
Helena D. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Caring Sisters. She is 31 years old, single and has two children who range from 5 to 8 years old. She was only able to attend school through 5th grade due to poverty.

For four years, Helena has been selling kitchen utensils at the Waterside Market in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She sells in a friendly manner, which keeps customers returning.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more kitchen utensils. Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Helena is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Cet homme de 36 ans est très dynamique. Il est tapissier de profession. Il confectionne diverses catégories de sacs qu’il revend. A coté de cette activité, il achète de la mousse qu’il revend en détail.
Avec le crédit sollicité, il compte acheter de la mousse en grande quantité pour soutenir son activité.
Il est marié et père de 03 enfants. Avec les revenus escomptés, il compte offrir une meilleure éducation à ses 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a 36-year-old man who is very energetic.  He is an upholsterer by profession.  He makes various types of bags which he sells. Aside from this business, he buys foam padding, which he sells retail.  With the loan requested, he plans on buying a large quantity of foam padding to support his business.   He is married and the father of three children.  With the revenues expected, he plans on providing a better education to his three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bags and foam padding

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
Siah S. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Is Great. She is 39 years old, single and has three children who range from 5 to 18 years old. She was only able to attend school through 8th grade due to lack of financial support.

For 20 years, Siah has been selling rice and cooking oil at the Jallah Town Market, Capitol Hill, Monrovia, Liberia. She sells in a friendly manner, which keeps customers returning.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more rice and cooking oil. Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future. She describes herself as patient and easy going.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Siah is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Eric

texts.es:
El Señor Eric P. A. tiene 36 años de edad, está separado de su mujer ya más de 10 años, el vivía en Cochabamba con su mujer pero ella lo abandono y le dejo sin nada en otras palabras lo dejo en la calle llevándose todas sus cosas (muebles y  electrodomésticos de su hogar), el tiene la voluntad de superarse y volver a empezar de nuevo, se vino a ivirgarzama a buscar su suerte de lo cual se animo y monto un nuevo taller sencillo e humilde.

El Señor Eric P. A. se dedica a la reparación de mascaras de plástico y fibra de vidrio (mascarero) y a la venta de repuestos pequeños de automotores por ejemplo: guiñadores, stops, faroles, etc. El tiene la seguridad que así podra levantar su tienda y poder tener una vida mejor, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda rehacer su vida y formar una nueva familia. 

El solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su taller, y así poder incrementar más sus ingresos y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Eric P. A. is 36 years old and has been separated from his wife for more than 10 years. He was living in Cochabamba when his wife literally left him with nothing (she had taken all the furniture and household appliances). Eric found the will to overcome and start a new life. Fate brought him to Ivirgarzama where he was inspired to open a new workshop that was simple and modest.

Eric repairs headlight and taillight covers made of plastic and fiberglass. He also sells small automotive parts such as turn signals, brake lights, headlights, and other items. Eric is confident in his ability to improve his business and have a better life. In the near future, he hopes to rebuild his life and start a new family.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy merchandise to expand his shop so that he can generate more revenue and offer better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory to sell in his auto repair shop

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 29 years old and is married with two children: the first one is 8 and the last is 3 years old.

Alphonsine works hard for the development of her family. She owns a small business which sells various products such as tea cups, cooking oil, bread and so on. This business is fruitful in her region and this is her 12th successful year in operation. Her shop is open from 6 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day. She employs two people as helpers from her community.

Alphonsine is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business. Once her shop is expanded, Alphonsine hopefully will earn enough money to allow her to sort out some family problems and other problems she faces in her daily activities.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Kofi Eyram

texts.en: Monsieur Kofi Eyram A. is a young tailor in his hometown of Lomé, Togo. At 26, he's married to a hairdresser and they have one child. Kofi has been working as a tailor since 2007. This is his first loan from WAGES. He requests a loan of 300,000 CFA to purchase a sewing machine and some cloth for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine and cloth.

loans.name: Togetherness Group

texts.en:
Seaneah Y. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Togetherness. She is 53 years old, married and has eight children who range from 20 to 38 years old. She did not have the opportunity to go school due to poverty. 

For 22 years, Seaneah has been selling fish at the Fish Market in Sinkor, MonroV., Liberia. She sells in a friendly manner, which keeps customers returning.

She plans to use her 18,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 83,350 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more fish.

Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Seaneah is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more fish.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. sells charcoal in both small and large quantities at Takoradi. She has received junior high education and is a single parent with one child.

Esther has been selling charcoal for some time now and is responsible for paying school fees, utility bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Maria Alfonza

texts.es:
La Sra. María Alfonza es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, es madre de hijos en edad escolar.

Ella es vendedora de ropas, colchas, hamacas y otros artículos de diferentes estilos, su venta lo realiza en forma ambulante en la ciudad de Itá con clientelas formadas.

Gracias a esta actividad tiene un ingreso considerado que le ayuda a contribuir en los gastos de la casa.  

Debido a la demanda que tiene necesita de capital para poder satisfacerlas por ello se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya para solicitar el préstamo para la compra de remeras mangas largas, pantalones, camisas, zapatos.
texts.en:
Sra. María Alfonza is from the city of Carapeguá. She is the mother of school age children.

María Alfonza sells clothing, blankets, hammocks, and other items of different styles. She generates sales as a traveling vendor in the city of Itá, where she has established customers. Thanks to her business, she is able to earn a considerable income that goes toward her household expenses.

Due to demand, she is in need of capital so that she can satisfy her customers. She approached Fundación Paraguaya in order to request a loan to buy long-sleeved shirts, trousers, dress shirts, and shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an assortment of clothing & shoes

loans.name: Damian

texts.es:
El señor Damián tiene 40 años está casado con la señora Reyna y tienen 3 hijos de (10,8 y 2) años los cuales estudian en la primaria, son una familia de escasos recursos económicos. 

Es señor Damián vive en la Ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de Esmeralda Norte, tienen una pequeña casa que falta terminar de construir ya que solamente cuenta con dos habitaciones. Una ocupan los padres y la otra para los tres hijos en la cual se encuentren muy incómodos.

El señor Damián tiene un pequeño aserradero en su domicilio del cual vende toda clase de madera a las carpinterías de la zona para la fabricación de muebles.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de tronco, el cual compra con todos los permisos y autorizaciones necesarias por la ABT (Autoridad de control Social de Bosques y Tierras) y de esta manera prever materia prima para aserrar madera y de esta manera vender en tiempo de lluvia.

Entre sus sueños y metas es tener una mueblería y así de esa manera tener una pequeña empresa, su meta más importante a corto plazo es realizar una construcción con habitaciones para cada uno de sus hijos, con lo cual estarán mas cómodos cada uno de ellos.
texts.en:
Sr. Damián is 40 years old and married to Sra. Reyna. They have three children (ages 10, 8, and 2), of whom two are attending elementary school. His family has limited financial resources.

Sr. Damián lives in the community of Esmeralda Norte in the city of Cochabamba. He has a small house that is still in the middle of construction. Only two of the bedrooms are occupied. His parents stay in one room while his three children occupy the other, which makes conditions very uncomfortable for everyone.

Sr. Damián operates a small sawmill out of his home where he sells all types of wood to carpenters in the area for making furniture. This loan will be used to buy tree trunks. He has all the required permits and authorizations from the ABT (the local forestry and land management authority) and the necessary equipment for sawing wood that he can sell during the rainy season.

One of his dreams is to open a furniture store so that he can have his own small business. Most importantly, his short-term goal is to finish the construction of the bedrooms for each of his children so that they will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tree trunks to turn into lumber

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase film, a water system and fertilizers for a new green house.

loans.name: United Women Group

texts.en:
Fatu Kollie is the leader of a group of five borrowers called United Women. She is 42 years old, single and has two children who are 5 and 24 years old. She was not able to attend school due to poverty. She cares for 4 siblings.

For 4 years, Fatu has been operating a mini restaurant in the Congo Town on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She prepares her food well and operates in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning.

She plans to use her 10,400 Liberian Dollars portion of this 52,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more rice, cooking oil, meat, fish and pepper

Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Fatu is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more rice, cooking oil, meat, fish and pepper.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama I. sells firewood in bundles at Takoradi. She has received junior high education. She is married and has four children. Her husband works with the railway system.

Adama has been selling firewood for quite some time now and supports her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more firewood for sale. She hopes to use the new income from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en: Fausta is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members. Fausta makes and weaves tablecloths and placemats. She wants to use this loan to buy more cloth and thread for making tablecloths. Fausta buys these materials from Kiyembe shops, one of the busiest places for clothing material in Kampala city.  She goes shopping twice a month and uses public transport to and from shopping. Fausta has been in this business for eight years and with MCDT for one and half years, servicing her third loan. Besides this weaving business, she also rears chickens at her home and owns a motorcycle for hire. She sells to all categories of people and makes her products according to one's fashion and style. She works seven days a week. Her business challenges are defaulters and transportation. She aspires to see her business grow big and start using machines instead of hand weaving. She joined MCDT because she wanted to increase her capital base. Fausta resides in and owns a house where the family stays and they have access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and thread

loans.name: Togetherness Group

texts.en:
Alfred V. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Togetherness. He is 46 years old, married and has four children who range from 5 to 17 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For six years, Alfred has been selling used clothes on Johnson Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He sells in a friendly manner, which keeps his customers returning.

He plans to use his 19,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 70,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more used clothes.

His goal is to grow his business and to continue to support his family so that they can have a better future. He describes himself as a hardworking man.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Alfred is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Women's Wing Group

texts.en:
Here are the members of the Women’s Wing Group. They are small-scale businesswomen in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of SLL 800,000 each to improve their businesses. With such a loan, they will be able to add more goods into their businesses, make more sales and better profits. Consequently, they can better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing and educating them.

Mabinty G. (right) is the leader of this group. She was born in Makili village in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and they have four children. Two of Mabinty’s children are in secondary schools and two are in primary schools.

Mabinty sells cooked rice, meat and vegetables. She also has a small box at the corner of her restaurant where she sells cigarettes, mints, matches, biscuits (cookies), lollipops, etc. She has been a businesswoman for more than six years now.

With this loan, Mabinty will be able to expand her business by buying the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients such as rice, palm-oil, pepper, onions, etc.

loans.name: Massesebeh Group

texts.en:
These are the members of Massebeh Group. They are small-scale businesspeople in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of SLL 800,000 each to enable them to improve their businesses. With a loan, they will be able to add more goods to their stalls, make more sales and better profits. Consequently, their living standards will improve so that they can better look after themselves and their children.

The leader of this group is Abdul K., pictured on the left. He was born in Magburaka town and is now 55 years old. He is married with eleven children: two are now teachers, eight are in secondary schools and one is in primary school.

Abdul is a motor-mechanic and he has been in this profession for thirty years now. With this loan, he will buy engine oil, tires and other spare-parts to sell.

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy engine oil, tires and other spare-parts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of cement to mold more blocks.

loans.name: Yaya's Group

texts.en:
Meet with the teachers of The SLC (Sierra Leone Church) Primary School, Makeni. The school was built by the Anglican Mission in 1914 and is the oldest school in Makeni City.

This is the second loan that teachers of SLC school will be accessing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of their previous loan, some of these borrowers were able to invest their loans into businesses, others bought pieces of furniture, some paid school fees, etc. Having repaid their previous loan successfully, they are now seeking a second loan.

Yaya M. (who is pictured on the left in the first row) is the headmaster at the school. He has been a teacher for twenty-nine years now. He is age forty-two. He was born in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone and is married with five children: one is already grown-up, two are in primary schools, one is in secondary school and the other one is in college. 

Mr. M. will invest this loan in his business. He sells local produce like palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, beans, groundnuts (peanuts), etc., and has been selling local produce for thirteen years now. He will use this loan to buy palm-oil, rice, beans, groundnuts, etc., wholesale to add to his business.

Mr. M. depends on the income from his small business to supplement his monthly salary.

loans.use: To buy palm-oil, rice, beans, groundnuts, etc., wholesale to add to his business

loans.name: Renka Group

texts.en:
These are the members of Renka Group. They are small-scale businesspeople in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of SLL 800,000 each to enable them improve their businesses. With a loan, they will be able to add more goods to their stalls, make more sales and better profits. Consequently, their living standards will improve so that they can better look after themselves and their children.

Mariatu K. is the leader of the group. She was born in a village called Wala Maboleh, in northern Sierra Leone and is forty-six years of age. She is married to a farmer and they have three children. Two of her children are in secondary schools and one is already married.

Mariatu sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), bread and fried cakes. She has been a businesswoman for over twenty years now. With this loan, she will buy palm-oil, vegetable oil, a bag of sugar and a bag of flour to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy palm-oil, vegetable oil, a bag of sugar and a bag of flour to add to her business

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia A. buys bags of onions to sell at Takoradi. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a trader. She has received junior high education.

Emelia has been selling onions in small and large quantities for about two years now and supports her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of onions to be able to supply her customers.

Emelia hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her children's education.

loans.use: To buy extra bags of onions to be able to supply her customers

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is divorced with four children and all her children go to school. Juliet also takes care of five additional family members.  Juliet sells charcoal at her home in Kasubi, one of the city suburbs, and operates this business in a semi-urban area. She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys from her place of work from delivery trucks, which get them from the villages. She has been in this business for a long time and she is proud of it because she has managed to get her own home. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal.  Besides this charcoal business, she is also getting some money from rental rooms.  She sells charcoal at wholesale and at retail and works seven days a week. Her business challenges are defaulters and the rainy season, because she works from an area that is prone to floods.  Her goals and aspirations include educating her children up to university level and developing her remaining plot of land.  She decided to work with MCDT because she wanted to access timely loans. She resides in and owns her house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water . Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Topisia Ene

texts.en:
Topisia Ene K. is 32 years old. She is married to Parsakei K. and is the mother of four children.

Topisia is a farmer and has been farming on her own piece of land for the last three years.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered members. This will be her first loan.  She is planning to spend thirty thousand Kenyan shillings to buy chemicals and fertilizer for her five acre wheat farm. The other twenty thousand shillings will be used to prepare the remaining five acres to plant more wheat. Wheat has proven to do well in this area and the market is readily available as the local millers come to buy the wheat from the farm.

She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Topisia's dream is do large scale farming and attain financial independence. 

She is a hard working woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizer for her wheat farm

loans.name: Soipei Ene Kitaei

texts.en:
Sopia Ene Kitaei T. is 24 years old. She is married to Pariken T. and is the mother of four children.

Sopia is a farmer and does the farming on her own piece of land which she has been working for the last three years.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered members. This will be her first loan. She is planning to spend the fifty thousand Kenyan shillings to buy chemicals and fertilizer for her ten acre wheat farm. Wheat has proven to do well in this area and the market is readily available to both retail and wholesale buyers.

She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Sopia's dream is do large scale farming and have her own farm machinery. 

She is a hard working woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizer for her ten acre wheat farm

loans.name: Kintalel Ole

texts.en:
Kintalel Ole S. is 32 years old. He is married to Timanoi Ene S. and is the father of three school-age children. 

Kintalel is a farmer who farms his own piece of land which he has been working for the last four years.

He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his first loan.  He is planning to use the loan for his twenty acres of wheat which has proven to do very well in this area. Since the farm is located along the main road, it makes it easy for him to get customers for his wheat.  With the profit he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm to increase his wheat production.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can be planting more wheat for commercial purposes. 

Kintalel is a hard working man and determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To use for his wheat farm

loans.name: Meluan Ole

texts.en:
Meluan Ole K. is 53-years-old. He is married to Lantano K. and he is a father of four school-going children. 

Meluan farms on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last five years.

He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his first loan. He is planning to use the loan to buy chemicals and fertilizer for his twenty acres of wheat. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent more land for farming to increase his wheat output.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can be planting more wheat in large scale.

Despite his age Meluan believes he is hard working, and by having the right resources at his disposal he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: Chemicals and fertilizer for wheat farming

loans.name: Iragi Group

texts.fr:
Munyerekane B. est jeune manager,conseillère du groupe de crédit  Iragi, à l’ extrême, elle lève sa main sur la photo, âgée de 38 ans, célibataire, elle héberge 5 enfants dont elle est responsable c'est-à-dire sous sa tutelle. Parmi les quels 3 étudient et 2 autres sont encore gauss.  Munyerekane B. est entrepreneur d’un atelier de couture MAMA JAQUY (tailleuse modéliste). Son atelier est situé dans le quartier Himbi II, avenue W. no 77. Munyerekane B. a commencé cette activité avec 80$, un peu plus tard, elle fut informée de crédit de l’IMF Hekima où elle a bénéficié le crédit de base de 50$ pour renforcer son entreprise. 
Avec  le crédit  de  l’IMF Hekima, Munyerekane B. souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant 20 mètres de tissus, 6 paquets de fils à coudre, broderies, 30 mètres de vaselines, payer le loyer de l’atelier, etc.
 Le grand défi de Munyerekane B. est que l’activité de couture est saisonnière. La couture dépend plus des événements de festivité, de noël, de paquet, de nouvel an, des manifestations telle que la journée internationale de Femmes,les périodes de pointe de mariage, etc. les périodes comme les mois de Mai, juin, et juillet, sont des périodes de  crise pour la plupart des couturiers. Munyerekane B. compte diversifier ses activités par le commerce général des divers  et s’approvisionne dans le grand centre de Kampala-Ouganda. Dans le futur, elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle dans le Sud kivu, ville d’Uvira, ville frontalière de Bujumbura-Burundi.
Munyerekane B. remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits permanents qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grâce à ces crédits, elle parvient à  se prendre en charge, de se préserver aux tentations des hommes, de se protéger contre l'immoralité et la prostitution. En outre de subvenir aux enfants qui sont sous sa tutelle dit- elle.  
Ce groupe Iragi est  composé de 17 membres majoritairement femmes.
texts.en:
Munyerekane B. is the young manager/advisor of the Iragi credit loan group, with her hand raised in the picture. She is 38 years old, unmarried but sheltering five children who are under her care. Three of them attend school and two are not yet old enough. Munyerekane B. runs a tailoring workshop named “Mama Jaquy (tailor/designer)”. Her workshop is located in the Himbi II borough, on W. Avenue. She started her business with $80, and a little later was advised that she had been granted a basic loan of $50 by the Hekima MFI, to help start up her business. With the loan from the Hekima MFI, Munyerekane B. wants to increase her turnover by purchasing 20 meters of clothing fabric, six packs of thread, embroidery, 30 meters of poplin cloth, paying the rent for the workshop, etc. Munyerekane B. biggest challenge is the seasonal nature of the sewing or tailoring business, which is highly dependent on festivities such as Christmas, New Year or Easter, special events such as International Woman’s Day, or peak periods for weddings. May, June and July are crisis periods for most tailors and seamstresses. Munyerekane B. intends to diversify her activities through the retail commerce of general tailoring supplies, which she finds in Kampala, Uganda. In the future her ambition is to buy a plot of land in South Kivu, in Uvira, a town bordering Bujumbura in Burundi. She wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for the loans she has been granted without any collateral, because thanks to these she has been able to take charge of her life, avoid the temptations coming from men, and protect herself from immorality and prostitution. She adds that she is also able to meet the needs of children under hr care. The Iragi group consists of 17 people, for the most part women.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 20 meters of clothing fabric, six packs of thread, embroidery, 30 meters of poplin cloth, pay the rent for the workshop, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Living For Purpose Group

texts.en:
Michen G. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Living For Purpose. She is 43 years old, married and has three children who range from eight to 22 years. She also cares for two siblings. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For five years, Michen has been selling used clothes at the Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She sells in a friendly manner, which keeps customers returning.

She plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 26,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of used clothes.

Her goal is to grow her business and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Michen is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes.

loans.name: Kupere Ole

texts.en:
Kupere Ole K. is 65 years old. He is married to Koitoi K. and he is a father of two school-going children. 

Kupere has been farming his own piece of land for the last six years.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to spend on his twenty acre wheat farm. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent more land for farming to increase his wheat production.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can be planting more wheat for commercial purposes and also build some rental houses. He hopes to become a large scale farmer and buy his own tractor for ploughing.

Despite his age Kupere believes he is hard working and he will achieve his goals.

loans.use: Wheat farming

loans.name: Katayei Ole Lekunya

texts.en:
Katayei Ole Lekunya T. is 41-years-old. He is married to Nookishu T. and he is a father of four school-going children. 

Katayei is a farmer. He does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last five years.
  
He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a Kadet registered client. This will be his first loan. He is planning to plant more wheat which normally does well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can be planting more wheat for commercial purpose. His hope and dream is to become a large scale wheat farmer.

He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To plant five more acres of wheat.

loans.name: Nariku Ene Tananko

texts.en:
Nariku Ene Tananko B. is 24 Years old. She is married to Kilopei Ole Kipaino and a mother of one child.

Nariku is a farmer and she does the farming on her own piece of land which she has been doing for the last three years.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered members in KADET. This will be her first loan. She is planning to spend the thirty thousand to buy chemicals and fertilizer for her five acre wheat farm. Wheat has proved to be doing well in this area and also the market is readily available in the area to both retail and wholesale buyers.

She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming. Nariku's dream is to do large scale farming and to buy a bigger piece of land. 

She is a hard working woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizer for her five acre wheat farm.

loans.name: Sialo Ene Neinda

texts.en:
Sialo Ene Neinda K. is 24 Years old. She is married to Kintalel Ole Sinkayo and a mother of one child.

Sialo is a farmer and she does the farming on her own piece of land which she has been doing for the last three years.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered members in KADET. This will be her first loan. She is planning to spend the thirty thousand to buy chemicals and fertilizer for her five acre wheat farm. She also hopes to spend the other twenty thousand to prepare another five acres of land to plant more wheat. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Sialo's dream is do large scale farming and to buy a bigger piece of land. She is a young hard working woman and with the right resources she can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizer for her five acre wheat farm.

loans.name: Review Leinda Ole Mairoi

texts.en:
Leinda Ole Mairoi K. is 26 years old. He is married to Normeshuki K. and he is a father of two school-going children. 

Leinda is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last four years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a Kadet registered client. This will be his first loan. He is planning to plant more wheat, which normally does well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet the demand for wheat produce.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and have his own farm machinery.

Leinda is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: To plant ten more acres of wheat.

loans.name: Nkorias Ole

texts.en:
Nkorias Ole K. is 41-years-old. He is married to Naisuaku Ene K. and he is a father of four school-going children. 

Nkorias is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last four years.

He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a Kadet registered client. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend the funds to buy fertilizer and some chemicals for his twenty acres of wheat. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his wheat production. 

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can be planting more wheat for commercial and buy his own farm machinery.

He is a hardworking man who is focused on his goals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and some chemicals for his twenty acres of wheat.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
El Señor Edwin R. P. tiene 31 años de edad, el vive con su mujer  y una  hija pequeña de casi 1 años. Ellos viven en inmediaciones de ivirgarzama en una zona agrícola del Trópico, Carrasco, quinta sección, municipio de Puerto Villarroel. 

El Señor Edwin R. P. se dedica a la cría de peces, los cuales vende a los diferentes  restoranes en Ivirgarzama y Valle Sacta el vive en un cuarto en alquiler con los servicios necesarios, ya que el esta empanzando recién una vida familiar, el proviene de una familia muy humilde el trabaja todos los días para el bienestar de su hija y su esposa. 

Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de alevinos para ampliar sus piscinas de peces, y así poder incrementar más sus ingresos y poder ofrecer a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Edwin R. P. is 31 years old and lives with his wife and young daughter who is almost a year old. They reside in the vicinity of Ivirgarzama, an agricultural area of Trópico Carrasco in the fifth section of the town of Puerto Villarroel.

Edwin raises fish to sell to different restaurants in Ivirgarzama and Valle Sacta. He lives in a rental apartment that has all the basic services for his new family. Edwin was raised in a very humble family and works every day for the welfare of his wife and daughter.

He is requesting a loan to buy fish hatchlings so that he can restock and grow his fish pond. This will allow him to generate more income so that he can offer his family a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish hatchlings

loans.name: Ntiti Ene

texts.en:
Ntiti Ene K. is 61 years-old. She is a widow and the mother of two children.

Ntiti is a farmer and for the last five years she has farmed on her own piece of land.

She learned about Kiva partner KADET from other women who are already registered members.  This will be her first loan. She plans to spend twenty thousand KES to buy chemicals and fertilizer for her five acre wheat farm. The other thirty thousand she will use to prepare the remaining five acres to plant more wheat. Wheat does well in this area and there is a market readily available as the local millers come to buy the wheat from the farm.

She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Ntiti's dream is to do large scale farming and attain financial independence. 

Despite the hardship of being a widow, Ntiti is a hard working woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gloria Mabel

texts.es:
La señora Mabel tiene 24 años de edad es viuda, tiene una niña de 5 años y ella vive con sus padres en la Maica Central es una zona rural de la ciudad de Cochabamba ella se dedica a la producción de leche.

Mabel quedo viuda hace como tres meses atrás ella sufrió mucho con la enfermedad de su esposo el tenia leucemia, lucho con él hasta el final tuvo que hacer tratamiento en los cuales ella sufría junto con él y su niña, ella sufría mas porque vivía en la casa de sus suegros que siempre estaban controlando las cosas que hacía, ella es una persona muy trabajadora a pesarse que su esposo estaba muy enfermo ella lo atendía y al mismo tiempo realizaba el trabajo de ordeñar y entregar la leche porque ella era la que pagaba los tratamientos de su esposo y la escuela de su hija, cuando el esposo falleció la madre de su esposo la saco de la casa y por esa razón ella se fue a trabajar con sus padres con los que cuentan con todo su apoyo.

Ella quiere el crédito para comprar una cabeza  de ganado lechero y de esa manera aumentar la producción de leche y poder trabajar y darle una vida mejor a su hija. Ya que ella es muy joven tiene el sueño de estudiar veterinaria y está inscrita en un instituto de la ciudad la cual se da modos para estudiar y trabajar con las vacas y darles tiempo a su hija y colaborar a sus padres en toda la producción de leche ya que ellos tienen un tanque de enfriamiento para poder echar la leche y entregar a PIL.

Ella es una persona muy responsable y dedicada al trabajo que realiza ya que sus padres desde niña le enseñaron a trabajar.
texts.en:
Mabel is 24 years old, a widow, and has a five year old daughter. She lives with her parents in Maica Central, a rural area of the city of Cochabamba. She works producing milk. Mabel has been a widow for about three months. She suffered during her husband's illness. He had leukemia, and fought to the end. He had to have treatments, which she suffered with him and her daughter. She also suffered because she lived at home with her in-laws, who were always controlling the things that she did. She is a very hard-working person. When her husband was sick, she took care of him and at the same time, worked to arrange and deliver the milk because she was the one who paid for her husband's treatments and her daughter's education. When her husband died, her mother-in-law told her to leave the house, so she went to work with her parents, who she could count on for support. She would like a loan to buy a dairy cow and increase her production of milk, so she can work and give a better life to her daughter. Since she was young, she dreamed of being a veterinarian, and she is enrolled in a school in the city that allows her to study, work with cows, spend time with her daughter, and work with her parents to produce milk, since they have a cooling tank to hold the milk and bring it to PIL. She is a very responsible person who is dedicated to the work that she does, since her parents taught her as a child how to work hard.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en: Aidah is a single mother of one and her child goes to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Aidah sells second hand clothes in Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She uses public transport to and from home. She has been in this business for five years.  She buys from the very place where she works. She wants to use this loan to buy more second hand women's clothes.  Besides this clothing business, she lays bricks and rears chickens.  Her customers are mainly women.  Aidah works six days a week. Her business challenges include seasonality and lack of enough capital to sustain her demands. Aidah joined MCDT because she wanted to access capital for her business. Aidah aspires to boost her business and start going directly to Mombasa for clothes.  She resides in and owns a four-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and cement

loans.name: Lilia Esther

texts.es:
En el Barrio Santa María al Sur Occidente de Barranquilla, los vecinos son muy solidarios y constantemente reúnen fondos para obras que embellecen la zona y ayudan a que fluyan nuevos clientes en sitios donde antes no llegaban; este es el entorno en que se desenvuelve Lilia Esther C.   de 71 años y su familia, que viven   muy cerca a un lugar llamado "la Cascada", donde se realizan reuniones políticas y actividades como la celebración del día de la mujer entre otras, impactando el aumento de las ventas en la Miscelánea y refresquería que tiene Lilia, porque siempre hay un motivo de celebración; en la actualidad su refrigeración se ha tornado muy mala, porque un congelador “sacó la mano” y ella quiere reemplazarlo, por eso está solicitando su tercer crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por valor de $1.800.000.

Lilia Esther es viuda y tiene 7 hijos de 33 a 59 años de edad, ella  desde sus 20 años llegó a Barranquilla procedente de Cartagena con una hija de 2 años y la ilusión de mejorar sus ingresos trabajando inicialmente como empleada doméstica;  tiempo después, se comprometió con su cónyuge y tuvo sus otros hijos, compro su primera casa y  desde allí comenzó a preparar y vender alimentos como  sopas, hayacas y fritos, finalmente  adquirió una casa mas amplia en el barrio Santa María, donde aun vive hace mas de 35 años. Lilia es un ejemplar mujer que con su empuje para el negocio, logró criar 7 hijos con muy buenas costumbres, enseñándole principalmente la honestidad y el valor por el trabajo.

Hace casi tres años impulsada por su hija, que también es clienta de la Fundación, se acercó a conocer sus programas y desde entonces ha recibido 2 créditos, con ellos ha ampliado su negocio y adquirió mejores ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades del hogar. Sueña con que algunos de sus hijos, que aun no tienen una casa propia, puedan gozar de un bien  familiar y tiene como meta organizar físicamente  su negocio realizando algunos arreglos locativos.
Sus mayores desafíos están relacionados con las temporadas altas y bajas, a las que siempre debe estar atenta, porque en las altas se incrementan sus ingresos pero también su trabajo y debe ahorrar, para que en “épocas de vacas flacas” o temporadas bajas, ella pueda resolver sus necesidades y no quedarle mal a nadie.
texts.en:
In the neighbourhood of Santa María, south west of Barranquilla, everyone joins together to raise money to make the area more attractive and bring in new customers who otherwise wouldn’t have visited. This is the environment in which 71-year old Lilia Esther C. and her family work. They live very close to a place called “La Cascada” where political meetings and activities like Mothers Day celebrations are held. All these visitors have a beneficial impact on Lilia’s sales of general goods and soft drinks. At the moment she has no refrigeration system as her freezer has broken down, so she wishes to replace it. For this reason she is asking for her third loan with Kiva partner, the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. Lilia Esther is a widow and has seven children aged 33 to 59 years. In her twenties she moved from Cartagena to Banrranqullia with her 2-year old daughter and the dream of increasing her income. At first she worked as a domestic servant. Some time later she got married and had her other children. She bought her first house and began cooking and selling food such as soup, hayacas (meat wrapped in cornmeal dough and banana leaves), and fried items. Later she bought a larger house in Santa María where she has lived now for 35 years. Lilia is a role model with her business drive and her well-mannered seven children. While she was bringing them up, she taught them honesty and the value of work. Encouraged by her daughter (who is also a client of the Foundation), about three years ago Lilia learned more about its programs and since that time has had two loans. She has used the money to expand her business and thus earn more money to cover household expenses. Her dream is that those of her children who do not yet have a home of their own will one day have their own house. Her goal is to make some physical changes to her business. High and low seasons give her some problems as her income is higher at certain times of the year. During those times she has to work harder and make sure she saves money for the tough times so she has enough to live on and not cause problems for anyone.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for her cows

loans.name: Argemira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Preparar, ensamblar, acabar piezas y convertirlas en delicados vestidos para damas , uniformes colegiales, conjuntos para niñas es lo que en toda su vida ha visto hacer en su familia Argemira del Carmen M. Martínez,  quien desde muy niña aprendió este arte y ya adulta lo ha  convertirlo en un buen negocio, que  representa sus principales ingresos de sostenimiento. Es así como ella en Sabanagrande, Municipio del Atlántico, al oriente del mismo,  es una fiel representante del saber confeccionar y con su creatividad también elabora edredones, fundas y adornos decorativos en cada época del año.
Para Argemira los créditos que ha recibido de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo le han permitido mejorar la calidad de sus productos pues pudo comprar una maquinaria apropiada para su línea de productos. En la actualidad  solicita un crédito mixto por valor de $900.000 para comprar materias primas y poder elaborar conjuntos  de niñas,  así como también repuestos para repotenciar su maquinaria.
 Su gran meta es llevar la calidad de sus productos a otras ciudades, para ser conocida y poderlos vender en mayor cantidad. Su desafío es superarse en el plano de actualización relacionada con su arte, porque vive consagrada a su trabajo  y con poco tiempo para ello;  Argemira tiene muchos desafíos y cuando se presentan, sobre todo en las dificultades económicas, siempre se sobrepone con su trabajo y las supera.
texts.en:
Throughout her life Argemira del Carmen M. Martínez has watched her family cut out, assemble, finish parts, and then turn them into stylish women’s clothing, or school uniforms, or children’s outfits. Ever since she was a young girl, she has been learning how to do this art, and now as an adult, it has become a profitable business providing her main income. She lives in Sabanagrande, west of the municipality of Atlántico. Because of her knowledge and creativity she also makes quilts, pillowcases, and ornaments for the different seasons of the year. The loans that Argemira has received from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation have allowed her to improve the quality of her products. She was able to buy the right sort of sewing machine. Now she is asking for a loan to buy the materials needed to make children’s outfits, and spare parts to improve the sewing machine. Argemira’s goal is take her quality products to other towns so she becomes better-known and sells more items. Her challenge is to find the time to keep on improving her work to which she is devoted. She also has financial difficulties but she always overcomes them through work.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sewing items and sewing machine spare parts

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is widowed with two children who go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  Sarah changed her business enterprise from retail shop to poultry farming. She has been in this business for three months.  She wants to use this loan of 900,000 to buy more chicken feed and 200 chicks.  Besides this poultry farming business, she doesn’t have any other side income.  She sells her chicken to all categories of people at retail and wholesale. Sarah works seven days a week and uses public transport to and from buying chicken feeds. Her business challenges include chicken diseases and transportation of feeds from Mengo Kisenyi to her home in Kawempe Bubajwe. Sarah aspires to own 2000 chickens. She joined MCDT because she wanted to increase on her capital base.  Sarah resides and owns her house. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feeds and 200 chicks

loans.name: Afiwa Mawutoè

texts.en:
Madame Afiwa Mawutoè A. has a general store in the Kégwé region of Lomé. She is 52 years-old, married, and has four children. Her husband is a surveyor. Afiwa has had her store since 1975 and she has one employee. She sells all kinds of food products at her shop in Lomé. 

Afiwa requests 300,000 CFA to purchase more merchandise for her shop. This is her first loan from Kiva partner WAGES.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Tunka Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento TUNKA que significa (diez) en Aymara es un banco D. Emprendimiento formado en la zona D. Villa Concepcion, ubicado al sur D. la ciudad D. La Paz. Es una asociacion D. la cual son integrantes 11 personas las cuales han demostrado mucha responsabilidad en sus anteriores creditos, sin tener dias D. atrazo ni fallas en sus cuotas.

Son representadas por la Señora Placida quien actualmente ocupa el cargo D. presidenta D. la asociacion, ella es una persona muy responsable que se dedica a la costura D. enaguas y polleras en su propio domicilio donD. con mucho esfuerzo pudo montar su taller. actualmente solo vive con el esposo quien se dedica a realizar trabajos varios por toda la ciudad. la señora placida invertira el prestamo para la compra D. una nueva maquina D. costura y D. esta manera aumnetra los ingresos D. su negocio, ella esta muy agradecida con la institucion por ofrecerles este apoyo.
texts.en:
The name of the TUNKA communal bank means "ten" in the Aymara language. It was founded in the area of Villa Concepcion, located south of the city of La Paz. It is an association with 11 members, who have demonstrated great responsibility with their previous loans, without late days or missing payments. They are represented by Placida, who currently holds the position of president of the association. She is a very responsible person who works as a dressmaker, making traditional skirts and slips in her own home, where she was able to establish a workshop through much hard work. She currently lives only with her husband, who does various jobs throughout the city. Placida will invest the loan in buying a new sewing machine, so that she can increase her income from her business. She is very grateful to the institution for offering her this support.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a sewing machine

loans.name: God Love Group

texts.en:
Rebecca K. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Love. She is 47 years old, married and has two children who are 25 and 29 years old. She also cares for three siblings. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For 7 years, Rebecca has been selling fruit and vegetable seeds such as watermelon, okra and cabbages at the Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She sells in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning.

She plans to use her 18,000 LRD portion of this 69,000 LRD group loan to buy more fruit and vegetable seeds. Her goal is to expand her business and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Rebecca is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista is a widow with two children who go to school. Teopista also takes care of additional family members. She is a market vendor in Kawempe market selling banana clusters, bunches and curry powder.  She buys bananas from the villages and uses public transport to and from the villages to her stall.  She has been in this business for 30 years. Teopista wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas. She works six days a week and sells at retail and at wholesale.  Teopista’s business challenges include high transport costs from the villages of Masaka to her stall in Kawempe and the rainy season, which makes roads impassable.  She aspires to earn enough profits.  Teopista joined MCDT because of the low interest rate. She owns and resides in a two-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Amélé

texts.en: Madame Amélé A. sells maize and coal at her shop in Lomé, Togo. She is 45 years-old, and married with three children. Amélé has been selling maize and coal since 1999. This will be her first loan from Kiva partner WAGES. She has requested 500,000 CFA to purchase more maize and coal.

loans.use: To purchase maize and coal.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère d’un enfant, cette dame est  très active. Elle a 34 ans mais a démarré le commerce de pagnes depuis plus de 12 ans. Elle achète ses pagnes au grand marché de Lomé et les revend sur les marchés périphériques notamment Assiyéyé.
Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter de nouvelles gammes de pagnes pour conserver sa clientèle.
Elle compte sur les revenus de cette activité pour mieux contribuer aux charges du ménage.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of one child, this lady is very active. She is 34 years old but started a business involving pagnes (colorful West African cloth) over twelve years ago. She buys her cloth at the big market of Lomé, the capital of Togo and resells it at outlying markets, especially Assiyéyé. She is requesting this loan for buying new assortments of cloth in order to maintain her customers. She is counting on the revenues from this business to do more to cover household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pagne cloth

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.en:
Monsieur Kokouvi K. owns a restaurant in Lomé, Togo. He has owned his restaurant since 2007. Kokouvi is married and his wife also works in the restaurant.  They have two children. He is 40 years-old. 

Kokouvi has requested a loan of 300,000 CFA to purchase a freezer and other products for his restaurant. This is his first time seeking a loan from Kiva partner WAGES.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer and food products.

loans.name: Líderes De Pepin Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal los Líderes de Pepin está ubicado en la comunidad de Yananaco, provincia de Huancavelica, departamento de Huancavelica, inicia su segundo ciclo con 10 socias.
Gladys pertenece a la Junta Directiva del bancomunal, su cargo en este ciclo es de fiscal, es casada, tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 18 años de edad que estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general como arroz, azúcar y alimentos de primera necesidad, le gusta tener mercadería surtida en su tienda, los préstamos que recibe los invierte siempre en su negocio. 
Gladys asiste a sus reuniones de bancomunal porque le gusta las capacitaciones y compartir momentos de alegría y tristezas con sus compañeras, es su segundo hogar según nos manifiesta, ha aprendido a ahorrar.
Con el préstamo que ha solicitado comprará frutas de la estación para implementar en su negocio. El sueño de Gladys es que sus hijos tengan una profesión, actualmente con su negocio les apoya en sus estudios, quiere hacer crecer más su tienda y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Los Líderes de Pepin Communal Bank is located in the Yananaco community in the Huancavelica province, Huancavelica department. They are starting their second cycle with ten members. Gladys belongs to the Governing Board of the communal bank. Her office this cycle is finance advisor. She is married and has two children; 11 and 18 years old. The children go to the community school. She sells general groceries like rice, sugar, and basic needs foods. She likes to have her merchandise stocked in her stO.. She always uses the loans she receives for her business. Gladys attends the communal bank meetings because she likes the trainings. She also likes to share happy and sad moments with her colleagues. According to what she tells us, it is her second home. She has learned to save. She will use the requested loan to buy seasonal fruits for her business. Gladys’s dream is for her children to have a profession. Now, with her business, she can support their education. She wants to make her stO. grow mO. in order to get greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit for her business

loans.name: Leslie Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Leslie esta casada y tiene como actividad la venta de ropa especialmente chompas que las distribuye en diferentes lugares y oficinas, este es su segundo credito bajo este financiamiento, ya que ella es muy emprendedora, dinamica y activa ayudando de esta manera a su familia que esta compuesta por su esposo y su pequeño hijo y asi progresar y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia. 
El destino del credito esta oportunidad es para comprar mercaderia aumentando de esta manera  su capital de trabajo y lograr mejores ingresos para ella y su familia, esta muy agradecida con  Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Leslie is married and has a business selling clothing, particularly sweaters, that she distributes in different places and offices. This is her second loan with this institution, and she is very enterprising, dynamic and active. She has a family that includes her husband and a small son. With her business she is helping her family and improving their quality of life. This loan will be used to buy merchandise, increasing her working capital and allowing her to obtain higher earnings for herself and her family. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust provided in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothing)

loans.name: Lorena Elizabeth

texts.es:
Lorena de 31 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo de Guayaquil, por la falta de ingresos y la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio Lorena invirtió sus ahorros hace 5 años en papelerías y vitrinas, también readecuo su casa para ubicar la papelería frente a su casa. 

Lorena a trabajado con esfuerzo y dedicación durante los cinco años. Sus resultados han sido favorables para que siga con su papelería. Trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Vende cuadernos a $ 1.10, lápices $ 0.20, papelería etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, lápices y papelería para su negocio. En el futuro tener dos papelerías.
texts.en:
Lorena is 31 years old. She lives an urban area in Guasmo de Guayaquil. Lack of income and the desperate idea of having her own business caused Lorena to invest her savings five years ago in paper goods and display cases. She also altered her house in order to locate her stationery store in front of her house. Lorena has worked with effort and dedication during those five years. Her results have been favorable to continue with her stationery store. She works from 9:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. everyday. She sells notebooks for $1.10, pencils for $0.20, and paper goods, etc. She will use the loan to buy notebooks, pencils, and paper goods for her business. In the future she wants to have two stationery stores.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks and pencils

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is married to a businessman and they have four children. All her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. Rehema own a charcoal stall in Kawempe, one of the city suburbs, and sells to all categories of people at retail and wholesale. She wants to use this loan of 600,000/= to buy more bags of charcoal. She has been in this business for 20 years.  Besides this charcoal business, she also sells refreshments like soda, passion juice and other eatables.  She works seven days a week.  Her business challenges includes thieves and defaulters.  She aspires to get electricity in her house and also to educate her children. Rehema resides in and owns a four-room house where she stays with eight members.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Constancio

texts.es: El Sr. Constancio tiene como actividad la venta de lubricantes para vehiculos como ser: aceite, liquido de frenos, liquido hidraulico y otros, ademas, de realizar cambio de balatas y pastillas de freno de automoviles y camiones, estas actividades que realiza son la principal fuente de ingreso para el y su familia que esta compuesto por su esposa, doña Florencia y sus tres hijas, que tambien ayudan trabajando y vendiendo fruta en el mercado de villa fatima zona populosa de nuestra ciudad, es una familia muy trabajadora y emprendedora, esta ocacion solicita credito para aumentar su capital de trabajo con la compra de turriles de aceite y compra de repuestos de vehiculos agrandando de esta manera  su tienda y mejorando su calidad de vida, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Constancio sells vehicles lubricants like brake fluid, hydraulic fluid, and others. He also changes car and truck brake pads. These activities are the main source of income for him and his family. His family is comprised of his wife, Florencia, and their three daughters. They help by working and selling fruit in the Villa Fatima market, which is a populous area in our city. The family is very hard-working and enterprising. He is now requesting a loan to increase his working capital to buy barrels of oil and vehicle replacement parts. This way he will be expanding his store and improving his quality of life. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy oil and stock replacement parts

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 45 años, comparte su vida con su esposo e hijos en una casa arrendada. Hace mas D. 3 años se ha dedicado a la actividad agrícola, logrando así intensificar este trabajo, es así que diariamente prepara sus terrenos D. cultivo para la siembra. Por otro lado también se  dedica a la crianza D. reses, en donD. posee una vaca que procura alimentarla bien ya que muy pronto podrá parir un becerro y pueda darle suficiente leche. El trabajo y esfuerzo que puso en su agricultura y ganadería tiene su recompensa, el ver sus frutos sanos y tener animales vigoroso en su establo le da mucho ánimos D. continuar trabajando. Por tal motivo desea aumentar la cantidad D. animales que tiene esto le ayudará en aumentar su productividad. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser responsable con sus pagos, además considera que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. sacos D. abono para sembrar alfalfa que servirá D. forraje para sus animales, asimismo podrá arrendar terrenos D. cultivo para sembrar papa.
texts.en:
Ana is 45 years old, and lives with her husband and children in a rented house. She has been working as a farmer for the past 3 years, and hopes to improve her production. She gets the land ready to plant every day. She also raises cattle, and has a cow that she feeds well and soon will be giving birth and producing milk. All the work and dedication Ana puts into her farm and caddle is paying it off, and seeing healthy vegetables and animals gives her the incentive to improve her productivity. This is her 7th loan with MFP, and she is commited to pay it back responsibly, as she thinks it will be very useful to the improvement of her business. With this loan she plans to buy fertilizers to grow more lettuce that she'll use to feed her cattle, and also to get more land to start planting potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizers and Land to plant potatoes

loans.name: Fousséna

texts.en:
Madame Fousséna B. is 29 years-old. She is married with three children. Her husband works as a courier for the press.

Fousséna has had her business since 2006. This is her first time taking a loan from Kiva partner WAGES. She has requested 300,000 CFA to purchase spices, canned tomatoes and other items for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase spices and canned tomatoes.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Cet homme est un entrepreneur de 31 ans, célibataire, est très dynamique. Il est électricien de formation. Cependant, pour diversifier ses sources de revenus, il fait le commerce de téléphones portables.
Il a démarré cette activité depuis 2005. Il dispose d’une boutique à Agbalépédogan(Lomé) où il expose ses derniers arrivages à la clientèle. Le crédit actuellement sollicité servira à approvisionner sa boutique de nouveaux téléphones portables.
Il espère avec ce crédit, accroître sa part de marché et jouir d’un mieux être financier et social.
texts.en:
This man is a 31-year old entrepreneur who is single and very dynamic. He is an electrician by profession. However, in order to diversify his income sources, he sells mobile telephones. He began this activity in 2005. He has a shop in Agbalépédogan (Lomé) where he displays his latest arrivals to his customers. The loan he is currently requesting will be used to stock up his shop with new mobile telephones. He hopes that with this loan he will be able to increase his market share and enjoy a better financial and social well-being.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mobile telephones

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria de Rosario empeso con su pulperia hace 15 años con la idea de ayudarle a su marido, quien, para esos años solo el trabajaba y su salario no ajustaba para mantener el hogar.

Maria quiere este préstamo para comprar abarrotería para su pulpería.  Este es el primer préstamo que ella toma para su negocio ya que siempre ha logrado mantener su negocio con fondos propios.

Maria tiene 44 años y vive en León.  Ella está casada y con 3 hijos de 12, 21, y 22 años de edad.  Un sueño de Maria un día tener un camión para trasladar sus productos.
texts.en:
Maria de Rosario is 44 years old, married and the mother of three children ages 12, 21 and 22. She lives in Leon. Maria opened her own convenience store 15 years ago with the idea of helping her husband, who was supporting the household by himself. Maria wants this loan so she can buy more merchandise to sell at her store. This is her first loan. She dreams of one day buying a truck to transport her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food products and grains

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is married with five children who all go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Rebecca owns a poultry farm and a charcoal store in Kyebando Nsooba, one of the Kampala city suburbs. She sells to all categories of people at retail and at wholesale.  She wants to use this loan of 700,000/= to buy more bags of charcoal and chicken feed.  She has been in this business for over five years and doesn’t have any other side business.  Rebecca works seven days week and her business challenges include thieves and transportation.  She aspires to improve her  standards of living and to educate her children up to university.  She joined MCDT to generate enough capital for her business. She resides in and owns a three-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bags of  chicken feed and charcoal

loans.name: Yaovi François

texts.fr:
Cet homme âgé de 37 ans est marié et père de 02 enfants. Il est menuisier de formation. Pour maximiser ses revenus, il vend de la quincaillerie. Il fait cette activité depuis 03 ans.
Il s’approvisionne au Ghana et vend ses marchandises à Adidogomé. Actuellement, son stock ne lui permet pas de faire face à la demande de la clientèle. C’est la raison pour laquelle il sollicite ce crédit de WAGES.
Il compte beaucoup sur notre appui financier pour faire décoller ses activités et réaliser de meilleurs rendements.
texts.en:
This 37-year old man is married and father to two children. He trained as a carpenter. In order to maximise his income, he sells hardware. He has been carrying out this activity for three years. He gets his supplies in Ghana and sells his goods in Adidogomé. His current stock does not allow him to meet customer demand and for this reason he is requesting a loan from WAGES. He is counting significantly on our financial support in order to get his activities going and make better profits.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hardware items

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.en:
Madame Ayawa L. is 27 years old. She and her husband have one child.

Ayawa sells cosmetics in her home town of Lomé, Togo and she's been running her cosmetics business since 2005. This will be her first loan from WAGES. She has requested 200,000 CFA to purchase more cosmetic products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics products to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: EL SR. PEDRO NACIO EN CHUQUISACA EL 20 DE ENERO DE 1970 ES CASADO Y TIENE 2 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, AHORA VIVE Y TRABAJA EN SU PARCELA QUE ADQUIRIO MEDIANTE EL SINDICATO DE QUEBRADA ALVARES HACE 25 AÑOS QUE TIENE SU PROPIA PARCELA , EL SIEMBRA MAIZ , PAPA, YUCA, MANI, Y MUCHOS PRODUCTOS QUE SE DEN EN LA COMUNIDAD  TAMBIEN TIENE SU GANADO TODO LO QUE SIEMBRA LO SACA A VENDER AL MERCADO DE EL TORNO, ES MUY TRABAJADOR TIENE SU FAMILIA Y SIEMPRE BUSCA QUE PLANTAR SEGUN A LA TEMPORADA,  EL DINERO DEL CREDITO SERA PARA INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE TRABAJO, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Pedro was born in Chuquisaca on January 20th, 1970. He is married and has two school age children. He now lives and works on his parcel of land that he got through the Quedbrada Alvares syndicate. He has had his own land for 25 years. He grows corn, potatoes, yucca, peanuts, and lots of products that are grown in the community. He also has livestock. He takes everything he grows to sell in the El Torno market. He is very hard-working. He has his family. He always looks to plant according to the season. The money from the loan is for increasing his working capital. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting him the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva tiene 32 años, vive con sus 2 hijos y su madre en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas, desde entonces y durante 15 años ha trabajado de manera independiente, cuidando sus vacas y sus tierras de cultivo, en donde siembra  maíz, papa arveja y zanahorias. Durante la temporada de cosecha lo lleva a comercializar al principal mercado de su ciudad. Para Eva realizar estas tareas son muy sacrificados pero a la vez recompensando, ya que ha logrado mejor su calidad de vida es por ello que  quiere continuar  trabajando y  emprendiendo mas en sus ingresos con la venta  al por mayor de sus cosechas. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de un becerro para intensificar su ganadería.
texts.en:
Eva is 32 years old and lives with her two children and her mother in their own house. Since she was a little girl she's been doing farm work, and has always worked independently, taking care of her caddle and land where she plants corn, potatoes and olives. During the harvest, she sells her products at the town's farmer's market. Eva works very hard but she believes she's seeing rewards, since her lifestyle has improved, and she wants to keep growing her business by offering more products and gaining more clients. This is her 7th loan with MFP, and she promises to pay it back responsibly, and thinks the money will be really useful in improving her business. She is using this loan to buy calf and intensify her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a calf

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: LA SRA. FLORA VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO DISTANTE A 40 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ, EN EL BARRIO SAN MARTIN DE DICHA LOCALIDAD, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO CHOFER EN UN RADIO MOVIL(TRANSPORTE DE PERSONAS URBANO), TIENEN 2 HIJOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO SOLICITADO ES PARA COMPRAR UN EXHIBIDOR DE TORTA, PARA SU NEGOCIO,  SU ACTIVIDAD ES LA VENTA DE JUGO DE FRUTAS Y LA VENTA DE TORTA, SE SIENTE AGRADECIDAD CON LA INSTITUCION POR BRINDARLE EL APOYO ECONOMICO FINANCIERO, PARA SEGUIR CRECIENDO EN SU ECONOMIA, Y AYUDARLE A SU ESPOSO EN EL SUSTENTO DE SU HOGAR.
texts.en:
Flora lives in the town of El Torno, 40 km from the city of Santa Cruz, in the San Martin neighbourhood. Her husband works as a driver in a radiomovil (an urban mode of human transportation). They have 2 school-aged children. The requested loan is destined for the purchase of a display case for cakes, for her business. She sells fruit juice and cakes. She is grateful to the institution for offering her this economic support. This will help her to continue growing financially, and to help her husband with household costs.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: an increase in working capital

loans.name: Estrella Del Mar Group

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 13 años de tener su negocio en que vende bebidas y fritangas para ofrecer a sus clientes.  Quiere este préstamo para Ella está casada y tiene 50 años de edad.
Deysi tiene 4 años de tener su negocio en que vende granos básicos y otros alimentos.  Quire este préstamo para comprar granos básicos y productos de consumo para el hogar.  Ella tiene 66 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo quien es adulto.
Este es el 14 préstamo que saca el Grupo Solidario Estrella Del Mar, y los prestamos se han usado para invertir en negocio.
texts.en:
Alicia has had her business for 13 years now, selling beverages and snacks to her clients. She wants this loan to improve her business. She is 50 years old and married. Deysi has had her business for the past 4 years, selling basic grains and other food products. She wants this loan to buy more grains and products for the home. She is 66 years old, married and the mother of a grown-up son. This is the 14th loan for the Estrella del Mar Solidarity Group and they have used the money to invest in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Luz Milda

texts.es: Luz Milda C. C., tiene la edad de 38 años, está casada, y vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 15,11 y 9 años de edad, y son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Luz Milda  también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en:
Luz Milda C. C. is 38 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their three children, who are 15, 11, and 9 years old, and who are their greatest priority. She wants the loan to help her farm, specifically for the harvest of coffee. The idea is to buy manure and fertilizer. She hopes to give the right maintenance to the coffee cultivation to attain a higher quality and to earn the highest income possible when it is time to harvest. This is the first time she is requesting a loan from FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the opportunities that they offered her.

Doña Luz Milda has been working for many years in agriculture. She hopes in the future to offer her family a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Help for the cultivation of coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase computers

loans.name: Leticia Monica
