Este trabajo se dio ya que el trabajaba para la empresa plásticos moderno y ahí logro sus conexiones, y nace la idea de poner su propio negocio, con el objetivo de obtener mejores beneficios y poder apoyar a sus hijos ya que la educación y la alimentación es cara en estos tiempos de crisis en nuestros país.

Con este financiamiento comprara desperdicios de reciclaje a mayor cantidad para lograr ventas altas. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa en  las ventas lo que le permite salir a colocar a mayores clientes y ella vende en la casa. Gracias a esta inversión espera un crecimiento en  su negocio.
texts.en:
Eddy lives in the Sabana Grande neighborhood with his family. He has five beautiful children, and he is supporting them so that they can go to school and get a good education. His work for the past several years has been recycling plastics where he has his buying and selling connections. He started this work because he used to work for a modern plastics company. That is how he got his connections. The idea of setting up his own business was born. His objective was to get greater benefits to be able to help his children. Education and food are expensive during these times of crisis in our country. He will use the loan to buy greater quantity of recyclable rubbish to have higher sales. His wife helps him with the sales. This allows him to leave to find more customers, and she sells at home. Thanks to this investment he hopes his business will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater quantity of recyclable plastic to help cover costs and expenses

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 35 años de edad, comparte su vida con sus cuatro hijos y juntos viven en casa de su madre. Su trabajo consiste en vender ropa de forma ambulante, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 6 años atrás, tiempo en el cual ha ganado mucha experiencia, conociendo las necesidades y gustos de la clientela. Es por ello, que al adquirir sus prendas, los hace pensando en el gusto y selección de sus compradores. María se siente contenta con su trabajo, pues le da independencia y libertad para dedicarles tiempo a sus hijos, que aún están en edad escolar. Otra de las ventajas que le da su trabajo es el poder trabajar en el mismo rubro que su madre, pues ambas venden ropa acompañándose muchas veces en la venta. En un futuro desea sacar adelante su negocio poniendo algo más fijo, pero María sabe que aún le hace falta capital y mucho trabajo para lograrlo es por ello que trabaja con tantas ganas para conseguirlo. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se compromete una vez más a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir para así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old and shares her life with her four children. They live together in her mother’s house. She has been selling clothing on foot for more than six years and has managed to gain lots of insight on her customers’ needs and wants. Because of this she takes her customers into account when acquiring her merchandise. María is happy with her work because it gives her some independence and allows her to spend time with her children, who are of school age. Another advantage she has is that it allows her to work in the same field as her mother. They both sell clothing and they often go out together to sell. Someday she wants to move her business ahead and establish a more permanent location, but María knows that she needs more working capital and lots of hard work, but she is anxious to make it happen. This will be her second loan through MFP and she is committed to being punctual with her payments. She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing in quantity in order to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: La señora Rosa María es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, desde hace un año pensó en invertir en un negocio, en el que ahora ella trabaja; esta es una dulcería la cual es llamada “Santa Rosa” donde vende mucha variedad de dulces, chocolates, botanas y también abarrotes. A Rosa le gusta tener artículos diferentes en todos los aspectos marca y sabores; es por ello que en este momento requiere de un préstamo para invertir mas en el negocio para ofrecer al cliente calidad.
texts.en:
Rosa María is a hard working, enterprising woman. Last year she thought about investing in the business that she now runs; a candy store called, “Santa Rosa,” where she sells a variety of candy, chocolates, snacks, and groceries. She likes to stock a variety of brands and flavors. She needs this loan in order to buy more items for the business and continue to offer good quality to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Luz Angélica

texts.es:
Luz tiene 27 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos D. 7 y 3 años D. edad en el sector El Pescador del distrito D. San José, un distrito pesquero D. L. provincia D. Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicado a veinte minutos D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace cinco años aproximadamente a L. venta D. choclos cocidos y humitas (plato típico D. origen andino hecho a base D. una masa D. maíz cocido, aliñado, envuelto en hojas D. mazorca y finalmente tostado en las mismas hojas), esta actividad L. realiza todos los dias en los exteriores del mercado del distrito D. San José y le sirve para agenciarse D. ingresos que utiliza para ayudar a su esposo, que es albañil, a solventar los gastos familiares.

Adicionalmente Luz venD. carbón en su puesto, elL. también utiliza este combustible para preparar los alimentos que venD. a sus clientes, actualmente desea adquirir ollas y una pequeña cocina para mejorar su negocio, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Luz es una madre D. familia bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos una buena educación para que puedan estudiar una carrera superior en el futuro. En L. zona donD. vive elL. es considerada por sus vecinos como una mujer honesta y colaboradora.
texts.en:
Luz is 27 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two children, ages 7 And 3 in the El Pescador sector of the San José district. This is a small district in the Lambayeque province, located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the past five years she has been selling boiled corn and "humitas" (a typical dish of Andean origin maD. from corn flour dough which is dressed, wrapped in corn husks and toasted). She does this every day on the outskirts of the San José district market. She uses this income to help her husband, who works as a mason, with the family expenses. Luz also sells charcoal from a stall and also uses this fuel to prepare her dishes. She wants to acquire pots and a small stove in order to improve her business, so she is asking for her first loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) through Edpyme Alternativa. Luz is a very hard working mother, committed to her family. Her greatest desire is to be able to proviD. her children with a good education so that they can establish careers in the future. Her neighbors consider her to be a very honest and hard working person.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Vuthy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vuthy S. is a CD and VCD seller who owns a small store to support her business. She is 49 years old. Her husband, Mr. Sok M., is an ambulance car driver who earns a small salary to support his family. This couple has a child who is employed in a private company. 

Mrs. Vuthy S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members, consisting of 18 people from Preak Cheang Prom village in Kandal province. Each member of this village bank will use their loan for different purposes. In order to enlarge her business, Mrs. Vuthy S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more CDs and VCDs.

loans.use: To buy more CDs and VCDs

loans.name: Thavy's Group

texts.en: This group loan, which consists of eight members, is located in Chher Teal village in Kandal province. Mrs. Samnang L. is 31 years old and is the village bank president who has selected by the members. The members of this village loan will use it to buy supplies, equipments and other items to support their different purposes. Mrs. Samnang L. is a pig breeder while her husband, Mr. Sopheap Pael, is a police officer. For supporting pig breeding, Mrs. Samnang L. decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food for pig breeding. This couple has four childR. who all are students in the local school. The childR. also help their mother with her business.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en: Four people are making a group loan, located in Sampan village in Kandal province. Mrs. La K. is 51 years old. She is the group leader of this loan, as selected by the members. The members of this group loan will use the funds to support their different purposes. Mrs. La K. is a farm laborer receiving a small salary to support her family while her husband, Mr. Hoapheng Kith, supports his family by making cow string. In order to support the cow string business, Mrs. La K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy raw materials to support her husband's business. This couple has a child who is an iron welder.

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Srey Lean's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Lean L. is a 28 year old married woman and is the village bank president selected by ten members, located in Krang Koam village in Kandal province. With this loan, the members will purchase supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purposes. Mrs. Srey Lean L. is a grocery seller and owns a small store. Mrs. Srey Lean L. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more groceries to enlargen her business. Her husband, Mr. Veasna M., is a car driver receiving a small salary to support his famiL.'s costs of living. This couple has two children; one is a student in the local school while the youngest one is 2 years old.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vuthy's Group

texts.en: Four people are making a group loan, located in Ta Loek village, in Kandal province. Mr. Vuthy S. is a 30 year old married man. He is the leader of a group loan who has been selected by the members. Each member of this loan will use the funds to support their different purposes. Mr. Vuthy S. is a motorcycle taxi driver and his wife, Mrs. Sophea Sim, is a seamstress in a garment factory. With both positions, they can earn a small income to support their family's costs of living. In order to increase their income and to improve the family's standard of living, Mr. Vuthy S. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and chickens for breeding. This couple has two children; one is attending in the local school while the youngest one is 5 years old.

loans.use: To buy piglets and chickens.

loans.name: Heoun's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Hoeun S. is a 31 year old married woman and is the village bank president selected by nine members, located in Reang Chaor village, in Kandall province. The members of this village loan will use the funds to support their different purposes. Mrs. Hoeun S. and her husband, Mr. Ven Soeun, are rice middlemen to earn funds for their family's costs of living. For supporting this business, Mrs. Hoeun S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy more rice to sell. Aside from this business, Mr. Ven Soeun is a fisherman earning a little income to support his family's costs of living. Mrs. Hoeun S. is a mother of two children who are all students in the local school.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy more rice.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha M. is 35 years old and is the leader of this group loan having been selected by its four members. They are located in Boueng Kroam village in Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use the loan to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Sokha M. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice and corn. For this farm, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to support her farm crops.

Mrs. Sokha M. is a widow with two children who all both students in the local school and also support their mother farming.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Romnick

texts.en:
Romnick M. is from the village of Palutan. He is 20 years old. Romnick is single. To make a living, Romnick plants, harvests, and sells corn. Romnick has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 50000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Romnick joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romnick has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Romnick is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be Romnick's third loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Aura Senith

texts.es:
Aura M. Tamara tiene 66 años  vive en la Urbanización playa, a 10 minutos de las principales universidades de Barranquilla,  es casada y tiene 9 hijos de 28 a 49 años de edad. Su principal ingreso proviene de su  tienda/panaderia llamada: “Panadería La Mejor”, para la cual necesita comprar  materias primas e insumos como harina, vitina y  azúcar principalmente y también con este dinero, completará la cuota para adquirir una nevera vitrina, que le hace mucha falta para exhibir elegantemente  los refrescos,  conservar frescas frutas, embutidos  y lácteos que también vende en su negocio.
Aura llegó a Barranquilla procedente del Carmen de Bolívar desde hace 10 años, allí tenía su panadería y tienda, y posteriormente logró montar una droguería y panadería en un barrio del sur de Barranquilla, pero no le fuè bien, porque como se había ubicado en un sitio no muy seguro, fuè atracada y se puso  muy temerosa y suspendió su actividad, pero desde hace dos años volvió a insistir en su negocio y le compró a su  hija  una tienda panadería, la cual se encuentra ubicada en la casa de su hermano  en calidad de arriendo.  Asì  Aura se decidió a seguir  teniendo su negocio de panadería  y es la  propietaria  de “Panadería La Mejor” pues ya lo registró  en la Cámara de Comercio;  ahora ella  está a cargo  de él en el corregimiento la Playa, un lugar que por su cercanía al mar goza de  mucha actividad pesquera; desde allí  es ayudada por su hija y tiene un empleado, que  prepara los panes, de su  negocio y hay mucho reconocimiento por  parte de sus clientes en virtud de la calidad de sus  panes: pan dulce, pan piñita, pan de mantequilla, pan tajado, tostadas y pudines, su agradable y fresco sabor y su inigualable olor a pan caliente, hace que diariamente en  las tardes despierte el deseo de consumirlo, por eso su clientela permanece, además de que su ubicación es clave para su buen desempeño, ya que se encuentra en  un sitio estratégico en el barrio Adelita char, por eso en este negocio  aplica muy bien el adagio que dice “se vende como pan caliente”
 Desde su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, ella pudo  completar su capital de trabajo y empezar nuevamente  a trabajar en su negocio y sobre todo  pudo lograr  la integración de su familia alrededor  de una actividad productiva, por eso sueña conque su negocio se amplié y adicionarle una miscelánea, para que otros familiares trabajen en su negocio, lo que se constituye justamente en su gran desafío.
texts.en:
Aura M. Tamara is 66 years old and lives in the urban subdivision of La Playa, which is ten minutes away from the main universities of Barranquilla. She is married and has nine children between the ages of 28 and 49. Her main source of income is from her general store-bakery called “The Best Bakery”. She needs to buy materials and supplies such as flour, a display case, and primarily sugar. Part of the money will be used to pay off the loan she used to buy a refrigerator case which she desperately needed to neatly store soft drinks, fresh fruits, sausages, and dairy products that she sells in her business.

Aura arrived in Barranquilla ten years ago from Carmen de Bolivar. She previously had a bakery and store in Carmen de Bolivar, but she later opened a drugstore and bakery in a neighborhood in southern Barranquilla. That business did not do well because it was situated in a location that was not very secure. She became very fearful after being robbed and decided to cease operation. Two years ago, Aura decided to go back into business by acquiring a bakery for her daughter that is located in a nice house that her brother rents. Here she decided to continue with her bakery business and is now the owner of “The Best Bakery”, which is already registered with the Chamber of Commerce. She assumed full control of her business in La Playa, a place that experiences a lot of fishing because of its close proximity to the sea. Aura's daughter assists her and she also has one employee who prepares the breads. The business is well-known among her customers for the quality of her baked goods including sweet bread, pineapple bread, buttered bread, toast, and puddings. The nice fresh flavor and unique smell of warm bread made every afternoon awakens the desire to eat it, which is why her customers come back for more. Being in a good location has also been a key to her success. She is now located in a strategic area in the neighborhood of Adelita Char. The old adage “sells like hotcakes” now applies very well to her business.

Since receiving her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Aura has been able to establish her working capital and reopen her business. Most of all, she was able to integrate her family into a productive activity. Her greatest wish and main challenge is to expand her business and open a variety store so that other relatives can work in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baking ingredients and a display case; pay off an existing loan that was used to buy a refrigerator case

loans.name: Lee's Group

texts.en:
This village loan group, which consists of fourteen people, is located in Koh Krabei Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Lee S. is 56 years old. She was selected by the group members to be the village bank president. The members of this village loan group will use their portions of the loan to purchase supplies, equipment, and other items to support their different businesses. 

Mrs. Lee S. and her husband, Mr. Chan Thorn BU., sell bananas and flowers. With this business, they can earn a small income to support their family. To support this business, Mrs. Lee S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more bananas and flowers to enlarge her business. This couple has four children. One child is a laborer in Malaysia. The other three are students and also supports their parents' business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and flowers

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn N. is from the village of Research Minante in Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 59 years old. Evelyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a general store where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 33000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Evelyn's fifth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Editha

texts.en:
Maria Editha C. is from the village of Barangay Roxas in Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 26 years old. Maria Editha is single. To make a living, Maria Editha owns and operates a general store where she sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Maria Editha has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Maria Editha joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Editha is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Maria Editha's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
For the second time, Diana P. is requesting a loan from Kiva through ASHI. This loan will be used to support her hog-raising business. She will sell the hogs that she has raised over the past four months to people in her village or in the market. The proceeds will be a great source of income that will augment the small and sporadic earnings of her husband, who is a hired laborer and, at times, a fisherman. 

By sustaining a hog business, Diana hopes to have more profit to be able to support the needs of her family, especially her four children whom she considers to be angels. They range in age from two to nine years old and they are Diana’a inspiration to work hard and expand her business. Considering their innocence about how poverty can affect their future, she gains strength to hold on to her dream of improving their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets for her hog business.

loans.name: Sreng's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Sreng T. is 63 years old. He was selected by the members to be the village bank president. The village bank is located in Kbal Seh Village in Kandal Province. The members of this village bank will use their portions of the loan to purchase equipment, supplies and other items to support their different businesses. 

Mr. Sreng T. and his wife, Mrs. Seoun S., sell pork. They earn a small income to support their family. Mr. Sreng T. decided to ask for a loan to buy more pork to sell. With this loan, he hopes to increase income and improve the family's living conditions. In addition to their pork business, they are also farmers who own a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) plot of land on which they grow rice. This couple has an adult child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more pork

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe D. C. is from the village of Research Minante 1 in Cauayan City. She is 57 years old. Fe is widowed and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Fe sells fruit, frozen fish, and vegetables in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Fe joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Fe's eighth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.
 
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kam

texts.en:
Mrs. Kam T. is a 25-year-old married woman who lives in Trabaek Pok Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Peng Rin, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow rice for a living. In addition to farming, they are also fishermen who earn a small income to support their family. 

Mrs. Kam T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fishing supplies to support her fishing business. This couple has two children who are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy G. is from the village of Research Minante 1 in Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 46 years old and married. To make a living, Juvy owns and operates a general store where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Juvy is just starting this business.

In 2006, Juvy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Juvy's seventh loan from ASKI. loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy B., age 31, and her husband, Mr. Chanra Khem, age 39, have been married since 1993. They have four children, two sons and two daughters. One of their children works in a garment factory, two attend school, and another one is still very young. The family lives along National Road Number five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Chanthy and her husband are farmers who grow vegetables and mushrooms. She does not have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her vegetable and mushroom farm, so she is asking for a loan of $1,000 to supplement her capital.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en:

Mrs. Sokunthea C. owns a small store where she sells coffee and groceries. Mrs. Sokunthea C. decided to ask for a loan to purchase more groceries to enlarge her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Samnol Sok, is a police officer who receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has three children. Two of the children attend the local school;  the youngest one is just 5 years old.

loans.name: Soksan

texts.en:
Mrs. Soksan P. (pictured here), has been married since 2004 and has two young sons. She lives with her parents on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Soksan has been a silk weaver since 2000, a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband is also a silk weaver. They sell their finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes them to Phnom Penh to sell. In addition, she runs a grocery store. 

Soksa has asked for Kiva loan several times before. She now is requesting another loan of $300 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk for her weaving business

loans.name: Sey

texts.en:
Mr. Sey P., age 40, and his wife, Mrs. Sokong Keo, age 33, have been married since 1991. They have five children: three sons and two daughters, all of whom attend school. He also has a sister who is a garment factory worker living with him. They are living suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sey is a farmer. He grows rice on his farmland in the village. He also raises cows at home. His wife sells dessert in the village. 

Sey’s sister does not have her own motorbike to get to work, so she has to spend a lot of money for traveling costs. Hence, Sey is asking his first loan of $1,000 to help buy a motorbike for his sister to get to work. She will be able to save money by not spending much on traveling costs any more.

loans.use: To buy motorbike for his sister to get to work.

With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family's standard of living. Mrs. Kiev L. is a widow with four children. Two of her children are seamstresses in the garment factory and the other two are students.

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 21 people who live in Angk Khlaeu village in Kandal province. The loan members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes so they can improve their businesses in the future.

Mrs. Kheoun E. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She is a farmer who owns one hectare of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She is a widow with four children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, whilst another is a laborer, another is a security guard, and the other is attending the local public school. Mrs. Kheoun E.'s problem is that her house is too old to live in, so to improve the living conditions of her family, she is asking for a loan to fix her old house.

All the members are shown in the photo but one of them is blocked.

loans.name: Ashrafi's Group

texts.en:
Ashrafi is a resident of the mid-sized city of Riwind in Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms. She has been living in it with her family for over ten years. Her husband's name is M. A. and he is involved in a dairy business. He has a dairy cow from which he gets milk to sell to the local community. His income helps him to manage the financial expenses of the family. 


On seeing the hard work and devotion of her husband, Ashrafi decided to share the financial burden with him and started sewing clothes three years ago. Originally she made her relatives use her to sew their clothes and, seeing the satisfactory results, they have now paid her and given her more of their clothes to sew. She also, now, receives orders from her neighbors and charges them Pak Rs. 100 to 150. Now they can both manage their financial expenses efficiently using their earnings. 


Ashrafi is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase another dairy cow and increases his profits.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow to increase profit

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana Román A., tiene 45 años y vive en el barrio La pradera de Barranquilla, tiene un hijo de 19 años  que estudia en la universidad, con el que sueña que al finalizar su carrera, pueda verlo exitoso con su profesión.
Ana  Román es un cliente que desde el año 2002 participa en las Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, y  que sabe en qué momento solicita cada crédito, porque conoce muy bien cuanto se gana y cuanto se debe gastar; cuando inició su relación con esta organización lo hizo para fortalecer su negocio de mercancía como prendas de vestir de distribución en  su vecindad y en su sitio de trabajo en una mueblería, donde hasta la presente está empleada y ahora lo hace para renovar su baño y hacer levante de paredillas en el patio de su casa  para tener mayor seguridad. Con sus anteriores financiamientos logrò mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y tiene como meta seguirlo haciendo hasta que su casa esté totalmente adecuada, por eso està solicitando este crédito por valor de  $1.200.000.
Ana vive en un sitio muy comercial ubicado en el suroccidente de la ciudad, muy cercana a comunidades religiosas dedicadas a hacer desarrollo comunitario en comunidades y apoyadas por organizaciones internacionales, lo cual ha ayudado al mejoramiento de su barrio y a hacer que mucha más gente estudie, tenga negocio y mejore sus relaciones familiares, es decir tenga un buen vivir.
texts.en:
Ana is 45 years old and lives in the La Paradera de Barranquilla neighborhood. She has a 19 year old son who attends university and her dream is to see him complete his studies and succeed in his career. Ana has been working with " Fundación Mario Santo Domingo" since 2002. She knows when it's the best time to request loans because she is well aware of how much she earns and how much she should save. She began her relationship in order to increase her inventory of articles of clothing, and be able to deliver within her neighborhood and at a furniture store, where she is currently employed. She is requesting this loan in order to be able to make improvements to her bathroom and repair the walls around her patio to improve the security of her home. She was able to make other improvements with the money from her past loans and her goal is to continue making improvements until her home is adequate. She is asking for a loan of 1,200,000 COP ($625). Ana lives in a commercialized zone, located in the southwest of the city, very near religious communities dedicated to community development and supported by international organizations. They have helped improve her neighborhood and made it possible for many other people to study, start businesses, and improve their family relations; in other words, improving lives.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Hamidan's Group

texts.en:
Hamidan is a resident of the mid-sized city of Riwind, Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living there with her family for over twenty years. Her husband's name is M. I. and he runs a sanitary shop in the market. He has been in this profession for seven years.  


To increases their family income, Hamidan makes embroidered dresses to order. She receives orders from the cloth shops and completes a dress in a day, making Pak Rs. 500 profit on it. They both use their income to pay for utilities and to save for a rainy day.

 
Hamidan is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase, in bulk, sanitary supplies such as taps and water pipes and increase the profits of his business.

loans.use: to purchase sanitary supplies in bulk to sell

loans.name: Jailer

texts.es:
Jailer S. A. de 37 años es oriundo del Carmen de Bolívar, donde tienen sus tierras él y su papá, ambos siembran, Jailer ñame y su papá yuca en su terreno. Desde muy pequeño conoce y aprecia las delicias de estos dos productos, por eso justamente son la base de  su principal negocio que desarrolla en el municipio de Soledad, donde vive con su familia conformada por su cónyuge y su hijo de 10 años.

Jailer se levanta desde las 5 de la mañana y en su moto lleva los productos que piden las 25 tiendas que en la actualidad tiene como clientes, él reparte durante toda la mañana, ñame, yuca y también cuando hay cosecha el famoso y muy reconocido aguacate “carmero” o sea sembrado en  “El Carmen de Bolívar” 

Jailer no todas las veces trae ñame y yuca sembrados en su  tierra  y la de su papá, también compra en Ovejas y  en Montería cuando se hace necesario; como en la actualidad quiere vender en estos municipios el empaque de estos productos   y aprovechar el mismo viaje para traer  su ñame, yuca y aguacate, está solicitando un crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, (organización donde está desde el año hace dos años) por valor de $2.000.000, con él comprará 50 resistentes bolsas llenas de yuca y ñame, aguacates carmeros que le dan buena utilidad y empaques que venderá en el mercado de los municipios proveedores de su producto.

Este negocio lo inició Jailer cuando se retiró de la Central de Abastos por su extenso horario de trabajo  de 3: 00 AM a 8: 00 PM, agravado por su muy bajo el salario, la poca dedicación de  tiempo a su familia y además,  porque permanecía con agotamiento permanente; así fue como decidido, independizarse e iniciar su negocio de vender verduras, tomate de árbol y aguacate, buscando la mejor opción que generara mejores ingresos y como conocía a muchos tenderos, empezó a hacer la preventa y pronto se llenó de muchos pedidos especialmente de ñame, yuca y aguacate.

Desde que llegó a la Fundación ha logrado pasar de tener como medio de transporte una bicicleta a una moto, en la que carga sus bultos, y acceder a mayor número de clientes, con mayor cantidad de sus  productos, porque antes los compraba a crédito a plazo de un día, y si le quedaban en existencia tenia dificultades con su proveedores viajeros y perdía credibilidad en el mercado. Hora trabaja mas holgado con su dinero de crédito y sueña con que su hijo se convierta en un profesional y respecto a él se ve en el futuro con una camioneta distribuidora de productos de la canasta doméstica y  extendido en toda Barranquilla y otros municipios del departamento del Atlántico.
texts.en:
Jailer S. A. is 37 years old and a native of Carmen de Bolivar, which is where he and his father own farmland on which they grow cassava and yams. From a young age, he has come to know and appreciate the delight associated with these two products since they form the basis of his main business that he developed in the town of Soledad. There he lives with his family, which consists of his wife and ten year old son.

Jailer wakes up every morning at 5am and delivers his products by motorcycle to 25 stores that make up his existing customer base. Throughout the morning he distributes cassava and yams that he harvested, as well as the famous “carmero” avocado that is grown in Carmen de Bolivar.

Jailer may not always have yams and cassava to sell from either his land or his father’s, so he also buys sheep in Montería when necessary. He wants to take advantage of his trips to Montería by seizing the opportunity to sell yams, cassava, and avocados while he is there. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo (which he joined two years ago) in the amount of 2,000,000 COP. He will buy 50 sturdy bags filled with cassava, yams, and carmero avocados so that he can sell his products in the markets where his suppliers are located.

Jailer started this business after he quit his job at the central municipal supply depot, where he worked an extensive schedule from 3am to 8pm, which was made worse by the low pay. Due to the exhaustion and the lack of time to devote to his family, he decided to become independent and start selling vegetables, tomato plants, and avocados. He is always looking for better ways to earn more income and eventually became acquainted with several shopkeepers who started ordering yams, cassava, and avocados from him.

Since joining Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Jailer has been able to upgrade his means of transportation from a bicycle to a motorcycle so that he can travel with cargo, access more customers, and sell more of his products because credit was available to him. Otherwise, he would have had difficulty traveling to his suppliers and would have eventually lost credibility in the marketplace. He is now more comfortable working with credit and dreams of seeing his son become a professional and looking up to him. In the future, he hopes to own a distribution truck so that he can sell basic necessities throughout Barranquilla and in other towns in the district of Atlántico.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 50 bags of cassava, yams, and avocados to sell

texts.ru:
Зарабатывать на хлеб насущный – умение, которым должен обладать каждый человек. Родители именно с этой целью тратят средства, отправляют детей в школы, училища, или техникумы, или, наконец, сами учат детей тому, что сами умеют, для того, чтобы их ребёнок, смог прокормить себя, когда вырастет. Везде конкуренция, и чтобы сохранить себе «место под солнцем» надо быть лучшим в своём деле. И в это очень непростое для народа Кыргызстана время, приятно наблюдать позитивные сдвиги среди простого народа в отношении предпринимательства. Ыбыкеева Асылкул – лидер данной группы. Асылкул, вот уже шестнадцать лет занимается фермерством и воспитывает шесть дочерей. Старшие её дочери, всячески помогают ей, и Асылкул удаётся параллельно заниматься скотоводством. В этом, Асылкул помогает её муж, который также работает водителем. Ранее её муж уже имел опыт в сельском хозяйстве. Это именно у него Асылкул и научилась заниматься земледелием. Сейчас старшей дочери двадцать два года, второй дочери двадцать. Остальные дочери учатся в школе. Асылкул мечтает о том, чтобы купить дом в Бишкеке, так, чтобы дочери могли получить высшее образование в городе. Сейчас Асылкул сорок пять лет, она полна сил, и хочет, чтобы, у её детей была другая жизнь. Асылкул очень надеется получить этот кредит и вложить средства на приобретение ГСМ и семян картошки. 

Партнёры Асылкул по группе:

Тентиеву Тойчубеку, сорок три года. Он является членом фермерского хозяйства. У Тойчубека четверо детей. Чтобы прокормить семью, приходится работать и жене Тойчубека. Они вместе занимаются фермерством. Сейчас дети учатся в ВУЗах, и расходы семьи растут. Тойчубек обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить ГСМ.

Аруновой Анаре тридцать года. Муж Анары работает руководителем одного из международных проектов по развитию. Анара мать двоих детей. Она не из тех, кто сидит дома, и ждёт, чтобы муж приносил домой деньги. Анара занимается сельским хозяйством. Она уже имеет большой опыт – шестнадцать лет. Анара не стала ждать, пока муж ей даст нужную сумму. Она надеется получить этот кредит, чтобы купить ГСМ.

Белек кызы Мире тридцать семь лет. Её муж работает водителем экскаватора, а сама Мира работает контролёром. Одной зарплаты на то, чтобы содержать семью и на повседневные нужды не хватает. Мира с мужем решили заниматься скотоводством. Сейчас она нуждается в кредите, который позволил бы ей купить корову. 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---


This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Earning daily bread is an ability which every person should possess. Parents use their financial means with the purpose to send children to schools, colleges and universities and also teach their children what they know so that their children can support themselves when they are older. Competition is everywhere and to secure your own "place under the sun" one has to be the best in their business. At this very difficult for Kyrgyztan time it's very pleasant to see positive changes amongst simple folk in entrepreneurship. Asylkul Y. is a leader of this group. Asylkul has been doing farming for the past sixteen years as well as raising six daughters. Her oldest daughters help her in any way they can and Asylkul is also able to do animal husbandry. Asylkul's husband helps her with this, who also works as a driver. Earlier her husband had some experience in agriculture. Asylkul has learned agriculture from his experience. At this time the oldest daughter is 22 years old and second oldest daughter is 20. The rest of her daughters go to school. Asylkul dreams about buying a house in Bishkek so that her daughters could get a higher education in the city. Right now Asylkul is 45 years old, she is full of life and wants her children to have a different life ahead. Asylkul very much hopes to receive this loan and invest it in fuel and potato seeds. Asylkul's group partners are: Toichubek T. is 43 years old. He is a member of the farmers union. Toichubek has four children. His wife has to work so that they can feed their family. They do farming together. Right now their children study in university and family's expenses are growing. Toichubek has asked for a loan to buy fuel. Anara Anurova is 33 years old. Anara's husband works as a director with one of the international development projects. Anara is a mother of two children. She is not the one who stays at home and waits for the husband to bring money home. Anara does agriculture. She has good experience of sixteen years. She did not want to wait for her husband to give her the necessary amount of money. She hopes to receive this loan to buy fuel. Mira B.-K. is 37 years old. Her husband works as an excavator driver and Mira works as a controller. Their salary is only enough to support the family, but is not enough for other expenses. Mira and her husband decided to start doing animal husbandry. Right now she needs a loan which will help them buy a cow.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fuel and seeds of potatoes for farming

loans.name: Mrs. Sim Un Village Bank Group

texts.en: Seventeen people make up this village bank loan and they are living in Angk Khlaeu village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sim U. is a village bank president, selected by all the members, who will use their loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare piece of land. On this land, she cultivates rice, which she later sels,l to support her family's costs of living. Her problem is that her rice field is on time to do farming but they did not have enough money to support the harvest. So, to improve production, Mrs. Sim U. is asking for a loan to do the farming this current year. Her husband, Mr. Saret Nget, is a construction laborer. She is a mother of a child who is enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To do farming.

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en:
Flordelisa T. is from the village of Magalalag, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 37 years old. Flordelisa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Flordelisa raises pigs for fattening and sale. Flordelisa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Flordelisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Flordelisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. Flordelisa is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Flordelisa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Mrs. Neang Son Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Neang S. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members who live in Preaek Touch village in Kandal province. This village bank loan has twelve people who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Neang S. and her husband, Mr. Ley Hor, are farmers who own a half-hectare piece of land to grow crops to sell in order to support their family's costs of living. Their problem is that their field is on time to plow but they did not have enough money to complete the harvest. So to improve production, Mrs. Neang S. is applying for a loan to hire a plowing machine to plow her field. She is the mother of a child who is studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To hire a plowing machine to plow her field.

loans.name: Kishwar's Group

texts.en:
Kishwar is a resident of the mid-sized city of Riwind, Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living there with her family for twenty-five years. Her husband's name is M. J. and he runs a grocery shop. He choose this business for two reasons: firstly, he had five years sales experience in a department store, and secondly, there was no local grocery store and people were going to the main market for groceries. He has been running his shop for three years and has built up a good reputation among his customers. 


Kishwar, who is a very talented lady, operates a bed-sheet selling business. She purchases bed-sheets from Lahore city at cheap rates and sells them in the local community and also in the market. This business helps her to share the financial burden with her husband.

  
Kishwar is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest capital in her own business so that she can purchase bed-sheets in bulk and increase profits.

loans.use: to purchase bed-sheets in bulk to sell

loans.name: Marivic Bullecer Group

texts.en:
Marivic B. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 52 years old. Marivic is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marivic is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Marivic owns & operates a manufacturing business. She manufactures & sells wood products to local businesses and community members. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2002, Marivic joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in renovating the business. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & towards working capital. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Marivic from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen T. N. was born in 1983. She lives in Dong Anh town. She is married with two children (a girl and a boy), who are still young. She not only grows rice but also raises pigs to scratch out a living. Her husband is a worker in Bac Thang Long industrial Park. They have a monthly income of about 5.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and has repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 70194.000 VND to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs

loans.name: Alejandra Cahilog Group

texts.en:
Alejandra A C. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 63 years old. Alejandra A is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Alejandra A is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Alejandra A owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Alejandra A has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Alejandra A joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Alejandra A has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Alejandra A is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 12th loan taken out by Alejandra A from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia S. is 56 and a happy person who enjoys life, especially since she joined ASHI in 2009. Apart from being able to receive a loan through ASHI, the opportunity to meet and interact with other members is what she enjoys the most. Married to a farmer, life is never easy because farming requires a huge amount of capital for maintenance and sustainability. Aside from the finances needed by the business she supports the family of her child, who is also poor. Despite that, Alicia is happy because her family members never stop loving and cooperating with one another to rise above poverty. Through a loan from ASHI, Alicia is the one who supports her husband’s sugar-cane farming business. Her son helps her husband in farming. Once sugar cane is harvested, her husband and son will have it processed to produce a muscovado (red) sugar. Alicia sells this bio-organic and natural sugar per kilo in the market. Proceeds are used to support her family and some will be re-invested to the business in addition to the loan she requests.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and hire laborers to cultivate the soil and plant sugar cane.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah C. is from the village of Magalalag, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 33 years old. Sarah is married and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Sarah owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Sarah has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. Sarah said the income earned in the business is of great help in supporting their daily needs.

In 2007, Sarah joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sarah has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. Sarah is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feeds and other supplies. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Sarah from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma is a resident of the mid-sized city of Riwind, Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living there, with her family, for over twelve years. Her husband's name is M. N. and he owns & operates a clothes selling business. He has been in this business for five years. He purchases clothes from different cities (Lahore, Peshawar and Faisalabad) and sells them in the local community. He goes to different areas of the community on his four-wheeled cart which he uses to sell his clothes.

  
Salma is a very caring lady and stays at home to manage the household chores and take care of her family. She also helps her husband in his business by selling clothes to her neighbors.  


Salma is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest capital in her husband’s business so that he can purchases clothes in bulk to sell to the cloth shops and increase his profits.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Vann Bou Village Bank Group

texts.en: The fifteen people, who make up this bank loan group, live in PreA. Touch village in Kandal province. Mrs. Vann B. is the group's president, selected by all the members who will use a loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Dork Bouv, are farmers who own three and a half hectares of land to grow crops to sell to support their family. Their field is ready to plow so Mrs. Vann B. is applying for a loan to rent a plowing machine to plow her field. She is the mother of four children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory, two help their parents with the farm, and the fourth is attending local public school.

loans.use: To rent a plow to plow her field

loans.name: Mabelle Lanticse Group

texts.en:
Mabelle is 23 years old and the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mabelle is married and has two very young children. Mabelle owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Mabelle has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Mabelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Mabelle is requesting a new loan, her 5th, of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital

loans.name: Zenaida Capisan Group

texts.en:
Zenaida C. is from the village of Tipolo. She is 55 years old and the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Zenaida is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Zenaida has been involved in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2002, Zenaida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Zenaida is requesting a new loan, her 13th, of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital

loans.name: Rosa Gonzaga Group

texts.en:
Rosa G. is from the village of Mamanga Daku. She is 51 years old and the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosa is married and has 4 adult-aged children. She owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily snacks and other delicacies, in the local community. Rosa has been involved in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2004, Rosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Rosa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Tt50-1 Group

texts.en:
Thanh T. K. D. was born in 1983. She lives in Dong Anh town, Ha Noi. She is married and has a 6-year-old daughter. Mrs Thanh is a farmer. Her husband is a builder. Her family has a monthly income of about 5.000.000 vietnamdong (VND). She has a participated in SEDA since 2006 and has repaid punctually. She is the leader of a 2-member group loan in SEDA. The other member in her group loved and believed her. Last cycle, she borrowed 3.000.000 VND. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND to breed pigs.

 About the other borrower in her group :
Phich T. N. was born in 1958. She lives in Dong Anh town with her husband and her son. Her son is 28 years old. He has a job and has a monthly income. Her husband is a bricklayer. Her family has a monthly income of about 6.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has a participated in SEDA since 2006 and has repaid punctually. She wants to repair her kitchen and prepare for her son to marry. So, in this loan cycle, she needs 6.322.000 VND.

loans.use: to breed pigs

loans.name: Mrs. Sophea Chhorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nine people who live in Preaek Touch village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sophea C. is the village bank president selected by all the members, who will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Sophea C. is a housewife who cooks tasty food for her family and her husband, Mr. Sophorn Yorn, is a fisherman. Through this activity, the couple supports eight children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others attend the local public school. Although this family’s members work hard, they earn little income. To improve their family's living conditions, they want to start a new business but they do not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Sophea C. is requesting a loan to buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Beishebubu's Group

texts.en:
Rivalry and competition make people strive to be the best in their fields and professions. Weak people get afraid to lose their positions and begin to feel themselves psychologically backward or weaker than others. However, among ordinary people we can still find many examples of strong-willed people, who not only do not get afraid, but go into business with full enthusiasm and energy, and quickly grow in prosperity. Daily obstacles and life ordeals cannot prevent these people from achieving their goals as they are mature minded and know that after the darkness of night comes the light of the morning.


Beishebubu M. is the leader of this group. She is fifty eight and has two children. Her husband used to be a farmer. Beishebubu’s two sons are grown ups. The elder son is thirty five and the younger is thirty. Both of her sons make their own living independently. Beishebubu obtains her sons’ support. However, she prefers to stay independent and, using the skills she acquired from her husband, she decided to be a farmer. Now she is working in the field, sowing and planting vegetables in a piece of land. Beishebubu needs a loan to buy fuel for field works. 

Beishebubu’s partners:

Juzumkan A., 71, has a daughter. Her daughter lives in the capital. She and her husband still work. Both of them are farmers. Now is the time when they are busy every day sowing in the field. Juzumkan needs a loan to purchase fuel. 

Baktybek K., 59, has a son. Baktybek and his wife are farmers. They also raise some cattle. In the fall they plan to marry their son who is thirty five and still single. Baktybek hopes to obtain this loan and invest the funds in increasing their livestock population. 

Bermet J., 52, has a son. Bermet, her husband and son are engaged in farming. Bermet wants her son to become a big farmer, and therefore actively involves her son in all aspects of the work. These days the whole family is busy working in the field. Bermet needs a loan to buy fuel. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel, which is needed for the sowing process

loans.name: Sorm

texts.en: Mr. R. is a motorbike taxi driver who lives in a fallow village in the capital of Phnom Penh. He also assists his wife in the food sale business. R. and his wife are good parents who have two teenage kids who depend on their income. This rainy season, the family has a problem: their house is surrounded by polluted water which is affecting their health and their daily living conditions. R. wants to overcome this obstacle by asking for a loan to purchase a piece of land to resolve this bad situation.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land to resolve his current bad situation

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en:
Zeny T. is from the village of KINANGAY SUR CLARIN, MISAMIS OCCIDENTAL. She is 42 years old. Zeny is married and has 1 school-aged child. Zeny owns & operates a motor transport service. Zeny has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Zeny joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Zeny has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from GDMPC. Zeny is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Zeny from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en:
Chhuon T. is 62 years old and lives in Phnom Penh. She currently produces and sells natural medicine to earn a living. The medicine is made from many kinds of tree roots. Normally, she buys the root from the people who carve from the forest. She then makes the medicine and sells it to patients. She earns an average of $4 per day and has been in this business for many years. 


Chhuon T. has three children; two of them are now married and the other one is single and works in a garment factory.  This is the third loan she has requested.  Chhuon T. will use this loan to buy a plot of land to resolve the issue of polluted water which is affecting her health and her daily living conditions. She will use the rest of the loan to mend her old house.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land to address the issue of polluted water

loans.name: Honaria Palangpangan Group

texts.en:
Honaria P. is from the village of Lawis Panalsalan. She is 57 years old and the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Honaria is married and has 2 adult-aged children. She owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. Honaria has been involved in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Honaria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Honaria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Honaria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Honaria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Remedios

The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2000, Remedios joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the 17th loan taken out by Remedios from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. loans.name: Sabrine

texts.en:
Sabrine is a 22-year-old wife and the mother of a two-year-old daughter. Sabrine is married to Ahmad Sadeq who is a Palestinian National Authority employee.

Sabrine and Ahmad are not a very fortunate couple, so their house has only the most basic amenities, but now that they have a two-year-old daughter, Sabrine thinks that a television is a need, especially for the little girl. Therefore, Sabrine came to FATEN and took a $500 loan to purchase a television. 

Sabrine's husband, Ahmad, appears in the picture, because Sabrine is not comfortable having her picture published online.

loans.use: Purchase a television

loans.name: Tonou Ene Meluan

texts.en:
Tonou Ene Meluan K. is 33 Years old. She is married to Kuaro Ole K. and is a mother of three children.

Tonou is a farmer and has been farming on her own piece of land for the last three years.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered members of KADET. This will be her first loan of which she is planning to spend 50,000 Shillings to buy chemicals and fertilizer for her ten acre wheat farm. She will use the other 20,000 Shillings to prepare the remaining five acres to plant more wheat. Wheat has been doing well in this area.

She hopes to use the profit from these activities to expand her farming activity from small scale to large scale commercial, and attain financial independence. 

She is a hard working woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizer for her ten acre wheat farm

loans.name: Ek

texts.en:
Ek S., 45, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, known as the most populated city in the country. He is a police officer and earns an income of about 15 USD per day. His wife is a grocery seller at home, earning an income of 5 USD per day to help cover the family expenses.  

S. has requested a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for his wife to transport groceries from the market. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to make repairs to his house. This is his third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport groceries

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga T. T. was born in 1980. She is married with two children who are still young. She is a farmer breeding pigs and poultry. Her husband is a driver. Sometimes she and her husband go to work together.

They have a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnam Dong (VND). They always try to work hard.

Since 2006, she has participated in SEDA and repaid punctually. For this loan, she wants to borrow 8,066,000 VND to repair her house.

010115500009

loans.use: To repair her house.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo S., 58, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated city in the country.

She sells fish for an income of about 2 USD per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and a fisherman, earning an income of 4 USD per day to help cover the family expenses.

S. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike for the family's use

loans.name: Nourn

texts.en:

M. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for  family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her fourth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
